jobTitle: Senior Consultant, Governance Job in Wellington - SEEK
experience: We think the best candidates will have 10+ years
jobText: TXT/50528247.txt	§Senior Consultant, Governance§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Consultant, Governance§§Advertiser: §Allen & Clarke Policy & Regulatory Specialists§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Other§§§§§§ §Be recognised as an expert in the provision of practical governance and Board level meeting management services§ §Use your tried and tested project management skills§ §Apply your people management knowhow§ §Work on a variety of projects, for a range of clients§ §Grow our Governance, Secretariat + Programmes Practice§ §Bring your 'can-do' attitude§ §Join a flexible, hard-working, and committed team§ §Help us to make a difference§.§ §Are you looking for a new challenge?  §Allen + Clarke§ needs someone with extensive experience supporting decision-makers to make the right calls. You may have led the provision of governance or meeting management services to advisory bodies like committees or Boards, managed complex projects from start to finish or implemented new policies or services. You need to be able to plan, lead and deliver all elements of high-quality secretariat services within a team environment. Identifying and chasing new opportunities energises you. You can work consciously across cultures and successfully engage with senior leaders and diverse communities with differing cultural, social, and political frameworks. This position is based at our Wellington office in The Woolstore in Thorndon.§  §Allen + Clarke §is a consultancy company that works with government, NGO and private sector clients on projects that matter. Our Governance, Secretariat + Programmes Practice works collaboratively with colleagues in our other Practices (Policy + Regulatory and Evaluation + Research). Our projects can be long or short term. They can be individual or team-based. Our people are flexible, hard-working and committed. They care and want to make a difference. They know how to work with pace. They never lose sight of quality. They are good at identifying opportunities, risks and issues and mitigating them to ensure success for our clients. §  §Come join us if you:§ § §love providing high-quality support to decision-makers (including governance and policy advice and/or meeting management services)§ §are energised by the thought of developing new business opportunities§ §enjoy people management and supporting teams to be the best they can be§ §enjoy delivering pragmatic solutions over multiple projects at one time§ §are comfortable with change and working in a fast-paced environment§ §have an ability to anticipate risks and the consequences of decisions and commitments§ §like networking and meeting new people and have experience in managing diverse relationships§ §have a strong client focus and enjoy working with organisations to identify and meet their needs, and§ §care and want to make a difference.§ §We think the best candidates will have 10+ years' experience in providing a wide range of governance and meeting management services in public or private sector organisations. Demonstrated experience in people management is essential.§  §If you have any questions or would like a copy of the position description, please contact Lizzie Johnsen on 021 594 780 or §recruitment@allenandclarke.co.nz§.§  §To apply, please email a covering letter and your CV to Lizzie at the above address.§  §Applications close at 9am Monday 28th September 2020.  Interviews are likely to be held in early October 2020.§  § §§§§

jobTitle: Strategy & Business Design - Associate Director Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50543826.txt	§Strategy & Business Design - Associate Director§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Strategy & Business Design - Associate Director§§Advertiser: §Deloitte - NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§ §Join an award-winning global consulting and implementation practice§ §Rapidly build your career alongside high-performing people§ §Be a trusted advisor to some of New Zealand’s most interesting clients§ § § §What will your typical day look like?§ §As an Associate Director within our Strategy and Business Design team you will play an active role in leading and coaching talented project teams, working on some of our client’s most complex and pressing issues.§ §You will be working with client executives across a wide range of exciting organisations as a trusted advisor to address their challenges and bring innovative solutions to their most difficult strategic issues. Working collaboratively is a core value practiced every day.§ §You will be responsible for managing engagements, providing our clients with the insights and solutions they need to grow, improve performance and create sustainable competitive advantage. You will help clients take advantage of the many opportunities to be digitally enabled and impactful on the local and world stage.§ §As well as guiding your team on the day to day delivery of outcomes for clients, you will also contribute commercially by developing deep client relationships, identifying opportunities and selling additional client work.§ §The broad nature of our client base means you will have the opportunity to gain exposure to a range of industries and sectors, and a broad spectrum of complex challenges. We are committed to learning and development, and Directors and Partners will support your development and provide coaching, guidance and direction.§ §We are a fun, caring and inclusive team who value people’s individual aspirations and connection to our purpose – to make an impact that matters.§ §You are someone with:§ § §8+ years demonstrated experience, managing and delivering strategy development and execution, ideally with significant experience working in a Consulting environment.§ §Experience in developing and executing corporate and business unit strategy§ §Experience in developing and driving growth and digital strategies or transformations, or in M&A strategy and corporate development including post-merger integrations and separations§ §Ability to understand client issues and pull together the right cross-functional team to meet these challenges head-on.§ §Experience and passion for directing, developing and mentoring a diverse and inclusive team, you enjoy seeing newer practitioners grow and develop.§ §Strong quantitative and analysis skills, able to uncover the heart of problems, identify root causes, offer clear solutions and drive change.§ §Ability to communicate, present and contextualise complex ideas concisely and accurately while adjusting style and tone to suit your audience.§ §Proven business development experience, from lead generation and leading bid management through to the delivery of client engagements.§ §The opportunity:§ § §If you have what it takes as a consulting professional, leader and practice-builder, we can promise opportunities to grow your career in a culture that develops, challenges, innovates and inspires.§ §We will offer you training and career development that keeps our consulting team at the top of its game. You will be rewarded with a competitive salary, city car park, healthcare, bonus and a range of Associate Director benefits that you would expect from one of the world's leading professional services brands.§ §About the team:§ § §We are a rapidly growing team based in Auckland, Wellington and Christchurch. We are currently looking for talented people to join our Auckland office. Our people have widely varied backgrounds but are united by a passion for creating a lasting impact for our clients.§ §At Deloitte, the success of our business is founded on recruiting the best people who share our values and relish the opportunity to embrace change, making a difference on every engagement.§ §We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture, and we are investing in growing the representation of women, LGBTQ+, Māori and Pacific people in our leadership roles. § §Sound like the sort of role for you? Apply now.§ §Please note: you must be based and legally entitled to work in New Zealand from the time of application to be considered.§ §If you have any questions or wish to have a confidential conversation about this role, contact Gracie Wang from the People & Performance team on §093030775§. We would love to hear from you!§§§§

It will prepare our city for up to 80,000 more people over the next 30 years. To make this happen, we need talented people who share our passion for Wellington and aspire to excellence in urban planning.§You will be joining a dynamic team of professionals involved in the development of a 30-year spatial plan for Wellington City and be part of the full review of the District Plan. You will be a team player who contributes to a positive, can-do culture within the Place Planning Team and the wider business unit. In return, we can offer you a collegial and flexible working environment with stimulating and rewarding work in Absolutely Positively Wellington, Smart Capital.§We also offer;§5 weeks annual leave after 2 years of continuous service for permanent staff§Flexible working arrangements§family leave provisions and a generously subsidised kid's school holiday programme.§Our services and projects are diverse and relate to all aspects of life in the city. We offer a wide range of careers, the chance to work with fantastic people, and many training and development opportunities.§Join us in making a positive difference - shape your own future, while contributing to the future of Wellington. If this opportunity is something that you are interested in, please make an application online. To submit an application and/or to the view the position description please click the apply button.§You are welcome to get in touch with John McSweeney, Place Planning Manager at §john.mcsweeney@wcc.govt.nz§ if you have any further questions. Applications for this role will close §11 October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

We're really looking for someone who has great coaching skills (can help self-service), who can coach and provide suitable collateral, learning aids to enable people to help themselves and enable change in the future.§An average week would see you immersed in the squads, participate in ceremonies, building relationships with key people in the delivery sides, dealing with other change managers, internal units and the people who will service the customers.§Personal Attributes§        §          §Proactive§          §Resilient and open to learning / iterating  §          §Collaborative – love to work in team and co-problem solve §          §People oriented - care and empathy§          §Smart thinking and ability to analyse/ problem solve§        § §Skills§        §          §Relational skills – stakeholder engagement and management including influencing and being assertive (to challenge constructively when required) §          §Facilitation skills - able to help a group to work through an topic for discussion/problem and move them towards an outcome/solution§          §Gets things done: Organised/ Able to prioritise / adaptability and ability to pivot with nimbleness across 'different worlds'§          §Ability to manage multiple (often conflicting) demands and prioritise work§          §Coaching skills - to help people self-serve and to help them develop capability§        § You'll join an organisation on the cutting edge of digital transformation, stepping up in agile, cross functional teams working collaboratively who are working better and faster to meet the needs of their customers. It's an opportunity for you to put your stamp on what the future might look like as well as joining a team that is looking to raise the level of change management to an international level, so lots to learn and grow with.§      §      §Stephen§0224643644§ §    §  §§§We're looking for a §Change Manager§ with §banking experience§ to take an exciting permanent position within a large bank based in the CBD. §You will be supporting the receivers of change coming from the delivery engine working on product and process change. §We're looking for someone who has worked in an §agile§ environment and come from the §banking§ world.§We're looking for someone who is a change manager through and through and has worked exclusively in change management roles in the past, someone who is extremely good at their craft but not too concerned with doing it their own way, someone who is open to feedback and learning, §very collaborative§ and happy to co-create with stakeholders. We're really looking for someone who has great coaching skills (can help self-service), who can coach and provide suitable collateral, learning aids to enable people to help themselves and enable change in the future.§An average week would see you immersed in the squads, participate in ceremonies, building relationships with key people in the delivery sides, dealing with other change managers, internal units and the people who will service the customers.§Personal Attributes§ § §Proactive§ §Resilient and open to learning / iterating  § §Collaborative – love to work in team and co-problem solve § §People oriented - care and empathy§ §Smart thinking and ability to analyse/ problem solve§ § §Skills§ § §Relational skills – stakeholder engagement and management including influencing and being assertive (to challenge constructively when required) § §Facilitation skills - able to help a group to work through an topic for discussion/problem and move them towards an outcome/solution§ §Gets things done: Organised/ Able to prioritise / adaptability and ability to pivot with nimbleness across 'different worlds'§ §Ability to manage multiple (often conflicting) demands and prioritise work§ §Coaching skills - to help people self-serve and to help them develop capability§ § You'll join an organisation on the cutting edge of digital transformation, stepping up in agile, cross functional teams working collaboratively who are working better and faster to meet the needs of their customers. It's an opportunity for you to put your stamp on what the future might look like as well as joining a team that is looking to raise the level of change management to an international level, so lots to learn and grow with.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50560269.txt	§Superstar Business Coach - Your Opportunity in an Unusual Industry§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Superstar Business Coach - Your Opportunity in an Unusual Industry§§Advertiser: §Tony Fraser-Jones§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Salary§§$100,000 - $119,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Other§§§§§§Over the last few years our business has grown by 50% plus year-on-year and we need a Coaching Superstar so we can help more clients succeed with their businesses.§  §Profitable Tradie is a NZ based Business Coaching company with an international reputation for making a difference in the lives of the owners of plumbing, electrical and similar construction-based service businesses across New Zealand, Australia, and North America.§  §Our mission is to turn great tradespeople into great business owners!!! §  §If you’re keen for a fresh challenge, want to push your boundaries and grow not only your earning potential, but yourself as a person and want to be part of a team of energetic, like minded high achievers then we should talk.§  §Fun, energy and a willingness to learn is part of the deal. You’ll be a connector but also a person who focuses on results. To be clear, that means you know how to get alongside people and demonstrate empathy, but you can also deliver the message in a “pull no punches” manner when needed 😉. §  §So, what does a Coach in a Business Coaching company for Tradies do? §  §First, our clients are the owners of established plumbing, electrical and similar construction-based service businesses – typically between 4 and 60 employees.   §  §Your role will be to ensure our clients have a world class experience which results in them growing their profits, creating a better lifestyle for themselves and growing as a person (nobody can improve their business without improving themselves).§  §You’ll be a “doer” and a “designer.”§  §The “doing” involves presenting coaching webinars, one-on-one coaching sessions, creating coaching resources, monitoring client engagement and results, maintaining our online coaching portals and Facebook Groups.  You will step into a well-developed coaching system. §  §The “designing” involves a relentless focus on how we can improve our coaching systems to help our clients win even quicker.  You’ll be amped to identify and implement business improvement projects. §  §Although the role does not have any direct reports initially, our growth plans see you building a coaching team in the future. §  §Your role comes with a strong remuneration package made up of a base salary plus performance bonuses.§  §We’ve found the key to your success in our world is “fit” with our company values. Most businesses talk values, but it’s all talk. We walk the talk.§  §You’ll possess a strong sense of self-confidence (but in a humble and modest way 😊) meaning you are sure of your ability to succeed.§  §You bring energy, relentless positivity, and an above the line attitude to work every day. In other words, no excuses and total accountability for your results.§  §You connect quickly with people, are fun to hang out with and you make everyone around you feel good about their experience with you – most importantly your teammates!    §  §We may be a based in little ol’ NZ, but you’ll vibe with being part of a world class operation.   §  §And if you love learning, podcasts, audio books and reading about business and personal development, we’re the mothership you’ve been looking for.§  §Plus, you bring strong business acumen and an understanding of how a business works (things like gross profit, margins, profit and loss and managing teams are second nature).§  §Oh, and strength in personal communication is crucial. Preferably in small to medium business settings. You may even have experience with coaching or training in the past and/or have an affinity with the construction industry.  §  §The role is primarily based at our office in Hamilton but there is potential to work remotely for one or two days per week.§  §My role as the founder and CEO is to recruit the best talent. If this sounds like you, apply now. There is only one opportunity.§  §Apply today by sending your §CV§ and a §video presentation§ (no more than 4 minutes) where you answer the following question: “What Does It Take to Create a Successful Business?”§  §Check out our website at www.profitabletradie.com or Facebook https://www.facebook.com/profitabletradie/§  §Life is about moments…is this your moment?§ §  §Send your application to §jo@profitabletradie.com§  §Applications close at 4pm on Friday 9 October 2020.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50564365.txt	§Data Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Data Analyst§§Advertiser: §Springboard Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§About Us§ §Springboard Trust is a unique charitable trust within the education sector, working to assist educational leaders enhance student achievement by strengthening strategic leadership capability in schools. This is achieved through capacity building amongst school leaders and providing them with access to cross-sector expertise drawn from New Zealand’s public, private and philanthropic communities.§ §About the Role§ §We have a new opportunity for a Data Analyst to work across our organisation to support us in our goal to continue to be an evidence based and data-driven organisation. The Analyst will be responsible for the accurate collection and analysis of data, with a view to develop skills in interpretation of data under the guidance of our Head of Evaluation & Research. § §In this role, the Analyst will support the development of Springboard evaluation systems, understanding the technical requirements and providing analysis and evaluation. This work will contribute to decisions across our services, funding and programmes to positively impact on school leaders and their learning communities. § §Ideally you will have basic experience as a Data Analyst, and an understanding of statistics.   You will need to be able to accurately collate, analyse and interpret data, be an excellent communicator and be both clear and succinct in report writing and presenting results. Being a team player and passionate about helping your colleagues is the key to your success in this role.  § §Responsibilities include:§ § §Data collection and Analysis:§ Support data integrity across the organisation, support the development of systems and strategies that optimise reporting efficiency and quality.§ §Evaluation and insights:§ Support the provision of programme and services evaluation through agreed robust and reliable data collection methods with a focus on continuous improvement.§ §Reporting:§ Provide data at an organisational level for the purpose of organisational governance and supporting the development and production of quarterly and annual reports (internal and external).§ §Ideal Experience and Qualifications:§ § §Analytical skills with the ability to accurately collect, analyse and interpret data§ §Strong communications skills, report writing and presenting findings§ §A working knowledge of  Microsoft Power BI, Power Query for Excel, Microsoft Office 365 Suite, statistical packages for analysing datasets, survey platforms. § §Experience working both independently & collaboratively within a team, with diverse roles and responsibilities§ §Good relationship management and customer service skills§ §A good sense of humour and able to work at times under pressure to achieve agreed deadlines§ §Take pride in attention to detail and getting stuff sorted§ §Experience with SPSS and knowledge about education trends in New Zealand and internationally is an advantage.§ §Location§ §This role is location-agnostic, while our office is situated in Onehunga, Auckland, our team is spread throughout the country. If you are comfortable working from home, with travel to Auckland or Waikato when required, then we welcome you to apply.§ §If you are looking for a new opportunity where you have the chance to add to your skill set, we look forward to hearing from you.  Please lodge your cover letter and C.V. via SEEK.  If you wish to learn more about the role please call Claire on §0275371825§ Monday - Wednesday.§ § § §Applications close Thursday 8th October. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a data analyst?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50574410.txt	§SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY LEAD§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY LEAD§§Advertiser: §Pohlen Partners§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§Lead and deliver world-class social and community initiatives for a significant New Zealand business.§  § §Overview§ §Kiwi Property is a leader in their industry and a New Zealand success story. With a sustainability focus 16 years strong, the team are the lively, enthusiastic and the best in the business. They constantly push the boundaries to achieve great results and are seeking an equally motivated social sustainability expert to collaboratively deliver on strategies. This role needs broad expertise to move forward their sustainable practices, with a specific focus within social sustainability practices.§ § §Position§ §Reporting to the National Facilities Manager, this role is responsible for supporting the leadership team in implementing initiatives through the collaborative engagement of key stakeholders. Building on an already strong culture of sustainability, this requires someone who can enable the wider team to implement projects which align to the long-term strategies already in place. Whilst a tactical role, involvement in ongoing strategic planning will require working with the leadership team to ensure future initiatives are integrated into the business plans. Key to this role is the command of sustainability reviews, reporting and internal audits, embedding and executing within the frameworks of GRI, TCFD and CDP standards. The business is a result focused and has a fast-paced environment, where initiatives reflect global trends and industry changes to develop on their current state. § § §Person§ You bring substantial knowledge and experience in leading and delivering world class social sustainability projects in complex businesses. Your exceptional interpersonal skills, including effective relationship building, will allow you to influence with ease creating successful partnerships internally and externally. With the ability to drive important projects and outcomes, you will be motivated by contributing to positive change in our community.§    §Career Opportunity§This position offers a stimulating career opportunity for a sustainability leader to influence a diverse, sizeable, and growing business making a huge impact on the future of sustainability in New Zealand.§ § §To apply send your application directly to us, via the application link.§   § §Your application may be discussed with our client unless otherwise requested.§ Applicants should be in New Zealand and hold a current work visa / residency or NZ citizenship.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50580346.txt	§Experienced Planner, Delivery Lead (Wellington)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Experienced Planner, Delivery Lead (Wellington)§§Advertiser: §Beca§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Experienced Planner, Delivery Lead (Wellington) §      §        §§        §Experienced Planner, Delivery Lead (Wellington)§        §          §Shape the Wellington region, providing strategic planning consultancy services to ‘make everyday better’§          §Make an impact delivering transformational planning projects improving transport, city growth planning and natural hazard resilience§          §Develop your career working with, learning from, and being mentored by, industry leaders in a fun and collaborative culture§        §        §The opportunity | Te kāinga rua§        §Make an impact in this planning delivery role where you will take the lead working with our clients who are doing incredible things every day. You will play a senior role across our Wellington planning and environmental team where you will be delivering community shaping projects across Wellington and the surrounding regions.§        §You will be joining a team that is known locally for our ability to provide high quality planning and environmental consulting advice. We lead projects of all sizes for a diverse group of clients and work as an integrated team of 120 planners and environmental scientists across the country.§        §We are looking for a high performing professional with a real passion for planning who is motivated to deliver for our clients, with a collaborative, team based, and people focused mindset. We are looking for a savvy, innovative and commercially minded professional with a collaborative approach who is motivated to be part of, and strengthen, our growing planning and environmental business.§        §You will need to have a thorough knowledge of the Resource Management Act 1991, with strengths in statutory and strategic planning. You will have a tertiary qualification in planning and / or resource management and be a full member of the NZPI or working towards this. We have flexibility to shape the role around you, depending on your level of experience.§        §Apply now§        §To apply for this role, please follow the online instructions. Throughout this year, we will celebrate our innovators, our thinkers, our explorers and our entrepreneurs; past, present and future.§        §We are a team of 3,300-plus who brings a wide range of perspectives and expertise to every client and challenge, creating resourceful, smart solutions from our collective experience and insights.§        §While our experience has been 100 years in the making, it’s the fresh talent we’re nurturing, the innovative thinking we’re developing and the connections that we’re forging that gets us most excited for the future. We lead projects of all sizes for a diverse group of clients and work as an integrated team of 120 planners and environmental scientists across the country.§We are looking for a high performing professional with a real passion for planning who is motivated to deliver for our clients, with a collaborative, team based, and people focused mindset. jobText: TXT/50588000.txt	§Graduate Consultant Opportunitites§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Graduate Consultant Opportunitites§§Advertiser: §Allen & Clarke Policy & Regulatory Specialists§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§We are looking for motivated Graduates to join our fast-paced consultancy firm in Wellington§ §Allen + Clarke§ is a Wellington and Melbourne based consultancy company that provides policy and regulatory advice, business change, research and evaluation, and governance, secretariat and programme support services to government, private sector and not-for-profit clients in New Zealand, Australia, the Pacific and Asia.  We are well-recognised as a policy leader: our clients come to us for trusted advice on a wide range of issues.  You can find out more about us at www.allenandclarke.co.nz.§ §We are looking for motivated Graduates to take on a role that:§ § §includes a diverse range of work§ §provides opportunities to learn and develop, and§ §is busy and constantly changing.§ §We work hard and fast to meet our clients’ needs by delivering excellent products. They appreciate our creative and challenging approach and have confidence in our proven ability to deliver practical solutions to their issues. Our local and global experience makes us a business partner of choice for many public sector agencies. Our projects can be long or short term. They can be individual or team-based. They may involve working in-house with our clients or at our offices. § §Allen + Clarke§ provides a collegial environment. We invest in our people and support them to grow their policy, regulation, research, evaluation, governance, secretariat, and project management skills. Our people are flexible, hardworking, and committed. They know how to work with pace and enjoy working on multiple streams of work without dropping the ball. They are good at identifying opportunities, risks and issues and mitigating them to ensure a project’s success. Our people enjoy working within a team environment that also offers scope for autonomy. They have great relationship management skills and work comfortably with a wide range of people including our clients. § §We are looking for Graduates who have these skills. Applicants will need to demonstrate:§ § §awareness of work in the following areas: § §policy and regulatory§ §governance, secretariat and programme support and/or§ §research and evaluation§ § § §ability to self-manage and to manage multiple pieces of work at the same time§ §ability to work successfully within, and make a contribution to, a team, and§ §an awareness of kaupapa Māori principles.§ §To apply for this position please email your CV and a brief cover letter to §recruitment@allenandclarke.co.nz§. Additionally, we ask all applicants to answer the following questions in a separate document and attach it to their application.§ §Please answer the following questions, in 200 words or less:§ § §Why are you interested in working for §Allen + Clarke?§ §What you will bring to §Allen + Clarke §from your life or work experience?§ §What do you bring to working as part of a team?§ §If you have any questions, please contact Lizzie Johnsen on 021 594 780 or §recruitment@allenandclarke.co.nz§.§ §The roles are Wellington based and will start at the end of January 2021§ §All applicants for this position must have the right to work in New Zealand.§ §Applications close 5pm Friday the 9th of October§§§§

jobText: TXT/50592169.txt	§Portfolio Change Lead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Portfolio Change Lead§§Advertiser: §H2R Consulting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §        §Portfolio Change Lead §        §          §We are looking for a senior, specialist, change professional with extensive experience in change leadership and delivery including transformational, operational and business change. You will have deep experience in all aspects of business change management, having worked in the change profession / discipline over several years, ideally experienced in transformational change. This is a strategic change leadership and management role, you will have the ability to think and work strategically and display evidence of whole-of-system thinking and successful change management outcomes over your career, building organisational change maturity and capability. You will have executive presence / mana / credibility and political acumen, being able to influence and coach senior leaders in leading change effectively. You will have a track record in creating and leading high-performing teams, you will be building a cohesive and high performing team of change practitioners, lifting capability in both technical change management skills and soft skills and ensuring quality work is being produced. §          §To apply for this position, hit the Apply Now button or visit www.h2r.co.nz and refer to vacancy no. 26339. jobText: TXT/50592826.txt	§Put Your Wisdom To Work - Business Coach, Board Facilitator, Business Owner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Put Your Wisdom To Work - Business Coach, Board Facilitator, Business Owner§§Advertiser: §The Alternative Board§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§ § §Are you an experienced business person ready to use your accumulated wisdom to help and empower other business owners in our COVID19 world?§  § § §Are you an exceptional leader able to act as a catalyst for change?§  § § §Are you currently employed, recently redundant, or a returning Kiwi ready to reinvent your future?§  § § §If this sounds like you - we should talk.§  § § §  §The Alternative Board is looking for wise, motivated business leaders in the Otago region to deliver our proven package of business owner advisory boards, one-to-one coaching, and our Business Builders’ Blueprint©.§  §As you would expect, our boards and facilitators have been exceptionally busy this year as our members navigate the challenging tides of 2020 – which means we need to expand our services to provide the help, guidance, and support that Otago business owners in the small-to-medium enterprise sector need right now.§  §As a franchise business owner with The Alternative Board, you will have the opportunity to be in business for yourself, but not by yourself – we help and support you so you can help and support our members. Since 1990, we have helped over 20,000 business owners around the world achieve their personal and professional goals through monthly business advisory boards and coaching.§  §If you believe you can help business owners in Otago thrive and grow through uncertain times, we should have a discussion.§  §Find out more about The Alternative Board at §https://bit.ly/wisdomtowork§ and, when you’re ready to talk, click the 'APPLY' button and send your CV with a covering letter that tells us how your wisdom and experience will make a difference.§  § §§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years of business management experience do you have?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50597469.txt	§Principal Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Principal Analyst§§Advertiser: §NZ Transport Agency§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Principal Analyst §    §    §      §        §§        §          §Mix of operational and strategic activities§          §Bring your strong coding experience§          §Be part of a high performing and supportive team§          §Wellington location§        §        § § §About us | §Ko wai mātou§        §At Waka Kotahi, the NZ Transport Agency, it all starts with our people. The organisation's performance and success depends on the people who choose to make this a great place to work and make a difference for Aotearoa. The Transport Agency has a strong future focus, understanding that new technologies and changing customer expectations mean the transport system we know today will not be the one we deliver in ten years time.§        §The Corporate Support Group underpins everything the Agency does.  They are an enabler, an advisor and the people who keep the Agency safe. Corporate Support includes Finance, Legal, Risk and Assurance, Research and Analytics, Procurement, and Enterprise Change. For the Agency to be successful, Corporate Support needs to deliver quality services efficiently.§        §As well as stimulating work, we offer a range of benefits including ongoing professional development, the opportunity to work flexibly (within our operational requirements), 4 weeks annual leave, subsidised health insurance, and an active social club.   For more information check out :§https://www.nzta.govt.nz/careers/our-benefits/§        §The opportunity | Te Whiwhinga mahi§        §This is a great opportunity for you to use your strong coding skills and focus working with large complex sets of data.This role has a great mix of both hands-on data analysis and strategic focus, so you will be comfortable with being operational as well as providing the big picture view.  §        §As Principal Analyst (Data) you will lead data analytics projects and be a trusted advisor, providing specialist data and analytical expertise to leaders and teams across Waka Kotahi.  You will positively influence Waka Kotahi's strategic objectives by contributing to the provision of high quality, well researched and reasoned data and statistical analysis. You will be a senior technical leader in the specialist Data Services team, which is part of the wider Research and Analytics team.§        §You will support the continuous improvement of data and analytics processes, practices, and products, and you will work to increase the team's data and analytics maturity. You will play a key role in identifying opportunities to use data analysis more widely and more effectively throughout the Agency.§        §With your highly developed communication and relationship building skills, you will develop key relationships both externally and internally to position the team as a strategic partner.§        §You will also support the continuous improvement of data and analytics processes, practices, and products, and you will work to increase the team's data and analytics maturity and play an important role in identifying opportunities to use data analysis more effectively throughout the Agency.§        §It will also be key for you to maintain a good understanding of developments in the field of data and analytics and, in particular, its use in the public sector.§        § §        §About you | §Ko koe tēnei§        §To be successful in this role, you will bring:§        §          §Significant experience in a similar role, working at a senior level in an analytical environment undertaking complex data queries from multiple data bases flexibly§          §Proven experience in coding and using large complex data sets§          §Solid experience in data manipulation and analysis, and turning raw data into valuable and relevant intelligence and insights§          §Sound understanding of Government Open Data initiatives§          §Thorough understanding of the principals of the Official Information and Privacy Acts.§          §Advanced level of computing skill including the use of SQL and R (or similar analytical tool)§          §Experience in mentoring and coaching other analysts§          §A relevant graduate qualification in the statistics, or similar discipline requiring the analysis of complex data is preferred§        §        §Applications close | §Rā Katinga: 12 October 2020§        §For a copy of the position description: §www.nzta.govt.nz/careers§        §For further information, email: §careers@nzta.govt.nz§ At WSP our role is to plan, design, manage and engineer our communities to thrive. We want our work to bring long-term improvements and to future proof our cities and environments.§The Role:§Needed is a Principal Planner for our busy Tauranga office, to assist our clients in creating what matters for future generations. The successful candidate will build on the future ready insights work that WSP has already completed locally, which helps us to better understand our clients and communities. §You will deliver principal level planning and engagement services to a high standard on projects of local, regional and national significance, and contribute to thought leadership in spatial planning and integrated land use and infrastructure provision. In addition, you will provide technical leadership across the core areas of statutory planning under the Resource Management Act, improving the technical health of the planning discipline across the business. §This is an exciting opportunity to take on a varied and challenging role in a fantastic location. Tauranga means ‘the place of rest or anchorage,’ and along with the surrounding Western Bay of Plenty sub-region has experienced significant growth in recent years.  Tauranga offers cosmopolitan city living right on the water’s edge, and is the ideal spot for those who love the outdoors and value a work-life balance. strategic plans, to accelerate client’s growth in revenue, § §Conduct workshops and strategy sessions with clients efficiently, to enable the delivery of strategy and/or digital campaigns§ §Manage jobText: TXT/50610350.txt	§Business Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Consultant§§Advertiser: §Business Success Partners South§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§Is it time for a change from the corporate world, or your current career or business? § §Take control of your own destiny and be rewarded for your efforts. § §About the role and opportunity§ §This is a unique opportunity to control your own income as part of a business consulting firm. The beauty of this model - §you work for yourself but not by yourself!§ §Most Business Owners are not trained to run a business. They have skills in their areas of technical expertise but often lack the overall business knowledge that ensures on-going growth, stability and the maximum profitability of their businesses.§ §This is where §Business Success Partners§ comes in. Our team is trained to sit alongside business owners helping them to manage their businesses more effectively. We have tools and processes to apply to any business to capture more profits, better growth and higher value in the business.§ §Skills and Experience§ §We are looking for people to join our growing network across the South Island to assist Business Owners in §Christchurch§ and the §Canterbury region.§ A major bonus is that you can be based, and work from, anywhere in the region.§ §Some key leadership competencies and skills you will need are:§ § §A good general business knowledge§ §To show confidence and leadership§ §To have strong commercial acumen§ §To be able to back yourself with intelligence and practicality§ §To have empathy and the ability to be a good listener§ §Benefits and Culture§ §This is an opportunity to own your own lifestyle with an excellent income to match. You will be provided with intensive training, supported by very good business systems, consulting tools and client acquisition processes to help locate and serve your potential clients and give you every opportunity to build a very rewarding income.§ §This is a unique opportunity to build your own portfolio of clients whilst working alongside a highly experienced 20 strong Consultancy Team who can provide day-to-day support and mentoring.§ §Please only reply to this opportunity if you are a New Zealand Resident, are serious about building your own portfolio of clients and have what it takes to do so. If you are motivated and passionate about business, and have an in-built desire to help Business Owners while creating a rewarding income and lifestyle for yourself - then this is the opportunity for you.§ §When inquiring please include contact details (including a cell phone number) and a summary of why you are interested in working with us. An up-to-date CV would be helpful. All enquiries will be answered,§ §All the best!§ §"It has long come to my attention that people of accomplishment rarely sit back and let things happen to them. They go out and happen to things."§ §- Leonardo da Vinci§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a consulting role?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§How many years of business management experience do you have?§§§

jobTitle: Economic Development Manager Job in Hawkes Bay - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50616115.txt	§Economic Development Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Economic Development Manager§§Advertiser: §Populous People§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Napier§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§This newly created role reflects Napier City Council’s determination to see Napier thrive and prosper right across its community. We are looking for an astute commercial thinker with a strong mix of engagement and analytical skills to analyse, determine and report on the pulse of economic activity and commercial opportunities for Napier.§ § §Reporting to the Director of City Strategy, this Economic Development Manger role will help underpin future business growth in Napier and the city surrounds. You will be working with a wide base of stakeholders, including other economic development partners and managers throughout the region, as well as Napier City Council’s research and data partners. This is a key partnership role that will see you involved in a wide range of initiatives. Your purpose here will be to take the lead role in economic research projects, creating industry overviews, and helping ensure the delivery of customised analytics for businesses interested in further growing or establishing operations in Napier.§ § §We are looking for someone with a strong commercial orientation. You must be tertiary qualified and understand how businesses tick, and you must have a brain that enables you to analyse and assess at the granular level.  A critical element of the role will be the ability to translate data and research into compelling presentations, interactive dashboards, and effective marketing materials. You will be someone who is able to connect to the business leaders and influencers, build relationships and then dive deep into the research and data analysis.§ § §This is all about ensuring the ongoing vibrancy and further development of Napier. If you have the commercial drive and analytical bent, and you feel philosophically aligned to the idea that your work will be all about being a conduit in this local economy then please apply through this seek.co.nz portal.§ § §If you would like to learn more before submitting your application, please telephone Rachel Cornwall on §0272 565620§ to learn more.  § § §Please note, only candidates who are have full NZ working rights will be eligible for this role.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50621076.txt	§Project Manager Māori Health Equity§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Project Manager Māori Health Equity§§Advertiser: §NoRTH - A division of Northern Regional Alliance Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Project Manager Māori Health Equity §      §        §        §Pou Whakahaere Mana Taurite§ §He Hononga o te Raki §Northern Regional Alliance§  §Nāu te rourou, nāku te rourou, ka ora ai te iwi§ § §Te Tākinatanga: Our story§        §Our Northern Region (Tāmaki Makaurau and Tai Tokerau) healthcare leaders are committed to delivering collaborative and innovative change. We have government agreement to our vision for healthcare transformation for the next 20 years. Now we are moving into the next phase; scaling up our collaboration to further improve health services for patients and whānau with a focus on health equity.§  §You can read the Northern Region Long Term Health Plan §§here§  §Greater focus on Māori health equity is central to this transformation and that’s where this exciting role comes in. Health sector experience is desirable but not essential as you will work closely with health leaders.§   §We’re looking for someone remarkable. If you think this could be you, apply now. jobText: TXT/50633474.txt	§Policy and Strategy Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Policy and Strategy Manager§§Advertiser: §people&co.§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§Take your policy career to the next level§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§The Horizons Region extends over 22,200km2 - from Ruapehu in the north and Horowhenua in the south, to Whanganui in the west and Tararua in the east. It's a landscape as rich and varied as the over 240,000 people who call it home. At Horizons Regional Council we work to make our region a great place to live, work and play. §  §We are looking for a Manager Policy and Strategy who can confidently take a leadership role in policy and strategy development and monitoring. You will be skilled in working with councillors, communities and staff to refine policy, lead plan changes and evaluate effectiveness. You will be alert to new strategic opportunities as the region looks to grow its prosperity and sustainably manage its resources. §  §We are looking for an excellent communicator with a strong history of developing enduring and valuable relationships. As the successful applicant, you will have:§ § §A tertiary qualification and several years' experience at a senior level in planning or policy development and monitoring § §Experience working with the Resource Management Act, and knowledge of Treaty Settlement processes§ §Excellent stakeholder management skills § §Strong critical thinking skills.§ §This is a full time role, based in Palmerston North. In return, you'll work for a flexible family friendly organisation, with a strong focus on employee health and well being, within a supportive and social work environment. §  §Applications close at §5pm§ on §Sunday, 18 October 2020§.§  §If you are interested in the position please click the §APPLY NOW§ button.  All applications will be acknowledged electronically.§  §For further information contact §Jacaleen Williams§ on §(04) 931 9450§ or §Michele Walls§ on §(04) 931 9448§ quoting job number §19510§.§  §To be eligible to apply you must have the legal right to live and work in New Zealand and meet any entry requirements if you're outside the country.  For advice on obtaining a New Zealand work or residence visa and our entry requirements visit www.immigration.govt.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50633840.txt	§Technical Writer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Technical Writer§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Education§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§Fixed-term, full-time (one year or two years)§Wellington§Kia ora, Bula Vinaka, Fakaalofa lahi atu, Fakatalofa atu, Kia orana, Malo e lelei, Malo ni, Talofa lava, Tēnā koutou katoa and welcome.§Help shape the future of education§At the Ministry of Education, we work together to shape an education system that delivers equitable and excellent outcomes.§While we work in different groups and on different things, we all strive every day to make the biggest difference we can for every child, young person and adult student in our education system.§About the Early Learning and Student Achievement Group§At the heart of the work of the Early Learning and Student Achievement Group is making sure that every day, in every early learning service, kohanga reo, school, and kura, the education workforce and curriculum delivery is world class.§Secondary Tertiary is in the Early Learning and Student Achievement (ELSA) Group. It is responsible for setting the standards of NCEA qualifications that students study when they are at senior secondary school levels.§About this role§You will work within the Production House team which is a new team that is part of the Review of Achievement Standards (RAS) project. The RAS project is a key mechanism for achieving the objectives in the NCEA Change Programme. Through the RAS, NCEA Level 1, 2 and 3 standards will be developed that are consistent with the policy goal of having more foundational learning at NCEA Level 1, with more specialisation at Levels 2-3. There are currently over 1,000 achievement standards across NCEA.§The Production House team works alongside the Senior Secondary team, and other teams, in developing products for the RAS project alongside leaders from the education sector.§You will work alongside teachers and other stakeholders from the education sector to produce new standards and associated products for NCEA. You are responsible for providing technical (written) expertise so that high-quality written products are produced; and undertake analysis.§About you§Just like New Zealand, we want our teams to be diverse. All applicants are encouraged to apply. To be successful in the role, you'll be comfortable with becoming the technical expert in a group setting and key driver of product development behind the scenes in the Ministry, and at times with NZQA (our partner in the project).§Much of your production expertise can be expected to be developed on the job, as it relates to a new function and team being developed in the Ministry.§This would be a good entry position into a high profile government department with a great reputation. Prior experience in the education sector and/or in another government department would be desirable but not essential. Existing technical writers should apply but other people with skillsets like policy analysis should also consider this.§Prior experience in the education sector and/or in another government department would be desirable but not essential. Existing technical writers should apply but other people with skillsets like policy analysis should also consider this.§People who can think conceptually and produce documents to suit client and technical needs would do well in this role. You should be confident at discussing matters, undertaking research, performing analysis and presenting your contributions to small groups both internally in the Ministry and externally as part of the RAS project.§A familiarity with project based methodologies like PRINCE2 would be advantageous but not essential.§We offer the following:§Exciting opportunity to be part of a new team and function as it is built within a leading government department§Opportunities to develop within the team over the course of a major project over the next five years§As training needs are identified the team will receive additional support§The Ministry operates flexible working arrangements meaning that you could be working from home at times§Are you ready to make a difference?§We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds, including Maori, Pacific and those with disabilities, who will enrich our understanding of the education system.§The Ministry is committed to the Treaty of Waitangi including working for and with Maori education professionals, teachers; and students, their whanau, hapu and iwi.§To view this position in Te Reo please follow this link: §https://expressonline.haineslink.co.nz/pdfs/663151_JobDesc.pdf§If this opportunity sounds like you, please apply now using the 'apply online' button.§For further information, please contact the responsible Senior Manager: Simon Laube at §simon.laube@education.govt.nz§.§This recruitment process is for the formation of a new team so there are multiple roles to be filled. Please access the job application through the Ministry of Education Careers Centre.§Click here to view the role description§§Applications close Sunday 11 October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50638761.txt	§Senior Land Safety Forum Advisor, (Fixed Term)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Land Safety Forum Advisor, (Fixed Term)§§Advertiser: §Department of Conservation§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Senior Land Safety Forum Advisor, (Fixed Term) §        §          §We are looking for a motivated, strategic, and innovative stakeholder management specialist to break new ground in a role that works with others to reduce preventable search and rescue incidents across land in New Zealand.§          § §          §He angitūtanga: About the Role§          §The Senior Advisor - Land Safety Forum is a brand new role set up to establish and facilitate a cross-sector land safety forum. This forum is to be made up of the agencies and owners of the land that Search and Rescue (SAR) operations and other incidents occur on, organisations that represent outdoor users and the organisations that are involved in SAR prevention activities.§          §There is currently no coordination across the sector for land-based incidents and the purpose of the Land Safety Forum will be to work together to achieve a reduction in preventable SAR incidents through greater coordination and integration of initiatives. This group will also develop and implement a land safety strategic plan.§          §The role requires sophisticated facilitation skills and an ability to engage and inspire multiple stakeholders to work collaboratively on a common goal.  The Senior Advisor - Land Safety Forum will receive excellent support from DOC at all levels but there is a level of autonomy and independence required, meaning initiative and self-efficacy will go a long way towards success in the role.§          § §          §He kōrero mōu: What we are looking for§          §Essential skills and experience§          §            §Advanced skills in facilitation and stakeholder management in a challenging environment§            §Experience in developing multiyear strategies and plans across sectors§            §Experience in managing multi-year projects involving multiple stakeholders§            §Knowledge of the land safety environment in New Zealand§            §Ability to manage budgeting and funding allocation processes§          §          § §          §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What's in it for you?§          §A fantastic supportive and collaborative working environment. Being the multiple award winner of the most attractive employer in the public sector (and second overall) with an average turnover beyond 10 years, we know people generally really enjoy working with us!§          §We offer a range of flexible working options depending on the needs of the role and its work context.§          §The chance to join a large organisation that's still growing. DOC has been undergoing a steady period of growth, we highly value the new expertise and fresh perspectives brought into the organisation. This is your chance to contribute to our culture of continuous improvement.§          § §          §Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory - this includes holding a valid work visa that covers the whole period of employment.§          §Please apply online via the DOC Careers Centre§ with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the requirements above. §          §For any enquiry, please contact Andy Roberts, §aroberts@doc.govt.nz§, or telephone (027) 280 9186, quoting vacancy T800/4000/5.  §          §Applications close at §5pm on Sunday, 11 October 2020.§          §DOC is committed to a diverse workforce that represents the communities we serve, and to creating an inclusive workplace culture. We offer a range of flexible working options depending on the needs of the role and its work context.§  §        §        §        §      §    §  §§§We are looking for a motivated, strategic, and innovative stakeholder management specialist to break new ground in a role that works with others to reduce preventable search and rescue incidents across land in New Zealand.§ §He angitūtanga: About the Role§The Senior Advisor - Land Safety Forum is a brand new role set up to establish and facilitate a cross-sector land safety forum. This group will also develop and implement a land safety strategic plan.§The role requires sophisticated facilitation skills and an ability to engage and inspire multiple stakeholders to work collaboratively on a common goal.  The Senior Advisor - Land Safety Forum will receive excellent support from DOC at all levels but there is a level of autonomy and independence required, meaning initiative and self-efficacy will go a long way towards success in the role.§ §He kōrero mōu: What we are looking for§Essential skills and experience§§Advanced skills in facilitation and stakeholder management in a challenging environment§Experience in developing multiyear strategies and plans across sectors§Experience in managing multi-year projects involving multiple stakeholders§Knowledge of the land safety environment in New Zealand§Ability to manage budgeting and funding allocation processes§§ §§Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What's in it for you?§A fantastic supportive and collaborative working environment. Being the multiple award winner of the most attractive employer in the public sector (and second overall) with an average turnover beyond 10 years, we know people generally really enjoy working with us!§We offer a range of flexible working options depending on the needs of the role and its work context.§The chance to join a large organisation that's still growing. DOC has been undergoing a steady period of growth, we highly value the new expertise and fresh perspectives brought into the organisation. This is your chance to contribute to our culture of continuous improvement.§ §Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory - this includes holding a valid work visa that covers the whole period of employment.§Please apply online via the DOC Careers Centre§ with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the requirements above. §For any enquiry, please contact Andy Roberts, §aroberts@doc.govt.nz§, or telephone (027) 280 9186, quoting vacancy T800/4000/5.  §Applications close at §5pm on Sunday, 11 October 2020.§§DOC is committed to a diverse workforce that represents the communities we serve, and to creating an inclusive workplace culture.
