jobText: TXT/50638768.txt	§Analyst, Pricing and Economics§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Analyst, Pricing and Economics§§Advertiser: §Department of Conservation§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Analyst, Pricing and Economics §        §          §The Department of Conservation is an exciting and ever rewarding organisation to work for. Through our work we ensure Papatūānuku Thrives. We all work together each day to increase the value of conservation, contributing to the economic, social and cultural success of Aotearoa.§          §The Pricing and Economics Unit was established as a separate Unit earlier this last year to drive improved conservation outcomes and to address the need to drive greater revenue from those who benefit from the use of conservation assets. This is a rare opportunity to join us as we embark on the second phase of our journey by further increasing the size and capability of our team.§          § §          §He angitūtanga: About the Role§          §As an analyst in our team you will play a pivotal role by providing analytical support to the pricing and economics unit and beyond.  You will ensure projects are well defined, scoped appropriately and implemented consistently. You will be working with multiple streams of internal and external data sources and a range of stakeholders.  You will be skilled at interpreting and working with data, quantitative and qualitative, and policy. You will have a good understanding of pricing and economic methodologies.  You will be proficient at translating information into insight and able to convey information in a variety of formats to meet the needs of different audiences.§          § §          §He kōrero mōu: What we are looking for§          §This appointment requires a dedicated and proactive individual with the curiosity to identify opportunities and initiative to explore them. Your strong communication skills will allow you to adapt the presentation of your information to ensure its suitability for your target audience. We are looking for an agile thinker who can understand and apply new information to learn and grow in this position. A relevant university qualification and work experience is desired.§          §Specific skills§          §            §Strong conceptual, analytical, communication and presentation skills§            §Strong ability to work with quantitative data and software packages (e.g. Excel, R)§            §Proven ability to lead project work within a multi-disciplinary team§            §Understanding of the implications of the Treaty of Waitangi on today's society§            §Strong ability to build and maintain effective relationships§            §A minimum of 2 years relevant work experience§          §          § §          §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What's in it for you?§          §A fantastic supportive and collaborative working environment. Being the multiple award winner of the most attractive employer in the public sector (and second overall) with an average turnover beyond 10 years, we know people generally really enjoy working with us!§          §We offer a range of flexible working options depending on the needs of the role and its work context.§          §Respect, recognition and opportunities for personal growth.§          §Excellent employee wellbeing initiatives including the employee assistance program and discounted insurance.§          §Free accommodation in our huts and campsites as well as general travel and accommodation discounts.§          §Job satisfaction from contributing to crucial and meaningful work.§          § §          §Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory - this includes holding a valid work visa that covers the whole period of employment.§          §Please apply online via the DOC Careers Centre§ with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the requirements above. §          §For any enquiry, please contact Carly Strausberg §cstrausberg@doc.govt.nz§          §Applications close at 5pm on Monday, 19 October 2020.§          §DOC is committed to a diverse workforce that represents the communities we serve, and to creating an inclusive workplace culture.§        §        §        §      §    §  §§§The Department of Conservation is an exciting and ever rewarding organisation to work for. Through our work we ensure Papatūānuku Thrives. We all work together each day to increase the value of conservation, contributing to the economic, social and cultural success of Aotearoa.§The Pricing and Economics Unit was established as a separate Unit earlier this last year to drive improved conservation outcomes and to address the need to drive greater revenue from those who benefit from the use of conservation assets. This is a rare opportunity to join us as we embark on the second phase of our journey by further increasing the size and capability of our team.§ §He angitūtanga: About the Role§As an analyst in our team you will play a pivotal role by providing analytical support to the pricing and economics unit and beyond.  You will ensure projects are well defined, scoped appropriately and implemented consistently. You will be working with multiple streams of internal and external data sources and a range of stakeholders.  You will be skilled at interpreting and working with data, quantitative and qualitative, and policy. You will have a good understanding of pricing and economic methodologies.  You will be proficient at translating information into insight and able to convey information in a variety of formats to meet the needs of different audiences.§ §He kōrero mōu: What we are looking for§This appointment requires a dedicated and proactive individual with the curiosity to identify opportunities and initiative to explore them. Your strong communication skills will allow you to adapt the presentation of your information to ensure its suitability for your target audience. We are looking for an agile thinker who can understand and apply new information to learn and grow in this position. A relevant university qualification and work experience is desired.§Specific skills§§Strong conceptual, analytical, communication and presentation skills§Strong ability to work with quantitative data and software packages (e.g. Excel, R)§Proven ability to lead project work within a multi-disciplinary team§Understanding of the implications of the Treaty of Waitangi on today's society§Strong ability to build and maintain effective relationships§A minimum of 2 years relevant work experience§§ §§Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What's in it for you?§A fantastic supportive and collaborative working environment. Being the multiple award winner of the most attractive employer in the public sector (and second overall) with an average turnover beyond 10 years, we know people generally really enjoy working with us!§We offer a range of flexible working options depending on the needs of the role and its work context.§Respect, recognition and opportunities for personal growth.§Excellent employee wellbeing initiatives including the employee assistance program and discounted insurance.§Free accommodation in our huts and campsites as well as general travel and accommodation discounts.§Job satisfaction from contributing to crucial and meaningful work.§ §Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory - this includes holding a valid work visa that covers the whole period of employment.§Please apply online via the DOC Careers Centre§ with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the requirements above. §For any enquiry, please contact Carly Strausberg §cstrausberg@doc.govt.nz§§Applications close at 5pm on Monday, 19 October 2020.§DOC is committed to a diverse workforce that represents the communities we serve, and to creating an inclusive workplace culture.§§§§

jobTitle: Asset Planner Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50638787.txt	§Asset Planner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Asset Planner§§Advertiser: §Department of Conservation§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Asset Planner §        §          §An exciting opportunity has become available within the Department of Conservation's (DOC) Hauraki-Waikato-Taranaki Operations Planning team for an Asset Planner looking for a rewarding career contributing to the management of New Zealand's recreational and historic resources.  This is an exciting time to join DOC and grow your career within a highly experienced and motivated team environment.§          §The Department is blessed with more than 72,000 recreational, historic and infrastructure assets - everything from huts and other buildings, signage and interpretation, tracks and walkways, bridges and structures, to campgrounds and toilets.  Don't miss the opportunity to help DOC manage these great assets.§          §This is a permanent, full-time role based in Hamilton, with the option of flexible working arrangements.§          § §          §He angitūtanga: About the Role§          §DOC's Asset Planners play a critical role in ensuring we maximise the use of our investments by helping to establish long-term maintenance programmes and advising on monthly work planning with Rangers.  They also provide information to different levels of management, and work as a team of Asset Planners to assist with achieving national consistency.§          §As one of two Asset Planners in the Hauraki-Waikato-Taranaki region, you will be a key member of the Operations Planning team.§          §In this role, you will:§          §            §Develop and maintain the AMIS database for Recreational and Historic work programmes across the districts§            §Ensure accurate reflection of the status of assets and work completed§            §Support district staff to schedule work within the asset management tool§            §Assign work orders to work groups or individuals§            §Maintain equipment master data§            §Be responsible for ensuring work management systems are kept up to date, while working with district Operations teams to develop and prioritise work programmes§            §Manage the Department's asset information system to provide quality analysis and reports for decision-making§            §Carry out all planned work to a high standard, on time and within budget§          §          §The appointee will join our DOC Operations Planning whānau based in Hamilton, supporting the whole of DOC's Hauraki-Waikato-Taranaki region.  This team includes a Biodiversity Planner, Recreation Planner, Treaty Partnership & Community Planner, Asset/Maintenance Planners, Inspectors, and Works Officers.§          §This is largely an office-based role; however, you will need to meet with teams in our district offices on a regular basis (Coromandel, Hauraki, Waikato, Maniapoto and Taranaki).  Good communication skills are essential to successfully build quality relationships with staff in the districts.§          § §          §He kōrero mōu: What we are looking for§          §The ideal applicant will have Asset Planning experience or be skilled at managing computer-based management information systems.  They will ideally understand general asset management practice with the ability to apply messaging and advice to maximise our investment and minimise risk for visitors.§          § §          §The successful applicant will have:§          §            §An understanding of asset/work management principles, practices and systems§            §A proven ability to manage and analyse data to identify risk and provide quality assurance§            §Excellent interpersonal, communication, engagement and relationship management skills§            §The ability to plan and organise work and resources over a programme of work to meet timeframes§          §          §An understanding of capital assets and operational budget management is desirable.  A good knowledge of the facilities used within the recreation/tourism industry and knowledge of construction principles would also be advantageous.§          § §          §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What's in it for you?§          §If you love managing and analysing data sets, and have an active interest in outdoor recreation, then this may well be the role for you.  If you are risk aware and motivated by working with others to achieve common goals, then we would love to hear from you.§          §This is a great opportunity to join a large organisation that's still growing.  DOC has been undergoing a steady period of growth, and we highly value the new expertise and fresh perspectives being brought into the organisation.  This is your chance to contribute to our culture of continuous improvement.§          §We offer a fantastic supportive and collaborative working environment. Being the multiple award winner of the most attractive employer in the public sector (and second overall) with an average turnover beyond 10 years, we know people generally really enjoy working with us!§          § §          §Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory.§          §Please apply online via the DOC Careers Centre§ with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the requirements above. §          §For any enquiries, please contact Sarah Carter, §sacarter@doc.govt.nz§, ph 027 260 6115, quoting vacancy 400/9487. §          §Applications close at 5 pm on Monday, 12 October 2020.§          §DOC is committed to a diverse workforce that represents the communities we serve, and to creating an inclusive workplace culture. We offer a range of flexible working options depending on the needs of the role and its work context.§        §        §        §      §    §  §§§An exciting opportunity has become available within the Department of Conservation's (DOC) Hauraki-Waikato-Taranaki Operations Planning team for an Asset Planner looking for a rewarding career contributing to the management of New Zealand's recreational and historic resources.  This is an exciting time to join DOC and grow your career within a highly experienced and motivated team environment.§The Department is blessed with more than 72,000 recreational, historic and infrastructure assets - everything from huts and other buildings, signage and interpretation, tracks and walkways, bridges and structures, to campgrounds and toilets.  Don't miss the opportunity to help DOC manage these great assets.§This is a permanent, full-time role based in Hamilton, with the option of flexible working arrangements.§ §§He angitūtanga: About the Role§DOC's Asset Planners play a critical role in ensuring we maximise the use of our investments by helping to establish long-term maintenance programmes and advising on monthly work planning with Rangers.  They also provide information to different levels of management, and work as a team of Asset Planners to assist with achieving national consistency.§As one of two Asset Planners in the Hauraki-Waikato-Taranaki region, you will be a key member of the Operations Planning team.§In this role, you will:§§Develop and maintain the AMIS database for Recreational and Historic work programmes across the districts§Ensure accurate reflection of the status of assets and work completed§Support district staff to schedule work within the asset management tool§Assign work orders to work groups or individuals§Maintain equipment master data§Be responsible for ensuring work management systems are kept up to date, while working with district Operations teams to develop and prioritise work programmes§Manage the Department's asset information system to provide quality analysis and reports for decision-making§Carry out all planned work to a high standard, on time and within budget§§The appointee will join our DOC Operations Planning whānau based in Hamilton, supporting the whole of DOC's Hauraki-Waikato-Taranaki region.  This team includes a Biodiversity Planner, Recreation Planner, Treaty Partnership & Community Planner, Asset/Maintenance Planners, Inspectors, and Works Officers.§This is largely an office-based role; however, you will need to meet with teams in our district offices on a regular basis (Coromandel, Hauraki, Waikato, Maniapoto and Taranaki).  Good communication skills are essential to successfully build quality relationships with staff in the districts.§ §§He kōrero mōu: What we are looking for§The ideal applicant will have Asset Planning experience or be skilled at managing computer-based management information systems.  They will ideally understand general asset management practice with the ability to apply messaging and advice to maximise our investment and minimise risk for visitors.§ §The successful applicant will have:§§An understanding of asset/work management principles, practices and systems§A proven ability to manage and analyse data to identify risk and provide quality assurance§Excellent interpersonal, communication, engagement and relationship management skills§The ability to plan and organise work and resources over a programme of work to meet timeframes§§An understanding of capital assets and operational budget management is desirable.  A good knowledge of the facilities used within the recreation/tourism industry and knowledge of construction principles would also be advantageous.§ §§Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What's in it for you?§If you love managing and analysing data sets, and have an active interest in outdoor recreation, then this may well be the role for you.  If you are risk aware and motivated by working with others to achieve common goals, then we would love to hear from you.§This is a great opportunity to join a large organisation that's still growing.  DOC has been undergoing a steady period of growth, and we highly value the new expertise and fresh perspectives being brought into the organisation.  This is your chance to contribute to our culture of continuous improvement.§We offer a fantastic supportive and collaborative working environment. Being the multiple award winner of the most attractive employer in the public sector (and second overall) with an average turnover beyond 10 years, we know people generally really enjoy working with us!§ §Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory.§Please apply online via the DOC Careers Centre§ with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the requirements above. §For any enquiries, please contact Sarah Carter, §sacarter@doc.govt.nz§, ph 027 260 6115, quoting vacancy 400/9487. §Applications close at 5 pm on Monday, 12 October 2020.§DOC is committed to a diverse workforce that represents the communities we serve, and to creating an inclusive workplace culture. We offer a range of flexible working options depending on the needs of the role and its work context.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50641954.txt	§Sustainability Graduate§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Sustainability Graduate§§Advertiser: §Mr Apple§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Hastings§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§Scales Corporation is a diversified agribusiness company and is a New Zealand listed company. It comprises of three operating divisions: Horticulture, Logistics and Food Ingredients. Based at Mr Apple in Hawkes Bay you will work for the Scales Group Health & Safety, Compliance and Sustainability Manager and get to work with a diverse company that values its biggest asset its people.  Mr Apple is New Zealand's largest vertically integrated grower, packer and exporter of apples. This is a brand-new role and requires a special Graduate with a passion for sustainability.  § § § §Your main duties will include§ § §Projects and lots of them with a focus on supporting our goals on energy, carbon, waste and site environment compliance§ §Working on energy, waste, carbon footprint roadmap strategies§ §Identify efficiency improvement opportunities, support energy/KPI management systems and project implementation.§ §Consult, review carbon footprint KPIs and engage key stakeholders to drive improvement projects§ §Implement training and education programs for the business§ §Conduct research for projects § §Oversee site audits and carbon footprint by engaging with stakeholders§ §Assist with Scales Annual report on sustainability§ § § §To be successful, you will have:§ § §Degree in either Environment Science or ideally Agri-Business§ §Excellent analytical, problem-solving and decision-making skills§ §Strong communication and coaching skills – ability to engage internal / external stakeholders§ §Strong interest in sustainability and environmental planning§ §Organised, detailed and thorough approach to tasks and project management§ §Good computer skills (MS Office, basic statistical analysis) and capability to learn new applications§ §A current full driver’s licence.§ § § §You will thrive in an analytical role with a component of stakeholder management, which allows you to both work with data and problem-solve and constantly enhance your ability to interact with people across the organisation. If you are keen to start your career with a company focused on continuous improvement with a strong focus on growing a fantastic product as well as looking after the environment then get involved and grow with us. We will support you on this important start to your career and ensure you have fun doing it. §Please apply via mrapple.com/employment/vacancies/§ § § §Mr Apple is committed to a drug and alcohol-free workplace. Please note applications will only be considered if you are legally entitled to work in New Zealand. You must be a New Zealand Citizen, a permanent resident or a holder of a current New Zealand work visa to apply for this job.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50641963.txt	§Principal Policy Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Principal Policy Advisor§§Advertiser: §Department of the Prime Minister and Cabinet§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Principal Policy Advisor §      §        §We're looking for a talented Principal Policy Advisor to join a dynamic team navigating New Zealand's most pressing security policy challenges. Do you have excellent policy skills, with demonstrated ability to apply these to complex policy challenges? Do you enjoy working collaboratively with others to solve problems? Do you have a passion for New Zealand's national security, in its widest sense?§        §The National Security Policy Directorate (NSPD) sits within the National Security Group, Department of the Prime Minister and Cabinet. Its role is to provide policy leadership on crosscutting national security, intelligence, emergency management, risk and resilience matters. The Directorate's teams include Security and Intelligence Policy, Cyber Policy and Strategy.§        §We are a collaborative team working on cross-cutting projects and offer a dynamic, agile environment for our policy professionals. The role has a focus on security and intelligence policy. We are especially keen to hear from policy professionals with experience in systems thinking, strategy and strategic policy.§        §The Principal Policy Advisor's key responsibilities are:§        §          §partnering with the Team Manager and other Principal Policy Advisors to set the strategic direction and drive the work programme of the team§          §leading complex policy projects and programmes within their portfolio§          §contributing flexibly to the broader policy work of the Directorate§          §leading and coordinating interagency and external collaboration, including influencing wider government policy development, to support national security objectives§          §lifting individual and collective capability and quality, through peer review and mentoring Policy Advisors§          §anticipating Ministers and Senior Officials requirements to deliver quality policy products§          §building relationships across the national security policy community and representing the Directorate§          §supporting the operation of the National Security System during emergencies§        §        §What are we looking for?§        §The Policy Project's Policy Skills Framework describes the knowledge, skills and behaviours required of NSPD's policy advisors.§        §Principal Policy Advisors are expected to demonstrate these at the §expert/leading§ level. For detailed descriptors, refer to the full Policy Skills Framework §here§.§        §          §proven experience in a policy environment working on complex projects§          §an interest in, and detailed understanding of, national security§          §detailed understanding of government priorities and relevant political context§          §proven experience in applying policy frameworks and analytical tools and methods§          §proven experience developing others through coaching and mentoring to achieve high performance§          §sound judgement, organisational and political nous, critical and lateral thinking;§          §proven ability to influence and engage others within and outside the organisation§          §excellent communication skills - persuasive, collaborative and inspiring§        §        §Eligibility requirements§: To be eligible for this position, you must have been a NZ citizen for at least 10 years. Alternatively you must hold NZ Permanent Residence or hold a current NZ Residency Class Visa and have been a citizen of UK, USA, Canada or Australia for at least 10 years.§        §You must also be able to obtain and maintain a Top Secret Special (TSS) security clearance. Ordinarily to obtain this level of clearance candidates must have a 15 year checkable background in countries where meaningful and reliable checks can be undertaken. Where requisite checks are unable to be made, the candidate application may not be able to be progressed.§        §Indicative starting salary is $131,987 to $155,279§        §For more information§        §Please email Pip Swaney (§Pip.Swaney@dpmc.govt.nz§). Ordinarily to obtain this level of clearance candidates must have a 15 year checkable background in countries where meaningful and reliable checks can be undertaken. jobText: TXT/50646047.txt	§Change Management Lead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Change Management Lead§§Advertiser: §DOWNER NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Change Management Lead §      §        §Downer New Zealand is NZ’s leading provider of integrated infrastructure services. The Facilities Services and Utilities (FS&U) division is a provider of end-to-end maintenance and project management services.  We design, construct, operate, maintain and manage assets and systems to deliver great results for asset owners and their customers. Our proven capabilities in high calibre technical asset management, technical facilities management, cleaning, catering, and technical utilities services; the smarts of our more than 8,000 people in all parts of the country; and our well established customer base is the platform for our success and growth.§        §Our FS&U Transformation Programme will streamline our work management lifecycle to achieve standardised, simplified, effective and cost efficient business processes. Our vision is to be the leader in our field by transforming the way we get things done together. We want to be easy to work with, easy to work for, sustainable and highly productive.§        §The Change Management Lead is accountable for developing deployment plans and ensure successful roll out in consultation with senior Operational leaders and functional stakeholders. In this role, you will lead a passionate team providing team leadership, clear and efficient work planning and ensuring day-to-day delivery against deployment plans. The key objectives of the role are to:-§        §          §Champion embedding, refining and leading effective change management processes supporting the implementation of the new FS&U operating model.§          §Support Operational leaders embedding new work management processes and ensure business process compliance through training, communication, analytics, and continuous improvement initiatives.§          §Consultation with internal stakeholders and partners on change management activities, priorities and operational delivery.§          §Ensure clear and early coordination with internal stakeholders on scheduling and delivery against key milestones and financial targets.§          §Develop and consolidate change management related workstream deployment plans and support reporting against those plans.§        §        §The Change Management Lead will support building internal change management capability, refine fit for purpose approaches, and embed effective deployment solutions.  Therefore, to be successful in this challenging role, you will ideally have the following skills and attributes:-§        §          §Experience of 3 – 5 years working for a large organisation in a Project or Change Management capacity, preferable from a large commercial environment.§          §Proven working knowledge and hands-on experience with deployment of contemporary change management principles, methodologies, engagement practices and implementation plans.§          §Financial and commercial acumen along with business transformation experience implementing large-scale significant changes to business process, technology and people.§          §Experience in leading a small high performance team and a clear demonstration of leadership behaviours that empower others.§          §Effective communication and stakeholder management with the ability to influence, constructively challenge and deal effectively with conflict.§          §Ability to work in a complex work environment; deal with ambiguity and across functions.§          §Change Management Certification an advantage.§        §        §A role with us can enable you to develop and enhance your skills and experience.  This is a great opportunity for you to join our diverse and inclusive culture and be part of a great team thriving in a collaborative fast-paced environment.  We will reward you with a competitive remuneration package, flexible working arrangements, great training and ongoing development, and the opportunity to advance your career within our organisation.     §        §If this sounds like the opportunity for you, head to www.downercareers.co.nz and enter reference number 573780 to apply.    §        §Downer NZ is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture.§        §Our workplaces are drug and alcohol free - all successful applicants will be required to undertake a Pre-Employment drug test and medical. §        §Due to the fast-paced nature of Downer, our vacancy close dates may be subject to change, so don't delay and make sure you apply as soon as possible. §        §Please note we have an in-house recruitment team that manage all our vacancies. No candidates presented through an agency will be considered for any of our roles advertised, unless previously arranged. We would strongly encourage all candidates interested in these roles, to apply directly online through the portal provided otherwise your application will not be considered. §      §      §      §    §    §www.downer.co.nz§  §§§Downer New Zealand is NZ’s leading provider of integrated infrastructure services. The Facilities Services and Utilities (FS&U) division is a provider of end-to-end maintenance and project management services.  We design, construct, operate, maintain and manage assets and systems to deliver great results for asset owners and their customers. Our proven capabilities in high calibre technical asset management, technical facilities management, cleaning, catering, and technical utilities services; the smarts of our more than 8,000 people in all parts of the country; and our well established customer base is the platform for our success and growth.§Our FS&U Transformation Programme will streamline our work management lifecycle to achieve standardised, simplified, effective and cost efficient business processes. Our vision is to be the leader in our field by transforming the way we get things done together. We want to be easy to work with, easy to work for, sustainable and highly productive.§The Change Management Lead is accountable for developing deployment plans and ensure successful roll out in consultation with senior Operational leaders and functional stakeholders. In this role, you will lead a passionate team providing team leadership, clear and efficient work planning and ensuring day-to-day delivery against deployment plans. The key objectives of the role are to:-§§Champion embedding, refining and leading effective change management processes supporting the implementation of the new FS&U operating model.§Support Operational leaders embedding new work management processes and ensure business process compliance through training, communication, analytics, and continuous improvement initiatives.§Consultation with internal stakeholders and partners on change management activities, priorities and operational delivery.§Ensure clear and early coordination with internal stakeholders on scheduling and delivery against key milestones and financial targets.§Develop and consolidate change management related workstream deployment plans and support reporting against those plans.§§The Change Management Lead will support building internal change management capability, refine fit for purpose approaches, and embed effective deployment solutions.  Therefore, to be successful in this challenging role, you will ideally have the following skills and attributes:-§§Experience of 3 – 5 years working for a large organisation in a Project or Change Management capacity, preferable from a large commercial environment.§Proven working knowledge and hands-on experience with deployment of contemporary change management principles, methodologies, engagement practices and implementation plans.§Financial and commercial acumen along with business transformation experience implementing large-scale significant changes to business process, technology and people.§Experience in leading a small high performance team and a clear demonstration of leadership behaviours that empower others.§Effective communication and stakeholder management with the ability to influence, constructively challenge and deal effectively with conflict.§Ability to work in a complex work environment; deal with ambiguity and across functions.§Change Management Certification an advantage.§§A role with us can enable you to develop and enhance your skills and experience.  This is a great opportunity for you to join our diverse and inclusive culture and be part of a great team thriving in a collaborative fast-paced environment.  We will reward you with a competitive remuneration package, flexible working arrangements, great training and ongoing development, and the opportunity to advance your career within our organisation.     §If this sounds like the opportunity for you, head to www.downercareers.co.nz and enter reference number 573780 to apply.    §Downer NZ is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture.§Our workplaces are drug and alcohol free - all successful applicants will be required to undertake a Pre-Employment drug test and medical. §Due to the fast-paced nature of Downer, our vacancy close dates may be subject to change, so don't delay and make sure you apply as soon as possible. §§Please note we have an in-house recruitment team that manage all our vacancies. Strong analysis skills will be critical to your success in this position with the ability to think innovatively and collaborate with key stakeholders across the business.§        §CAA employees enjoy benefits including 4% Kiwisaver contributions and discounted insurance premiums.  Our head office is modern, well-equipped and close to public transport and next to the fabulous Wellington waterfront.§        §The Authority is implementing change to deliver better regulatory outcomes and ‘safe and secure skies to help New Zealand fly’. Join us at this exciting time while we work to develop our new organisational culture and way of working.§        §Please take a look at the §Position Description§ for this role to find out if you have what it takes and apply now! If you’d like to have a confidential chat with one of our team about this role or other opportunities at the CAA please call Lisa Rickard-Simms on 021 620 059.§        §Applications close Sunday 11 October 2020. §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Company description:§We are a Crown entity responsible for the safety and security of New Zealand’s civil aviation system. jobTitle: Consulting Solicitor - Law Society Stakeholder Representative Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50647633.txt	§Consulting Solicitor - Law Society Stakeholder Representative§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Consulting Solicitor - Law Society Stakeholder Representative§§Advertiser: §Land Information New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Consulting Solicitor - Law Society Stakeholder Representative §      §      §      §        §          §Do you enjoy an intellectual challenge and complex decision making?§          §Looking for fast paced, meaningful work with a high level of public interest?§          §Play a key role in modernising Land Titles for NZ§        §        §At Land Information New Zealand (LINZ), our key role is to ensure that we are protecting New Zealand's land and assets. We do this by ensuring that New Zealanders have accurate information about the land and its use, that they have confidence in their property rights and that our land is well-managed and maintained for future generations.§        §We are focused on establishing ourselves as an organisation that actively influences our sector to provide services that are more modern, efficient, and effective for New Zealand.  To achieve this LINZ wishes to become more proactive both as regulators of land related transactions and as stewards of information about the land.  Our objective is to work with customers and industry participants to ensure the effective use of the information we make available and to co-create new modernised services.§        §To enable our goal, we are building a bespoke enterprise solution with great challenges, many moving parts, with an energised team driven to deliver world class products.§        §To help us realise this goal, we are seeking a customer-centric, collaborative, and innovative §Consulting Solicitor§ to join us.§        §Working as a consulting solicitor for our Survey and Titles Enhancement Programme, this role gives you a fantastic opportunity to contribute to the design and development of a new and enhanced Landonline functionality by acting as the liaison between the programme and the New Zealand Law Society |Te Kāhui Ture o Aotearoa (Law Society).  As part of our proficient and professional team, you'll be provided with a broad variety of challenging work which will include providing strategic advice and sharing your comprehensive knowledge of the property and conveyancing environment. §        §Ideally, you will have had previous experience in a property and conveyancing environment and will be commercially savvy with exceptional analytical skills. You'll be confident at producing balanced advice and building effective stakeholder relationships and won't hesitate to proactively respond to our daily challenges. You will hold or can hold a current practising certificate from the Law Society, and be a member of its Property Law Section.§        §The role will give you the chance to work as part of a cohesive, high functioning team and so it is vital that you are knowledgeable and able to relate well to people of all levels and backgrounds. You will serve as an §ex officio §member of the Law Society Property Law Section‘s Land Titles Subcommittee, and have the support of the committee as practitioners dedicated to improving Landonline and conveyancing practices.§        §This strategic career move will allow you to be involved in challenging and politically visible work that impacts positively on New Zealand's future. §        §How to Apply§        §To apply, please click "Apply Online." You'll be taken through to our LINZ Careers Centre where you'll be able to review further information about the responsibilities and accountabilities of this role in the Position Description. You'll be able to complete your online application form and upload a copy of your CV/Cover Letter. Please keep in mind when including your CV to specifically highlight how you demonstrate the capabilities and skills listed in the above ad and the position description.§        §Applications close 11th October 2020.§        §If you have any questions about this role or working at LINZ, please email §opportunities@linz.govt.nz§ and our Recruitment Team will be in touch with you.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§§Do you enjoy an intellectual challenge and complex decision making?§§Looking for fast paced, meaningful work with a high level of public interest?§§Play a key role in modernising Land Titles for NZ§§At Land Information New Zealand (LINZ), our key role is to ensure that we are protecting New Zealand's land and assets. We do this by ensuring that New Zealanders have accurate information about the land and its use, that they have confidence in their property rights and that our land is well-managed and maintained for future generations.§We are focused on establishing ourselves as an organisation that actively influences our sector to provide services that are more modern, efficient, and effective for New Zealand.  To achieve this LINZ wishes to become more proactive both as regulators of land related transactions and as stewards of information about the land.  Our objective is to work with customers and industry participants to ensure the effective use of the information we make available and to co-create new modernised services.§To enable our goal, we are building a bespoke enterprise solution with great challenges, many moving parts, with an energised team driven to deliver world class products.§To help us realise this goal, we are seeking a customer-centric, collaborative, and innovative §Consulting Solicitor§ to join us.§Working as a consulting solicitor for our Survey and Titles Enhancement Programme, this role gives you a fantastic opportunity to contribute to the design and development of a new and enhanced Landonline functionality by acting as the liaison between the programme and the New Zealand Law Society |Te Kāhui Ture o Aotearoa (Law Society).  As part of our proficient and professional team, you'll be provided with a broad variety of challenging work which will include providing strategic advice and sharing your comprehensive knowledge of the property and conveyancing environment. §Ideally, you will have had previous experience in a property and conveyancing environment and will be commercially savvy with exceptional analytical skills. You'll be confident at producing balanced advice and building effective stakeholder relationships and won't hesitate to proactively respond to our daily challenges. You will hold or can hold a current practising certificate from the Law Society, and be a member of its Property Law Section.§The role will give you the chance to work as part of a cohesive, high functioning team and so it is vital that you are knowledgeable and able to relate well to people of all levels and backgrounds. You will serve as an §ex officio §member of the Law Society Property Law Section‘s Land Titles Subcommittee, and have the support of the committee as practitioners dedicated to improving Landonline and conveyancing practices.§This strategic career move will allow you to be involved in challenging and politically visible work that impacts positively on New Zealand's future. §How to Apply§To apply, please click "Apply Online." You'll be taken through to our LINZ Careers Centre where you'll be able to review further information about the responsibilities and accountabilities of this role in the Position Description. You'll be able to complete your online application form and upload a copy of your CV/Cover Letter. Please keep in mind when including your CV to specifically highlight how you demonstrate the capabilities and skills listed in the above ad and the position description.§Applications close 11th October 2020.§If you have any questions about this role or working at LINZ, please email §opportunities@linz.govt.nz§ and our Recruitment Team will be in touch with you.§§§§

jobTitle: Intermediate Planner Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50647680.txt	§Intermediate Planner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Intermediate Planner§§Advertiser: §JOYN§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Intermediate Planner §      §        §About the company§        §        §Our client is a well established consultancy with a reputation for expertise, results and customer service. Working nationally with construction professionals, legal intermediaries and land developers, the business is experiencing strong and growing demand for its services and needs to expand the team with an experienced Planner.§        §        §About the role§        §        §Working closely with an established Consents Manager, you will be focused on understanding client goals and the accurate, timely preparation of consent applications.§        §        §Key skills & experience for this role are:§        §        §          §Tertiary qualification or demonstrated skills in planning or a similar discipline such as environmental management§          §3 or more years of relevant experience§          §Knowledge and experience working with the Resource Management Act 1991§          §Experience dealing with numerous regional councils & territorial authorities across the greater Canterbury region§          §A thorough understanding of opportunities in the CCC District Plan§          §Exceptionally well organised with excellent attention to detail§          §Strong interpersonal and communication skills§          §Knowledge of the Auckland Unitary Plan would be an advantage but isn’t essential§          §The ability to think outside of the "normal" box§        §        §        §        §What’s on offer§        §        §A competitive salary and positive, supportive working environment will be on offer to the successful candidate.§        §        §The role is full time but everyone in the business enjoys the flexibility to start and finish earlier or later to suit their needs.§        §        §Company vehicles will be available for any client site or supplier visits and the role is based in modern, spacious offices with parking.§        §        §Click ‘Apply’ or contact Kris Morgan to talk about the role.§      §      §Kristian Morgan§+6421 088 35617§Kristian.Morgan@joyn.co.nz§ §    §    §  §§§About the company§§Our client is a well established consultancy with a reputation for expertise, results and customer service. Working nationally with construction professionals, legal intermediaries and land developers, the business is experiencing strong and growing demand for its services and needs to expand the team with an experienced Planner.§§About the role§§Working closely with an established Consents Manager, you will be focused on understanding client goals and the accurate, timely preparation of consent applications.§§Key skills & experience for this role are:§§Tertiary qualification or demonstrated skills in planning or a similar discipline such as environmental management§3 or more years of relevant experience§Knowledge and experience working with the Resource Management Act 1991§Experience dealing with numerous regional councils & territorial authorities across the greater Canterbury region§A thorough understanding of opportunities in the CCC District Plan§Exceptionally well organised with excellent attention to detail§Strong interpersonal and communication skills§Knowledge of the Auckland Unitary Plan would be an advantage but isn’t essential§The ability to think outside of the "normal" box§§§What’s on offer§§A competitive salary and positive, supportive working environment will be on offer to the successful candidate.§§The role is full time but everyone in the business enjoys the flexibility to start and finish earlier or later to suit their needs.§§Company vehicles will be available for any client site or supplier visits and the role is based in modern, spacious offices with parking.§§Click ‘Apply’ or contact Kris Morgan to talk about the role.§§§§

jobTitle: Analyst and Senior Analyst Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50650062.txt	§Analyst and Senior Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Analyst and Senior Analyst§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Social Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§§§§  §    §Analyst and Senior Analyst §    §      §        §Job Ref: 34765§        §          §Are you passionate about helping New Zealand communities?§          §Your chance to work on some front-page issues§          §Join a demanding and diverse working environment!§          §Permanent and Secondment/Fixed Term roles, Wellington based§        §        §We are seeking an Analyst on a permanent basis and a Senior Analyst Fixed Term/Secondment to June 2021, to join our Safe, Strong Families and Communities team.§        §The Safe, Strong Families and Communities (SSFC) team sits within the Māori, Communities and Partnerships Group at MSD. The current focus of the Safe, Strong Families and Communities group involves MSD’s response to Family Violence, Sexual Violence, and Building Financial Capability across New Zealand.§        §In our work, we make a real and positive difference for communities, through the services we invest in and the support we give.§        §In the role of an Analyst/Senior Analyst, you will be responsible for developing and improving a range of social services for New Zealanders.§        §This is a fast paced position in an achievement focused workplace. We are looking for a broad set of skills within the role of Analyst/Senior Analyst. These roles will provide research, insight and analysis at a national level cross our work programme.§        §Functions within this role include:§        §          §leading projects and/or contributing to work on cross government priorities, including Family Violence§          §identifying and analysing national trends and issues impacting on our work programme§          §providing high quality analysis, advice and reports§          §promoting continuous improvement of services and processes including commissioning.§        §        §We are seeking positive individuals, with relevant experience in social services policy, or NGO environment. Knowledge of Te Ao Maori would be an advantage.§        §To be successful in this position you will need excellent writing skills and the ability to provide evidence-based and balanced analysis. §        §You will need excellent relationship management skills and be able to demonstrate how you build relationships with key government stakeholders and internal ministry staff. This means you are an effective communicator in addition to an excellent relationship manager with a collaborative work ethic and values that align to MSD’s goals.§        §You will also be able to demonstrate your ability to develop practical solutions for complex problems and will have led pieces of work from inception through to implementation with a focus on getting the job done. Experience in service development or the Budget process is also a distinct advantage.§        §You have experience in working constructively with a range of stakeholders and can show how you have mentored colleagues and assisted skill and technical capability development.§        §How to Apply§        §To apply, click the 'Apply Now' button, complete the online application form and submit your CV and Cover Letter outlining your suitability for this role.§        §All applications must be made online. If this is not possible or if you have any queries, please contact us at §jobs@msd.govt.nz§        §Applications close 5pm Monday, 12 October 2020.§        §Position Description§        §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/dce-maori-communities-and-partnerships/senior-analyst-ssfc-dec-19.docx§        §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/dce-maori-communities-and-partnerships/analyst-ssfc-sep-2020.docx§        §Joining us§        §Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents.  We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. We are a Treaty partner committed to strengthening relationships with§ §Māori,§ §Hapū§,§ Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.§        §If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so we can assist you through the recruitment process.§      §      §The Ministry of Social Development is one of New Zealand's largest government agencies. Our work to achieve better social outcomes affects almost every New Zealander, now or in the future.§        §https://jobs.msd.govt.nz/§      §    §    §  §§§Job Ref: 34765§ § §Are you passionate about helping New Zealand communities?§ §Your chance to work on some front-page issues§ §Join a demanding and diverse working environment!§ §Permanent and Secondment/Fixed Term roles, Wellington based§ §We are seeking an Analyst on a permanent basis and a Senior Analyst Fixed Term/Secondment to June 2021, to join our Safe, Strong Families and Communities team.§  §The Safe, Strong Families and Communities (SSFC) team sits within the Māori, Communities and Partnerships Group at MSD. The current focus of the Safe, Strong Families and Communities group involves MSD’s response to Family Violence, Sexual Violence, and Building Financial Capability across New Zealand.§  §In our work, we make a real and positive difference for communities, through the services we invest in and the support we give.§  §In the role of an Analyst/Senior Analyst, you will be responsible for developing and improving a range of social services for New Zealanders.§  §This is a fast paced position in an achievement focused workplace. We are looking for a broad set of skills within the role of Analyst/Senior Analyst. These roles will provide research, insight and analysis at a national level cross our work programme.§  §Functions within this role include:§ § §leading projects and/or contributing to work on cross government priorities, including Family Violence§ §identifying and analysing national trends and issues impacting on our work programme§ §providing high quality analysis, advice and reports§ §promoting continuous improvement of services and processes including commissioning.§ §We are seeking positive individuals, with relevant experience in social services policy, or NGO environment. Knowledge of Te Ao Maori would be an advantage.§  §To be successful in this position you will need excellent writing skills and the ability to provide evidence-based and balanced analysis. §  §You will need excellent relationship management skills and be able to demonstrate how you build relationships with key government stakeholders and internal ministry staff. This means you are an effective communicator in addition to an excellent relationship manager with a collaborative work ethic and values that align to MSD’s goals.§  §You will also be able to demonstrate your ability to develop practical solutions for complex problems and will have led pieces of work from inception through to implementation with a focus on getting the job done. Experience in service development or the Budget process is also a distinct advantage.§  §You have experience in working constructively with a range of stakeholders and can show how you have mentored colleagues and assisted skill and technical capability development.§  §How to Apply§  §To apply, click the 'Apply Now' button, complete the online application form and submit your CV and Cover Letter outlining your suitability for this role.§  §All applications must be made online. If this is not possible or if you have any queries, please contact us at §jobs@msd.govt.nz§  §Applications close 5pm Monday, 12 October 2020.§  §Position Description§  §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/dce-maori-communities-and-partnerships/senior-analyst-ssfc-dec-19.docx§  §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/dce-maori-communities-and-partnerships/analyst-ssfc-sep-2020.docx§  §Joining us§  §Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents.  We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. We are a Treaty partner committed to strengthening relationships with§ §Māori,§ §Hapū§,§ Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.§  §If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so we can assist you through the recruitment process.§§§§

We’ve united iconic industrial and imagewear brands that have been clothing workers for most of the past century: King Gee, Hard Yakka and NNT. We are striving to become a market leader, sending over one million garments to more than 30 countries across Asia, Europe and The Pacific.  In New Zealand, Workwear Group operates in an end to end environment from design to manufacturing to logistics§        §About the Role§        §We have an exciting opportunity for an enthusiastic Sourcing & Project Specialist to join our Product and Sourcing team in Albany. Reporting to Category Manager, our candidate would ideally be analytical with good business acumen, comes with a can-do altitude and a team player. As the Sourcing & Project Specialist, you will be managing the sourcing requirements of Workwear Group, managing new and existing supplier relationships from both local and overseas, coordinating key projects and NPD, and driving continuous improvements.§        §Key Responsibilities:§        §          §Supports and manage business projects that delivers to WWG business plan and strategies§          §Handling sourcing enquiries, proposing product and service solutions tailoring to user requirements while aligning with WWG strategy and deliverables§          §Managing overall integrity and direction of the projects to ensure that product and services are delivered on time, within budget and quality§        §        §          §Works closely with Supply Planning, Suppliers and Quality Assurance on production delays, shipments and quality control issues; identifies and implements corrective actions to resolve production and delivery delays and order discrepancies§          §Conducts competitor bench marking analysis and identifies savings opportunities§        §        §          §Contribute to NPD activities, keep up-to-date with new and emerging supplier and technologies§        §        §          §Negotiates with suppliers to meet best quality, delivery, and cost objectives§        §        §          §Manage the on-boarding process and requirement for existing and new supplier ensuring that they meet WWG ethical and social requirements§          §Identify areas where existing policy, procedures or standards could be improved, or where new ones need to be developed and provide recommendations for change.§          §Understands, adheres to, and works towards meeting WWG HSE Responsibilities§        §        §About You:§        §          §Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to gain and maintain the confidence of a wide range of personnel.§        §        §          §Previous experience working in a complex business environment with multiple customer and stakeholder expectations.§          §Previous experience around project management, sourcing and product development is advantageous§          §An ability to work independently with demonstrated ability to make decisions using sound judgement with limited supervision or direction.§          §Knowledge in garment construction and manufacturing preferred (ideally industrial Workwear).§        §        §You will be rewarded with a range of employee benefits including; exposure to innovative brands, career progression, a competitive salary, a wide range of employee discounts and a safe, fun and supportive working environment. §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§About Us§The Workwear Group brings together the very best of the Australian & New Zealand workwear industry into a single, focused business. We’ve united iconic industrial and imagewear brands that have been clothing workers for most of the past century: King Gee, Hard Yakka and NNT. We are striving to become a market leader, sending over one million garments to more than 30 countries across Asia, Europe and The Pacific.  In New Zealand, Workwear Group operates in an end to end environment from design to manufacturing to logistics§About the Role§We have an exciting opportunity for an enthusiastic Sourcing & Project Specialist to join our Product and Sourcing team in Albany. identifies and implements corrective actions to resolve production and delivery delays and order discrepancies§Conducts competitor bench marking analysis and identifies savings opportunities§Contribute to NPD activities, keep up-to-date with new and emerging supplier and technologies§Negotiates with suppliers to meet best quality, delivery, and cost objectives§Manage the on-boarding process and requirement for existing and new supplier ensuring that they meet WWG ethical and social requirements§Identify areas where existing policy, procedures or standards could be improved, or where new ones need to be developed and provide recommendations for change.§Understands, adheres to, and works towards meeting WWG HSE Responsibilities§About You:§Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to gain and maintain the confidence of a wide range of personnel.§Previous experience working in a complex business environment with multiple customer and stakeholder expectations.§Previous experience around project management, sourcing and product development is advantageous§An ability to work independently with demonstrated ability to make decisions using sound judgement with limited supervision or direction.§Knowledge in garment construction and manufacturing preferred (ideally industrial Workwear).§You will be rewarded with a range of employee benefits including; jobText: TXT/50656042.txt	§Senior Advisor Operational Strategy and Policy §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Advisor Operational Strategy and Policy §§Advertiser: §Parker Bridge – Global Recruiter Winners 2018 – Best Marketing Campaign§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§ §§My client is looking for an experienced Senior Advisor to support their Operational Strategy and Policy Directorate for a 2 year fixed term contract.  §The Role§You will be part of of a complex multi-agency programme which needs to ensure that its key users are well supported and continue to thrive through the next 3-5 years as the programme of work to stand up the new components and transition from the current model. §As a Senior Advisor Operational Strategy and Policy, you will be responsible for leading and creating fit-for-purpose operational strategy and policy solutions that deliver on the policy intent, support organisational strategy and decisions, and meet customer needs. §Responsibilities include:§§Lead and develop operational policy and processes to ensure the project delivers a Unified Funding System§Help develop and communicate the project’s implementation strategy and goals§Use and gather data and information from our customers to design and develop implementable change§Work closely with the project stakeholders to make a difference §Collaborate across other agencies  in the development and design of policy, operational policy and implementation§§Who are we looking for?§We are looking for someone with:§§Operational policy or implementation experience at a Senior Advisor level. Ideally, you will have been involved in successful public sector projects from initiation through to implementation.  §Great critical thinking and writing skills to enable you to tell the story of the ‘what and why’§Effective relationship-building skills that enable you to get the most out of interactions with colleagues and key stakeholders§An ability to select and understand information to support the development of robust strategies and options.§§This position plays a cruicial role in New Zealand's future, contributing to the social and economic growth of the whole country. §What’s next?§Sound like you? §APPLY NOW!!§ To apply for this role, click the link provided and attach your CV and Cover letter.  §At Parker Bridge, we make every effort to respond to all applications, however sometimes the volume we receive is so large it is not possible. If you do not receive a response from us, please don't take it personally as we really value the effort you made to apply.§ §§ §§§§§

jobTitle: Performance and Planning Advisor Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50656257.txt	§Performance and Planning Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Performance and Planning Advisor§§Advertiser: §Rezource Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§Kia hiwa ra!§Te Pūtahitanga o Te Waipounamu is the Whānau Ora Commissioning Agency for the South Island. Te Pūtahitanga o Te Waipounamu works on behalf of the nine Iwi of Te Waipounamu to determine the best ways to support whānau.  The commissioning agency model contributes to realising the power of Whānau Ora by developing strategies based on four guiding principles:§§Kotahitanga - collaborative approach to integrated solutions and delivery§Kāinga focus - local solutions. Whānau initiated solutions are best.§Panoni hou - innovation through investing in new solutions, encouraging social innovation and entrepreneurship to incentivise new services, new approaches and integrated solutions§Kōkiritanga - partnering for success§The purpose of the position is to improve the planning and performance management capabilities as the organisation transforms through a rapid growth phase.  Responsible for designing and implementing improved strategic and operational planning processes, by supporting the senior management team and staff across the organisation to develop robust, measurable workplans through which delivery can be managed and achieved.§An ability to apply a cultural lens to problem-solving and decision-making by bringing together good business practice balanced with an understanding of the kaupapa of the organisation is fundamental.§Responsibilities include:§Facilitate, develop and deliver a strategic long-term plan as part of the annual investment plan.§Foster and develop a planning and performance reporting focus which encourages engagement across Whānau Ora entities and internally within Te Pūtahitanga o Te Waipounamu§Support the Chief Operating Officer by running internal forums to gather performance and planning requirements from workstreams.§Support, maintain and monitor internal monthly and annual planning and performance processes.§Provide performance reports as required by the Pouārahi and senior management team.§Work with team leads/managers to inform the design and development of the performance and planning systems and processes.§Maintain three-year accreditation with Te Wana and the Accreditation Alliance Australia-New Zealand.§You will have:§Exceptional communication skills§Well developed facilitation skills with the ability to present information§Solid track record of development and successful implementation of strategic plans, business plans and performance management reporting§Strong analytical skills §Self-motivated, organised and confident §Competency and confidence in Te Reo Māori me ōna tikanga and a willingness to proactively develop these§§For confidential enquiries, please contact Vanessa Hutchins 027 221 8960 or Chan Collin §0275 401 027§ §Applications close 14th October 2020§§§§

jobText: TXT/50657848.txt	§Principal Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Principal Advisor§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Education§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§Kia ora, Bula Vinaka, Fakaalofa lahi atu, Fakatalofa atu, Kia orana, Malo e lelei, Malo ni, Talofa lava, Tena koutou katoa and welcome.§Permanent - full-time§Provide timely, quality advice and support for operational policy, and internal process management in support of leadership team roles in the property delivery functions§Help shape the future of education§At the Ministry of Education, we work together to shape an education system that delivers equitable and excellent outcomes.§Our organisation is made up of more than 3,000 talented and committed people around New Zealand, from a wide range of backgrounds and cultures.§While we work in different groups and on different things, we all strive every day to make the biggest difference we can for every child, young person and adult student in our education system.§ About us§Education Infrastructure Service (EIS), a part of the Ministry of Education, creates and supports safe, healthy, inspiring and ICT enabled learning environments. EIS manages the Crown's second largest property portfolio of around 2,100 schools with a book value of $18.3 billion, is responsible for the largest payroll in the country, and transports over 100,000 students to and from school each day.§ About the role§Reporting to the Chief Advisor in Wellington, you will support future planning and analysis (looking over the horizon, to support Managers working on day to day matters) in support of the School Property Strategy.§Your key accountabilities will include the following:§Proactively leading the investigation, monitoring (to ensure any implementation activities are completed) and closure of escalated risks and issues. This will include researching and analysing the impact, challenging assumptions or direction where required, and pulling together options/recommendations for next steps or responses to stakeholders. This may also include leading/supporting resolution activities§Supporting senior leaders in the Northern region to develop and deliver projects/strategies, particularly as this relates to roll growth, including personally leading business improvement projects or activities as needed; and§Developing cohesive working relationships and collaboration opportunities with key internal stakeholders to progress projects, promote property delivery's position and strengthen policy and operational ties§About you§You will have a Tertiary qualification in an appropriate field and will also offer:§the ability to take a strategic focus on issues, understand issues within a wider business context, and to develop and implement sound, well-reasoned strategies that achieve the required outcomes§excellent written and verbal communication skills§strong relationship management and engagement skills, and the ability to quickly establish trust and credibility.§If you'd like to bring your skills to a rewarding role within an organisation that's continuously reaching goals and striving for a better future for New Zealand, we'd love to hear from you.§ Are you ready to make a difference?§We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds, including Māori, Pacific and those with disabilities, who will enrich our understanding of the education system.§As a government agency, the Ministry is committed to keeping to the Treaty of Waitangi's guiding principles in our work for and with Māori students, their whānau, hapū and iwi.§Please review the job description and if this opportunity interests you, and you meet the requirements, apply now using the 'apply online' button. §For further information please contact Stephanie Phillips at §eis.recruitment@education.govt.nz§§Applications close midnight on Tuesday, 13 October 2020.§Click here to view the role description§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

This really is a social programme with a difference!§          §The Service and System Design team works hand in hand with the Tāmaki community for a better future. They empower local people to identify problems and opportunities, and then support them to develop innovative ideas and solutions.  They use systems thinking methodologies to champion for positive change and drive collective action across other government partners.§ §As Service and System Designer, you will be passionate about unlocking the potential of people and communities. You will draw from your frontline experience (e.g. practitioner, researcher, advocate) along with your understanding of the structural and systemic conditions that maintain disadvantage in communities like Tamaki to coach and support others to identify opportunities for change. You will be creative and tenacious pulling together partners to prototype, test and implement solutions.  § §To be considered for this position you will have the following attributes:§ § §Empathy§ §Cultural awareness§ §Be comfortable working with ambiguity and open to change§ §Big picture focused§ §Collaborative style and a team player§ §Ideally experience working in social services, mental health services or similar§ §We would especially love to hear from people who have a strong connection to Tāmaki, through experience living / working in the area, and a passion for achieving positive change.§ §If this sounds like an exciting opportunity for you then do not hesitate to get in touch.
