jobTitle: Adviser – Regional Strategy Job in Taranaki - SEEK
xenophobe: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?
jobText: TXT/50670565.txt	§Adviser – Regional Strategy§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Adviser – Regional Strategy§§Advertiser: §Venture Taranaki Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Taranaki§, §New Plymouth§§Salary§§$60,000 - $74,999§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§Adviser – Regional Strategy§Who are you?§As the Adviser – Regional Strategy, you will play a key role in our activities by analysing and collating inputs for the regional strategy, refining and prioritising action plans and supporting sectoral initiatives to underpin our economic development initiatives.  §The role requires excellent writing and analysing skills, experience in developing and implementing collaborative initiatives, and the ability to offer clear, coherent thoughts to help shape thinking. A keen interest in sectors such as energy, engineering and manufacturing would be an advantage.§If this sounds like you, and you want to be part of our regional development team in Taranaki at a pivotal time of change and opportunity, then the Adviser role is one you will relish.§The role will be based in Taranaki, is full time, fixed-term, concludes 30 June 2021 and requires someone for immediate start. § §Who are we?§Venture Taranaki, the Regional Development Agency for Taranaki, is a small, high-performing team widely acknowledged as making a significant difference to the Taranaki region through what we do and how we do it.§Our vision for the future is a Taranaki economy that supports the well-being of our people and environment, underpinned by resilient enterprises, economies and communities. We do this by promoting Taranaki as a great place to learn, live, work, play, visit and create; providing enterprise support and enablement; undertaking research and thought leadership and promoting investment opportunities. §Applications §Monday 12 October 2020§. Please submit all applications on Seek – including CV and a covering letter (with reasons for wanting the job and earliest start date). § §See below for a copy of the position description. § § §Position Description:§ADVISER§ §Accountable to: General Manager Regional Strategy and Sectors§Location:  New Plymouth, Taranaki§Date:  1 October 2020§ §1. The Organisation§ §Venture Taranaki Trust (VT, or the Trust) is Taranaki’s regional development and promotion agency, encompassing a wide range of activities, spanning local and regional economic development and strategy, enterprise innovation and growth, regional promotion and marketing, sector development, and major event attraction. The Trust is a Council Controlled Organisation of the New Plymouth District Council, is governed by an independent Board of Trustees, and guided by the principles of Te Tiriti o Waitangi.§ §The long-term impact that we are working towards is a Taranaki economy that supports the well-being of our people and environment, underpinned by resilient enterprises, economies and communities. We do this by:§• Promoting Taranaki as a great place to learn, live, work, play, visit and create§• Providing enterprise support and enablement§• Undertaking research and thought leadership§• Promoting investment in Taranaki.§ §Our work is also guided by Make Way for Taranaki Tapuae Roa, Taranaki’s regional economic development strategy, and by the Taranaki 2050 Roadmap for transitioning to a low emissions economy.  § §Working for us§Venture Taranaki is a small, high-performing team widely acknowledged as making a significant difference to the Taranaki region through what we do and how we do it. We encourage ongoing innovation and improvement and have a strong focus on staff engagement and workplace culture.  The services and projects we deliver are varied and interesting and we endeavour to expose our team to a range of engaging and challenging work. Venture Taranaki is here to serve Taranaki and working with the Trust will allow you to make a meaningful contribution to the community on a daily basis.§ §2. The Role§ §The Adviser role is responsible for advisory and analyst support for the functions of the Regional Strategy and Sector team. This includes analysing and collating inputs to strategy, drafting action plan(s) and submissions, and supporting thought-leadership pieces.  The position also provides analysis, coordination and support for sector activity.  §A key focus of the role is supporting the forward progress, integration and prioritisation of the Taranaki 2050/Tapuae Roa action plans, development of the strategic narrative, promotion and implementation of regional development initiatives.§ §This role is a fixed term contract, on the basis that the position concludes upon completion of the contracted project at 30 June 2021.§ § §Team: Regional Strategy and Sectors  §Reports to: General Regional Strategy and Sectors  §Direct reports: Nil§Indirect reports: Nil§Operating Budget:    As per VT delegation policies§Delegated authority: As per VT delegations and policies§Stakeholders – internal: • VT Board of Trustees§• All VT functions and employees§Stakeholders – external: • Government agencies§• Industry bodies and sector groups§• Taranaki Territorial Local Authorities (TLAs) – NPDC, STDC, SDC and TRC§• Contractors, consultants as required§ § §3. Responsibilities§ §• Supporting the development and implementation of regional and sector strategies and action plans, through analysis and collation of inputs and feedback, and supporting planning and co-ordination.§• Drafting strategies, actions plans and submissions to government proposals§• Supporting the development of ‘thought-leadership’ papers by co-ordinating providers (as appropriate) and production process§• Supporting sector development work by providing analytical support and co-ordinating and collating inputs and feedback, as well as identifying potential growth opportunities or tactics for sectors, and identifying potential new and emerging sectors for the region§• Assisting with project delivery.§• Preparing materials to support regional strategy and sector activity, such as presentations, reports, website material etc§ §Note: These duties may change from time to time to meet operational or other requirements.§ § §4. Skills, Knowledge and Behaviours§ §VT’s core competencies below, outline the skills, knowledge and behaviours that are important to the organisation.§ §Relationship§Management§• Builds and maintains positive working relationships with internal and external stakeholders  §• Works well as part of the immediate and the wider team and is supportive and respectful of other team members  §• Consults and collaborates with others as appropriate§• Represents VT in a professional and diplomatic manner§• Demonstrates cultural and political awareness§Planning and Organisation§• Demonstrates effective project management skills§• Demonstrates effective time management skills§• Prioritises competing demands without compromising the quality of work delivered§• Plans ahead and completes projects  §Communication§• Is confident communicating clearly and persuasively to a range of audiences  §• Employs the most appropriate method/medium of communication to reach the desired audience§• Is able to communicate complex ideas and issues in a way that is easy to understand§Problem-solving§• Demonstrates a solutions-based approach to overcoming problems in a positive and constructive manner§• Analyses relevant information in a rational manner to form evidence-based judgements§• Demonstrates creativity and innovation when assessing problems and developing solutions§Strategic Thinking§• Demonstrates knowledge and understanding of the regional, national and international context VT operates within§• Understands the strategic goals of VT and what these mean at an operational level§• Proactively plans and takes appropriate action to achieve goals  §• Demonstrates an awareness of the political environment that VT operates within as a public service entity§Innovation and Change • Looks for opportunities to make improvements and add value§• Works cooperatively with others to develop innovative solutions§• Sees opportunities and responds positively to change§• Is open to feedback and seeks out personal opportunities to learn and grow§Health, Safety and Wellbeing • Complies with the Health & Safety at Work Act 2015 and VT’s internal health and safety policies and procedures§• Takes reasonable care of own health and safety while at work§• Actively contributes to promoting a safe working environment§ §5. Qualifications, Experience and Personal Attributes§ §• Strong customer-centric orientation, relationship skills and teamwork§• Experience in developing and implementing collaborative strategies§• Understanding of systems-thinking§• Independent thinking capable of acting as soundboard and able to offer clear, coherent thoughts to challenge and shape thinking§• High standard of communication skills and ability to relate to people across all levels, business sizes, sectors and business maturity§• Ability to clearly articulate ideas and thoughts verbally, and to make presentations to others§• Solution oriented focus  able to evaluate information, problem solve and offer potential solutions§• Collaborative inclusive approach to work practice§• Knowledge of how businesses operate, the issues faced by companies seeking to attract and retain talent§• Knowledge of relevant local, regional, and government  §• A tertiary level qualification in a relevant discipline or equivalent experience§• High level of computer literacy§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50671023.txt	§Principal Workforce Planner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Principal Workforce Planner§§Advertiser: §NZDF§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§$93746 - $115803 including 4% super contriubution§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§What you will do§You'll be responsible for the development, articulation and maintenance of workforce strategy and work programme, that aligns with the overarching NZDF strategic intent and personnel requirements, contributing to the overall NZDF workforce strategy.§You’ll support strategic workforce planning leadership in facilitating end-to-end strategic workforce planning approach including:§Conducting environmental scanning;§Workforce segmentation;§Supply and demand analysis;§Scenario planning and gap analysis; and§The monitoring of critical workforce segments.§You’ll also facilitate the development and monitoring of personnel costs within NZDF, to help to identify internal and external workforce factors that could affect growth, translating these into business priorities to influence HR programmes and initiative priorities.§What we need§A respected and influential leader with experience contributing to high level strategic planning. You will have exceptional analytical skills and the ability to translate raw data into information and knowledge through the use of dashboards, data visualization and reports, as well as having the ability to interpret, synthesise and convey meaning from data. §You’ll be skilled at critically analysing complex quantitative/qualitative data and translating the findings into easy to understand presentations, as well as making effective recommendations, as well as:§Have experience working across strategic workforce planning activities;§Be able to find constructive pathways through varied, conflicting and diverse viewpoints and needs;§Have strong skills in stakeholder management and communication as well as logical, investigative, evaluative, and adaptive thinking skills;  §Knowledge and understanding of the public sector;§Experience in making strategic level decisions;§Proven experience in leading, managing and successfully implementing projects; and §A relevant tertiary qualification in business or project management. §Who we are§Enhancement of combat capability is dependent on the management of a sustainable workforce. NZDF leaders are expected to manage their workforce resource and make informed workforce decisions to achieve NZDF priorities.§To do so they must be supported by strategic workforce planning, excellent people analytics, reporting and insights enabling them to balance their short term priorities with their ongoing responsibility to steward the workforce for the future.§The Workforce Planning, Systems and AnalyticsUnit is responsible for providing this support by developing and integrating workforce strategy and supporting HR plans and initiatives for the overall NZDF effect of generating a sustainable workforce.§Every hour of every day, 365 days of the year, the New Zealand Defence Force is contributing to the defence, security and well-being of Aotearoa / New Zealand. As a modern, professional military, it is our goal to maintain well trained, equipped and disciplined armed forces that can react to crisis at short notice. §Why Us§NZDF is an inclusive organisation that is open to flexible working arrangements and welcomes applications from people regardless of gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, age, beliefs/opinions, or family circumstances.§In return for your expertise, dedication and hard work, NZDF is offering remuneration reflective of your experience, along with:§Great benefits for you and your family§;§5 weeks annual leave per year;§Variety, challenge and a chance to influence;§Flexible working environment and positive culture.§How to Apply§To view the Position Description and to Apply Online please visit our §Defence Careers§ website, or use the links on this page. For further information, contact Andre Davies on 021 954 043.§Please note:§ If you are an existing NZDF employee (excluding contractors) you must apply through our Internal Vacancies site, via the HR Toolkit.§Applications close on §Sunday 18 October 2020§.§Please note: §Applicants must be legally entitled to work in New Zealand (NZ) and be able to obtain and maintain the required level of NZ Government security clearance for the position applied for.§The minimum citizenship and residency criteria for security clearances to be granted by the NZ Defence Force are as follows:§Higher level Security Clearance§most preferably a NZ citizen who §has resided continuously§ in this country for the last §10 years§, OR§is a citizen of, §and/or has resided continuously§ in one or more of the following countries for the last §10 years§: either Australia, Canada, NZ, UK or the USA; §and§ has a background history that is verifiable and can be assessed as appropriate by the NZSIS towards a recommendation of suitability for a security clearance at a higher level.§If you do not meet these minimum criteria, we will not be able to accept your application.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

We have more than 3500 people working across 120 locations around the country, all working towards our vision of a safe and just New Zealand.§§Joining the Ministry of Justice means you will become part of an inclusive organisation that values you and the communities we serve. We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated.§§This is an exciting new role within our National Service Delivery, Operations Support Team, in a newly established workforce planning and performance function. If so, contact our Economist today.§  §The work we do really makes a difference and if you are someone who is motivated to contribute to the management of Northland's environment, check out the position description and apply today!§  §Applications close on 22 October 2020 and must be submitted online.§  §Applicants for this position should have NZ residency/citizenship or a valid NZ work visa.§  § §  §To apply for this job go to: www.nrc.govt.nz/jobs§§§§

jobText: TXT/50674314.txt	§Change Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Change Analyst§§Advertiser: §Zespri International Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§Zespri is more than simply the world’s single-largest marketer of kiwifruit. We like to think of ourselves as fruit on a mission and as rebels with a cause: to help people, communities and the environment around the world thrive through the goodness of kiwifruit.§ §We supply one of the world’s healthiest little superfruits to millions of people around the world in more than 50 markets. We are one of New Zealand’s best-known international brands, dedicated to creating sustainable long-term value for growers.§ §We are growing quickly, driven by our success in engaging more and more consumers and by offering the world’s best kiwifruit 12 months of the year. We have bold ambitions and aim to grow sales from approximately $3 billion in 2018 to $4.5 billion by 2025.§ § § § §Organisational Change Analyst - Contract § The Horizon Organisational Change Analyst will be responsible for supporting the Horizon Program Organisational Change Management Lead in analyzing organisational and role impacts, delivering change artefacts and coordinating change analysis.§ §This includes but not limited to current to future state change analysis across people, process, technology and data, role-based impact assessments, learning needs analysis, business readiness assessment, measurement of change adoption and any documentation that supports the successful implementation of the people-side of change.§   § §Responsibilities:  § § § § The successful candidate will be an experienced business analyst with strong analytic skills and proven experience of working successfully in a change-focused capacity.§ § §Support the Horizon Organisational Change Manager with in change activities associated with preparing for change, managing, and reinforcing change.§ §Perform Change Impact Analysis, Role Impact Assessments and Learning Needs Analysis in conjunction with other key resources and business SMEs, to enable effective change planning.§ §Translate the new system functionality and business processes into a language that an end-user will understand to bring about change including documentation of key change impacts at a solution, functional process and task level.§ §Support the Communications Lead with the design and development of content (SharePoint content and updates, PowerPoint slide decks, Quick Reference Guides, FAQs) as required.§ §Provide support to Regional Delivery Leads / Regional Coordination Managers in preparation of briefings or change communication material.§ §Assist with training needs analysis, participate in training planning and design and training logistics e.g. room bookings, calendar invites, event set-up and management.§ §Provide support in terms of delivering learning and training interventions.§ §Provide support to business leads and end users once the system has been implemented.§ § §Qualifications and Experience:§  § § §Business process management or modelling relevant certification.§ §PROSCI or équivalent change management certification.§ §PRINCE2 Foundation or equivalent project management certification.§ §   § § §Experience working in a fast-paced project or change management environment.§ §Experience working with People & Capability business functions and an understanding of analyzing and documenting learning needs.§ §Very good working knowledge of change management/project principles and methodologies.§ §Ability to quickly understand and translate complex messages into simplistic language.§ §Ability to communicate and relate well with people at all levels of the Organisation.§ §Ability to identify and understand people related impacts and issues.§ §Demonstrates a high standard of professionalism, especially during challenging times for impacted team members.§ §   § All applications should be submitted by §Friday 16th Ocotober §§§§

jobText: TXT/50679923.txt	§Test ONLY. Please DO NOT apply§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Test ONLY. Please DO NOT apply§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Social Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§§§§  §    §Test ONLY. Please DO NOT apply §    §      §Company description:§        §Our Ministry is all about helping to build successful individuals, and in turn building strong, healthy families and communities.§It’s a big job - we’re tackling some of the big issues in society, like family violence.§We’re working towards this through providing:§employment, income support and superannuation services§funding to community service providers§social policy and advice to government§student allowances and loans§social housing assistance.§This is not work we do alone. We work closely with other government agencies, non-government organisations, advisory and industry groups, and communities and iwi. Together we aim to make a positive and lasting difference§Job description:§ Test Only Please DONOT Apply §(TEST REQ - Please DO NOT APPLY)§        §Permanent §        §Auckland or Wellington Based§ §        §Are you a people leader interested in the following?§        § §        §          §Improving outcomes §          §Being part of TEST Technology and Channels group at an exciting time§          §Working with our technology vendor partners to execute and deliver corporate technology services to our staff, enabling them to provide outcomes to children, young people and families.§ §        §        §About the team:§        §Our core business is to support children, young people and their families who are at significant risk of harm now and into the future. To achieve this, we form partnerships with children, families and whānau, iwi, NGOs, and other government agencies and work with our partners to help children thrive.§ §        §Technology and Channels is responsible for the Ministry’s technology strategy, systems and services.  It is an exciting time for the group as we are currently implementing a new operating model so that we can deliver our responsibilities more efficiently.§ §        §Our operating model is founded on three main principles:§        § §        §          §User-centricity is paramount, with a focus on the front-line and the wider sector.§          §We will be cloud-first and asset-light, choosing to buy as-a-service offerings from third party suppliers, rather than own technology assets.§          §Our systems and processes will be agile and enabling, to deliver changes faster, reduce complexity and simplify system interactions.§ §        §        §About the role:§        §As part of our new operating model we will have five dedicated Service Portfolios. Each Service Portfolio will be responsible for a set of systems that is broadly aligned to agency business functions.§ §We are currently seeking a Systems Lead for the Community and Partnering services  portfolio which is focussed on systems for NGOs and information sharing with partner agencies§        § §        §The Systems Lead is responsible for maintaining day-to-day operational oversight of all technology systems within the Service Portfolio. You will have experience in cloud-based infrastructure platforms such as Amazon Web Services and software platforms such as SalesForce.§        §Skills and experience:§        §You will have significant experience as a business analyst and delivery lead or project manager in a large organisation as well as leading delivery of modern technology systems in a large, customer focussed environment.§ §        §In addition to this you will have previous experience with the transition from legacy systems to new and modern cloud based solutions, exposure to complex corporate integrations and excellent analysis skills§        §What we offer§        §We offer a dedicated and supportive team, flexible work options and the opportunity to apply your skills and experience to the wellbeing of tamariki. §        §How to apply (Test- Please DONOT APPLY)§ §        §Test ONLYEmployees – please apply through your myHR portal at work.  This will ensure that your myHR employee profile is visible as internal candidate.§ §        §All external applicants including MSD employees please apply through the apply button and upload your CV and cover letter to our applicant tracking system. Please note all applications must be made online. If you have any questions please contact us (Test only)§ §        §Applications close: Test ONLY§ Position Description §https://jobs.msd.govt.nz/§ §Profile description:§ §Test Only Please DO NOT Apply§        §Test ONLY Employees – please apply through your myHR portal at work.  This will ensure that your myHR employee profile is visible as internal candidate.§ §        §All external applicants including MSD employees please apply through the apply button and upload your CV and cover letter to our applicant tracking system. Please note all applications must be made online. If you have any questions please contact us (Test only)§        § §        §Applications close: Test ONLY§ Position Description §https://jobs.msd.govt.nz/§      §      §The Ministry of Social Development is one of New Zealand's largest government agencies. Our work to achieve better social outcomes affects almost every New Zealander, now or in the future.§        §https://jobs.msd.govt.nz/§      §    §    §  §§§Company description:§Our Ministry is all about helping to build successful individuals, and in turn building strong, healthy families and communities.§It’s a big job - we’re tackling some of the big issues in society, like family violence.§We’re working towards this through providing:§employment, income support and superannuation services§funding to community service providers§social policy and advice to government§student allowances and loans§social housing assistance.§This is not work we do alone. We work closely with other government agencies, non-government organisations, advisory and industry groups, and communities and iwi. Together we aim to make a positive and lasting difference§Job description:§  Test Only Please DONOT Apply  §(TEST REQ - Please DO NOT APPLY)§ §Permanent § §Auckland or Wellington Based§ § §Are you a people leader interested in the following?§ § § § §Improving outcomes § §Being part of TEST Technology and Channels group at an exciting time§ §Working with our technology vendor partners to execute and deliver corporate technology services to our staff, enabling them to provide outcomes to children, young people and families.§ § § §About the team:§ §Our core business is to support children, young people and their families who are at significant risk of harm now and into the future. To achieve this, we form partnerships with children, families and whānau, iwi, NGOs, and other government agencies and work with our partners to help children thrive.§ § §Technology and Channels is responsible for the Ministry’s technology strategy, systems and services.  It is an exciting time for the group as we are currently implementing a new operating model so that we can deliver our responsibilities more efficiently.§ § §Our operating model is founded on three main principles:§ § § § §User-centricity is paramount, with a focus on the front-line and the wider sector.§ §We will be cloud-first and asset-light, choosing to buy as-a-service offerings from third party suppliers, rather than own technology assets.§ §Our systems and processes will be agile and enabling, to deliver changes faster, reduce complexity and simplify system interactions.§ § § §About the role:§ §As part of our new operating model we will have five dedicated Service Portfolios. Each Service Portfolio will be responsible for a set of systems that is broadly aligned to agency business functions.§ §We are currently seeking a Systems Lead for the Community and Partnering services  portfolio which is focussed on systems for NGOs and information sharing with partner agencies§ § § §The Systems Lead is responsible for maintaining day-to-day operational oversight of all technology systems within the Service Portfolio. You will have experience in cloud-based infrastructure platforms such as Amazon Web Services and software platforms such as SalesForce.§ §Skills and experience:§ §You will have significant experience as a business analyst and delivery lead or project manager in a large organisation as well as leading delivery of modern technology systems in a large, customer focussed environment.§ § §In addition to this you will have previous experience with the transition from legacy systems to new and modern cloud based solutions, exposure to complex corporate integrations and excellent analysis skills§ §What we offer§ §We offer a dedicated and supportive team, flexible work options and the opportunity to apply your skills and experience to the wellbeing of tamariki. § §How to apply (Test- Please DONOT APPLY)§ § §Test ONLYEmployees – please apply through your myHR portal at work.  This will ensure that your myHR employee profile is visible as internal candidate.§ § §All external applicants including MSD employees please apply through the apply button and upload your CV and cover letter to our applicant tracking system. Please note all applications must be made online. If you have any questions please contact us (Test only)§ § §Applications close: Test ONLY§    Position Description  §https://jobs.msd.govt.nz/§   §Profile description:§  §Test Only Please DO NOT Apply§  §Test ONLY Employees – please apply through your myHR portal at work.  This will ensure that your myHR employee profile is visible as internal candidate.§ § §All external applicants including MSD employees please apply through the apply button and upload your CV and cover letter to our applicant tracking system. Please note all applications must be made online. jobText: TXT/50680512.txt	§Planning Consultant - Hamilton§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Planning Consultant - Hamilton§§Advertiser: §4Sight Consulting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Salary§§Attractive salary + benefits & flexible working§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§Join § § §One of New Zealand's largest Planning teams§ §A business where people, clients and the environment come first§ §A highly engaged and respected team who love working together§ §A business that prides itself on diversity and flexibility§ §Do you have§ § §A planning degree recognised by the New Zealand Planning Institute.§ §2+ years resource consent and planning experience in New Zealand.§ §Knowledge and experience of applying the Resource Management Act to development and infrastructure.§ §A good working knowledge of district and regional planning and consenting.§ §Excellent organisational and prioritisation skills.§ §An aptitude for building and maintaining great relationships with clients and colleagues.§ §A resilient and adaptable attitude; see yourself as a can-do person with a calm and confident communication style.§ §A drive and passion to achieve outstanding results.§ §Want to work for a business that prides itself on having a great company culture, flexibility in the workplace and encourages staff to reach their potential? Due to increased workload, we have another  exciting opportunity for an Intermediate Planning Consultant based in Hamilton to join our driven and dynamic Planning team.§ §We're looking for another Intermediate Planner who believes in better and has a keen interest in RMA planning. They will have a willingness to work collaboratively to deliver outstanding projects and enjoy having a laugh because although we take our commitment to the business and the environment seriously, we still like to have a lot of fun along the way.§ §As a national planning consultancy, our site visits may be off the beaten track, so a willingness to travel, whether it be by electric car, 4WD or flying, is preferred. The opportunity to be involved in a mixture of projects including, policy development, undertaking planning due diligence, assisting local councils with processing resource consents and acquiring resource consents for a range of development projects is also on offer. Therefore, demonstrated experience in local government and private sector development projects is a must.§ §4Sight is an environmental, planning and landscape architecture consultancy that strives to achieve balanced outcomes for land, people and water so that together, we can thrive. We're committed to finding the best people in the industry to help guide our company into the future because it's the people that make us who we are and set us apart from the competition.§ §Check out our videos on our website to learn more about 4Sight and why our staff love working at 4Sight.§ §So if you're interested, have what it takes and want to work for an established, but still growing New Zealand owned, award-winning consultancy, please apply with a personalised cover letter and CV.  Don't forget to include in your cover letter what attracted you to 4Sight and to this role.§ §For more information or to have a confidential discussion, please contact Christina Walker, Hamilton Planning Manager, by email (§christinaw@4sight.co.nz§) or mobile 021 367 143.§ §We can't wait to hear from you and good luck!§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a consulting role?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Are you willing to relocate for this role?§§§

jobText: TXT/50680586.txt	§Change Implementation Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Change Implementation Manager§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Social Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §Change Implementation Manager §    §      §        §Job Ref: 35023§        §          §Great opportunity to support change initiatives across Service Delivery and the wider Ministry of Social Development§          §Apply structured change methodologies to projects and key business initiatives to support change readiness and embedding changes§          §2 fixed term/secondment positions to June 2021, National Office, Wellington§        §        §Service Delivery is all about working together to make a difference for New Zealanders. The Change Implementation Manager roles are part of a team that supports and embeds changes within Service Delivery. They are vital in leading activities that will support our people to accept, get ready and embed the change.§        §Using your change implementation expertise, you’ll be responsible for;§        §          §Planning and creating structured integrated change implementation plans that ensure the right people and change activities are coordinated in a sequence that makes sense.§          §Creating strong relationships involving all key stakeholders to ensure the needs of our people are met and there is a smooth transition for impacted stakeholders.§          §Ensuring people who need to know about the change are engaged with and supported and that the end goal is conveyed.§          §Implementing and delivering the change activities necessary to drive and support successful change including supporting the communication, engagement, training and post implementation activities to embed the required changes.§          §Analysing the impacts from several perspectives to identify any gaps and understand what supports, connections, and resources are needed.§          §Understanding what other changes are impacting our people across Service Delivery so you can provide an integrated approach.§        §        §To be successful in these roles you’ll need to have a real passion for change and supporting people to understand and accept change. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. We are a Treaty partner committed to strengthening relationships with§ §Māori,§ §Hapū§,§ Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.§        §If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so we can assist you through the recruitment process.§      §      §The Ministry of Social Development is one of New Zealand's largest government agencies. Our work to achieve better social outcomes affects almost every New Zealander, now or in the future.§        §https://jobs.msd.govt.nz/§      §    §    §  §§§Job Ref: 35023§ § §Great opportunity to support change initiatives across Service Delivery and the wider Ministry of Social Development§ §Apply structured change methodologies to projects and key business initiatives to support change readiness and embedding changes§ §2 fixed term/secondment positions to June 2021, National Office, Wellington§ §Service Delivery is all about working together to make a difference for New Zealanders. The Change Implementation Manager roles are part of a team that supports and embeds changes within Service Delivery. They are vital in leading activities that will support our people to accept, get ready and embed the change.§ §Using your change implementation expertise, you’ll be responsible for;§ § §Planning and creating structured integrated change implementation plans that ensure the right people and change activities are coordinated in a sequence that makes sense.§ §Creating strong relationships involving all key stakeholders to ensure the needs of our people are met and there is a smooth transition for impacted stakeholders.§ §Ensuring people who need to know about the change are engaged with and supported and that the end goal is conveyed.§ §Implementing and delivering the change activities necessary to drive and support successful change including supporting the communication, engagement, training and post implementation activities to embed the required changes.§ §Analysing the impacts from several perspectives to identify any gaps and understand what supports, connections, and resources are needed.§ §Understanding what other changes are impacting our people across Service Delivery so you can provide an integrated approach.§ §To be successful in these roles you’ll need to have a real passion for change and supporting people to understand and accept change. Experience managing multiply pieces of work at the same time and working to deadlines is an advantage. You’ll be supporting anything from a small process changes to large business improvements giving a wide variety of work and engagement with people.§ §How to apply§ §To apply, click the 'Apply Now' button to upload your CV and cover letter outlining your suitability for this role.§ §All applications must be made online. If this is not possible or if you have any queries, please contact us at §jobs@msd.govt.nz§ §Applications close: 5pm Sunday, 18 October 2020.§ §Position Description§ §tp://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/dce-service-delivery/strategy-and-change/change-implementation-manager-dec-19.docx§ §Joining us§ §Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents. We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. and the role§ § §Strong demand for our consulting services has created an opportunity for a talented economist with data science skills to join our team.  We offer a stimulating work environment in science skills.§ §You will either have previous experience as an economic consultant or excellent University grades if you are a recent graduate (GPA of 8+).§ §Our work focusses mainly on the economics of tourism, events and regional development, so a background in one or more of these areas would be highly desirable.  You will need to have good research and problem solving skills, and be capable of writing clear and concise reports.§ §You will also have the skills required to manage our in-house data assets which include data feeds from third parties (e.g. Stats NZ), survey data, dashboards, and websites we've developed to collect and report data.  We work with a lot of spatial data, so knowledge of shapefiles and mapping is essential.  Some of our datasets are very large, so you will need the skills to manage and manipulate these. § §We currently use R to process large datasets and Shiny to build dashboards, so knowledge of these products is essential.§ §You will have a strong work ethic, be comfortable working on multiple projects at the same time, and enjoy being part of a small but highly effective team. § §If you believe you meet our high standards, please submit and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Whānau Āwhina Plunket is committed to giving every New Zealand child the best possible start.§        §About you§        §As an experienced Principal Advisor working in performance and reporting, you'll provide intellectual leadership, analysis, and advice on organisational performance and reporting to support Whānau Āwhina Plunket in the delivery of our strategic goals.§        §You'll work alongside the Head of Performance, Reporting and Assurance to provide timely and effective support to our senior leaders and their teams on planning, performance measurement, monitoring and reporting. ideally within a government or a not-for-profit organisation§          §Strong analytical and critical-thinking skills with a real passion for turning strategy into action, driving performance improvement and providing insightful reporting that tells the full performance story§          §A flair for translating what can be complex information into simple, easy to understand insights across a multi-layered audience - as such we are open to flexible working arrangements for the right candidate.§Click here to view the role description§        §For more information or to apply for this role please refer to www.plunket.org.nz/careers or contact HR and Careers (§HRandCareers@plunket.org.nz§).§        §Applications close Monday, 19 October 2020.§        §§      §      §      §    §    §In the first 1000 days we make the difference of a lifetime§  §§§Join a supportive workplace with excellent team culture and a rewarding vision§Use your expertise to help drive a high-performance culture§Partner with our senior leaders and managers§Help one of New Zealand's most trusted and respected brands to grow and develop, so we can keep making a difference to Kiwi families.§About us§The first 1000 days of a child's life are vastly important - jobText: TXT/50684651.txt	§Senior Research and Evaluation Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Research and Evaluation Analyst§§Advertiser: §Ministry for Pacific Peoples§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§ § §Enriching Aotearoa with thriving Pacific communities through robust research and evaluation evidence, and insights§ §Connecting with Pacific communities and across government to lead insightful research for better Pacific people outcomes§ §Working collaboratively across Evaluation and Policy work§ § As a Senior researcher in your field - you will be responsible for the delivery of work across Research and Evaluation programmes.  You will bring a Pacific community lens to the research work where experience in research frameworks and methodologies promote positive Pacific outcomes. §  § §Our purpose§ § § The Ministry for Pacific Peoples make a significant contribution to improve outcomes for Pacific People. We bring the Pacific voice, perspective and understanding into fabric of New Zealand government. We are the guardians and the caretakers of Pacific knowledge, culture, and identity, and we support and take stewardship over our Pacific communities and peoples. We have a key role in developing cross government collaboration and coordination of government’s Pacific investments.§ § §What you will do in this role is:§ § §working in collaboration with the wider Research and Evaluation team, you will deliver research and evaluation work that feeds into key programmes such as Tupu Aotearoa and Toloa which strengthen the delivery of programmes for Pacific peoples.§ §undertake quantitative and qualitative research that provides accurate data to ensure the delivery of significant research programmes are successful.§ §provide support to the Director Research and Evaluation in the Pacific Data Sovereignty Network – this is key development for Pacific research.§ §provide insightful research for the COVID-19 Pacific recovery package - ensuring the policy development can be targeted for better Pacific outcomes.§ §support and influence in rolling out best practice and processes around the Ministry’s research and evaluation work.§ §support the translation of research into policy – working closely with the Policy team to ensure policy planning and development are informed by robust research evidence and insights.§ §contribute to a key Ministry programme established in Languages research so undertaking significant and ground-breaking research that promotes a wider understanding of Pacific peoples’ views, experience, cultures and languages.§ §providing robust research and evaluation advice which contributes to the Ministry’s reputation as a centre of excellence in Pacific research, ensuring high-quality advice is provided that brings credibility and assurance through building a strong network of stakeholders from across government, not-for-profit, Pacific community groups and industry sectors.§ § §To be successful in this role you will bring:§ § §strong delivery of solid research and evaluation, demonstrating a robustness around research and evaluation methodologies, approaches and outcomes.§ §good network across smaller Pacific ethnic communities that enables collaboration and focus on positive research outcomes for Pacific People.§ §postgraduate qualification and a background in education, preferably in early childhood education and care.§ §excellent written communication and verbal skills, with the ability to confidently communicate with a variety of audiences.§ §good understanding of the machinery of government and how to navigate it.§ §strong stakeholder engagement skills and the ability to engage with different sectors of the Pacific communities.§ § §Working for us§ § § At the Ministry for Pacific Peoples, we offer attractive employment benefits including market salary, healthcare insurance, flexible working arrangements and family friendly policies. Whilst the work is challenging, you be rewarded by contributing to positive outcomes with a focus on better outcomes for our Pacific People.§  § At the Ministry for Pacific Peoples, we recognise that diversity, inclusion, and accessibility is important to our business. We embrace the unique perspective and capabilities of our current and future employees, which will help us continue to drive innovation for our Pacific People and achieve our Lalanga Fou goals. Our culture enables us to create an environment of involvement, respect, and connection with the communities where we work - benefitting individual employees and our Pacific People across New Zealand§  § If you would like more information please email §recruitment@mpp.govt.nz§ quoting the position title in the subject.  Applications will be reviewed throughout advertising and we may reach out to you if further information is required. §  § §Applications close on Sunday 11 October 2020.§ For a copy of the position description, please click on the link below.§ https://www.mpp.govt.nz/assets/Uploads/Senior-Analyst-Research-and-Evaluation.pdf§  §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50685853.txt	§Principal Advisor - Strategic Languages Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Principal Advisor - Strategic Languages Development§§Advertiser: §Ministry for Pacific Peoples§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§ § §Languages development will sit front and centre across multiple programmes of work§ §Passion and linguistic experience in the revitalisation of Pacific Languages § §High-performing team that reaches across government and communities to support collaborative work § §  § You will provide support and professional leadership to the languages unit and deliver high quality, robust advice relating to the theory and practice of language revitalisation. A key function of the role is the ability to lead and influence change at a systems and strategic level, be innovative and forward thinking.§  § §Our purpose §  § The Ministry for Pacific People make a significant contribution to improve outcomes for Pacific People. We bring the Pacific voice, perspective and understanding into fabric of New Zealand government. We are the guardians and the caretakers of Pacific knowledge, culture, and identity, and we support and take stewardship over our Pacific communities and peoples. We have a key role in developing cross government collaboration and coordination of government’s Pacific investments.§  § §What you will do in this role is:§ § §Support the Director of Languages to identify and lead strategic development for new opportunities to enhance the languages across our Pacific nations into wider government programmes – influencing social policy through relationships.§ §Lead strategic language development work across community, cross-agency and project teams to support and influence language revitalisation of Pacific Languages into fabric of Aotearoa.§ §Develop reports, papers and submissions to Cabinet Office and Select Committee for Language related information.§ §Provide intellectual and linguistic subject matter expertise and leadership in language development programmes both within the Ministry and to external agencies and organisations.§ §Providing robust language design that meets agency and /or community culture, values and operating models§ §  § §To be successful in this role you will bring:§ § §Linguistic background and solid experience in languages ideally within an Education background§ §Sound network across government, and across Education sector that enables collaboration and focus towards better outcomes for Pacific People around language revitalisation.§ §Excellent written communication and verbal skills, with the ability to confidently communicate with a variety of audiences.§ §Good understanding of the machinery of government and how to navigate it.§ §Strong stakeholder engagement skills and the ability to engage with different audiences.§ §  § §Working for us§  § At Ministry for Pacific People, we offer attractive employment benefits including market salary, healthcare insurance, flexible working arrangements and family friendly policies. Whilst the work is challenging, you be rewarded by contributing to positive outcomes with a focus on better outcomes for our Pacific People.§  § At Ministry for Pacific People, we recognise that diversity, inclusion, and accessibility is important to our business. We embrace the unique perspective and capabilities of our current and future employees, which will help us continue to drive innovation for our Pacific People and achieve our Lalanga Fou goals. Our culture enables us to create an environment of involvement, respect, and connection with the communities where we work - benefitting individual employees and our Pacific People across New Zealand§  § If you would like more information or a position description, please email §recruitment@mpp.govt.nz§ quoting the position title in the subject.  Applications will be reviewed throughout advertising and we may reach out to you if further information is required. §  § §Applications close on Sunday 25 October 2020.§  §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50685996.txt	§Head of Operations - Data Ventures§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Head of Operations - Data Ventures§§Advertiser: §Stats NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§$150,000 - $169,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§About Us | Mō mātou§ §Data Ventures focuses on bringing together the right data across private and public sectors that are not readily available or accessible. We aim to remove the road blocks that prevent access  to data to help customers make the best decisions for their businesses.§ §We've been successful in supporting Aotearoa NZ's COVID-19 response, providing critical datasets to pandemic modelling and reporting on how well we behaved during the different alert levels.§ §Our work isn't finished; there's now a focus on how can we measure and monitor the recovery of the economy and wellbeing of Aoteroa New Zealand.§ §The role | Mō te tūnga§ §As Head of Operations, you report to the Executive Director (ED) of Data Ventures, and are second in charge, deputising for the ED when required. This is a critical internally focused role and you'll be responsible for operational strategy, commercial direction and internal systems. There's also an external focus and responsibility to lead data provider relationships, who are key stakeholders to our customers' success.§ §As a senior leader, you're also a key member of the Stats NZ's Senior Leadership team – accountable for planning for our future, demonstrating collective leadership, and delivering agreed outputs to budget that support and achieve our overall strategic intentions.§ §About you | Mōu§ §We're looking for someone with a good understanding of how government agencies work and who enjoys engaging with other leaders to gain mutual benefits. To be successful in this role, you will bring:§ § §Proven operational leadership experience with business planning and forecasting, especially through periods of growth.§ §Experience of brokering value between two parties ensuring on-going and long-term relationships§ §Strong strategic thinking and conceptual skills, sound commercial judgement and well-developed financial management skills§ §Proven relationship, negotiation, interpersonal, coaching and listening skills with the ability to communicate at all levels of an organisation§ §Political nous with the ability to build and maintain trust and confidence of customers and stakeholders (ideally within a government context)§ §What's in it for you | Āwhina§ §You'll be joining an inclusive environment where people, regardless of gender, race, disability, religion or background are supported to be able to do their best work. This includes:§ § §Opportunity to lead a team and generate continued success§ §Interesting and meaningful work that benefits Aotearoa New Zealand§ §Flexible work that supports balancing life and work commitments§ §An inclusive environment where you can be yourself§ §Health and wellbeing support and services§ §How to apply | Me pēhea te tuku tono§ §To view the position description click on or copy and paste this link §https://bit.ly/3l8bnnm§ to your browser.§ §If you are looking for a new challenge and this sounds like you, please apply.§ §Any questions about the role please contact §jobs@stats.govt.nz§ §Applications close 23 October 2020 at 11:55pm and we will be screening and actioning as we receive them so don't delay, apply now. § §You must have the right to live and work in Aotearoa New Zealand to apply for this job§§§§

jobTitle: Senior Consultant, Programme Management Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50686293.txt	§Senior Consultant, Programme Management§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Consultant, Programme Management§§Advertiser: §Allen & Clarke Policy & Regulatory Specialists§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Other§§§§§§Are you ready for a new challenge?  §Allen + Clarke §is looking for an experienced programme manager to join our team.§ §About Us / Ko wai mātou § §Allen + Clarke§ is a consulting company that works with government, NGO and private sector clients on projects that matter. Our Governance, Secretariat and Programmes Practice provides expert services including programme and project management, governance advice and secretariat services, contract, and grant management, and supports independent reviews and inquiries. We work collaboratively with colleagues in our other Practices (Policy + Regulatory and Evaluation + Research) to produce high quality work for our clients. Our projects can be long or short term. They can be individual, or team based. Some are delivered from our offices; others are delivered at our clients.§ §The opportunity / Te Whiwhinga mahi§ §We are looking for an experienced project or programme manager who can provide our clients with hands-on expertise designing and delivering programmes or discrete  projects in major policy, legislative or business change areas. This is a dynamic and challenging position where you will be working across §Allen + Clarke§ and with clients to design and deliver small- and large-scale programmes and projects in a range of policy, regulatory, governance, strategy, business optimisation, research, and evaluation areas.§ §You will have proven ability in project methodology, experience in stakeholder and community engagement, intellectual acumen, and understanding of strategic objectives and what is required to achieve them. You will work efficiently, bringing a calm head to pressured environments. You will also be confident in networking, creating opportunities and securing new business. As a senior consultant, you will  have an important role in raising internal competency in project management.§ §Our consultants are flexible, proactive, hard-working, and committed. They care and want to make a difference. They know how to work with pace. They never lose sight of quality. They are good at identifying opportunities, risks and issues and mitigating them to ensure success for our clients.§ §About you / Ko wai koe:§ §You will be able to:§ § §Design, plan, and implement programmes and projects including governance frameworks, schedules, reporting, resource, and quality management§ §Produce project briefs, proposals, and business cases including methodology, resource, and budget requirements§ §Identify, analyse, document, manage and monitor issues, risks and opportunities that arise§ §Advise on and negotiate priorities, constraints, interdependencies, requirements, methodology options, phases and decision points§ §Develop and maintain effective and efficient working relationships with internal and external stakeholders§ §Confidently speak with clients, stakeholders, and diverse communities§ §Work on numerous different projects at once, with a high level of ambiguity§ §Network and create business opportunities and feel comfortable in this space§ §Be comfortable with a varied work schedule of very busy periods of client work, and periods of self-directed business improvement and development§ §Coach and support team members in professional skills, and§ §Care and want to make a difference.§ §We think the best candidates will have 5+ years’ experience in providing programme management in public or private sector organisations.§ §To apply for this position please email a covering letter and your CV to Lizzie Johnsen at §recruitment@allenandclarke.co.nz§. A copy of the position description is available on request.§ §Applications close / Rā Katinga: § §Applications will close on Monday the 26th of October at 5pm.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50687089.txt	§Portfolio Manager - Safer Commercial Transport§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Portfolio Manager - Safer Commercial Transport§§Advertiser: §NZ Transport Agency§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Portfolio Manager - Safer Commercial Transport §    §    §      §        § §        §          §This is an exciting and important new role in a new team, and you have the chance to make it your own.§          §It's a great opportunity to help develop a better approach to regulating commercial transport in New Zealand§          §You'll be responsible for national portfolios and regulatory assurance programmes aimed at improving long-term behavioural change and safety §          §Locations: Auckland (Upper North Island), Hamilton (Central North Island), Wellington (Lower North Island), and Christchurch or Dunedin (South Island)§        §        § §        §About us | Ko wai mātou§        § At Waka Kotahi NZ Transport Agency, it all starts with our people. The organisation's performance and success depend on the people who choose to make this a great place to work and make a difference for Aotearoa. The Transport Agency has a strong future focus, understanding that new technologies and changing customer expectations mean the transport system we know today will not be the one we deliver in ten years' time.§        §This is an exciting time for the Regulatory Services Group as we set ourselves up for future success delivering end-to-end regulatory services that are sharply focused on outcomes and delivering our regulatory purpose and objectives.  § § We have a rare opportunity to drive positive change that will make a difference to the way we work and the outcomes we can deliver for the public. Safety is a top priority for Waka Kotahi and we, as the Regulatory Services group, aim to improve safety and reduce the risk of harm by being a firm and fair regulator applying principles of good practice grounded in Te Ao Maori - Whakapono (Integrity), Manaakitanga (Caring for people), Whanaungatanga (Relationships) and Kotahitanga (Unity).§        §To view our regulatory strategy§ : §please visit §Tu Ake, Tu Maia - Stand Up, Stand Firm§        §Our purpose is to ensure that the system is safe, effective, efficient and functions well for everyone in New Zealand.§        §Being a real-world regulator means:§        §We take a systems view that is focused on improving safety outcomes and reducing harm, we work to understand why people behave the way they do and are pragmatic in how we respond, we encourage and educate to support people to comply and enforce compliance when necessary.§        § §        §The opportunity | Te Whiwhinga mahi§        §The purpose of the Portfolio Manager role is to take ownership of developing and driving strategy, business planning, with oversight of operational delivery of the national safer commercial transport regulatory function. The goal is innovation with clear focus on outcomes, partnerships looking for win win outcomes that lock in long term behavioural change, and effectiveness and efficiency to achieve the biggest bang for our buck from our resources.§        §We are looking for someone with vision and flair who can bring a fresh approach to our business. We need someone who is innovative, can build relationships with industry, will take calculated risks to achieve outcomes, and has a proven ability to get things done. You'll enjoy working as part of a close, collaborative team, and you'll have a clear vision and the freedom to get things done. You'll own your role and will be responsible for the business outcomes.§        §In this exciting new role you'll report directly to the Senior Manager, Safer Commercial Transport. This is a great opportunity for someone with energy and talent who is ready to embrace the challenge of shaping a senior role.§        § §        §About you | Ko koe tēnei§        §To be successful in this role, you will bring:§        §          §Proven experience in bringing together multidisciplinary teams from across sectors to solve large complex issues.§          §Experience in creating a motivational work environment and enabling high performance§          §Experience leading change management and continuous improvement initiatives to drive performance and build capability§          §Experience in leading, influencing and building credibility across a range of stakeholders to drive behaviour change§          §An understanding of regulatory practice particularly within the Government context would be helpful §        §        § §        §Applications close | Rā Katinga : Wednesday, 21 October 2020§        §For a copy of the position description: §www.nzta.govt.nz/careers§        §For further information, email: §careers@nzta.govt.nz§        §To be considered for this position you must have a legal right to live and work in New Zealand.§        §NZ Transport Agency is an equal opportunity employer (EOE). jobText: TXT/50687296.txt	§Portfolio Manager - Safer Commercial Transport§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Portfolio Manager - Safer Commercial Transport§§Advertiser: §NZ Transport Agency§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Portfolio Manager - Safer Commercial Transport §    §    §      §        § §        §          §This is an exciting and important new role in a new team, and you have the chance to make it your own.§          §It's a great opportunity to help develop a better approach to regulating commercial transport in New Zealand§          §You'll be responsible for national portfolios and regulatory assurance programmes aimed at improving long-term behavioural change and safety §          §Locations: Auckland (Upper North Island), Hamilton (Central North Island), Wellington (Lower North Island), and Christchurch (South Island)§        §        § §        §About us | Ko wai mātou§        § At Waka Kotahi NZ Transport Agency, it all starts with our people. The organisation's performance and success depend on the people who choose to make this a great place to work and make a difference for Aotearoa. The Transport Agency has a strong future focus, understanding that new technologies and changing customer expectations mean the transport system we know today will not be the one we deliver in ten years' time.§        §This is an exciting time for the Regulatory Services Group as we set ourselves up for future success delivering end-to-end regulatory services that are sharply focused on outcomes and delivering our regulatory purpose and objectives.  § § We have a rare opportunity to drive positive change that will make a difference to the way we work and the outcomes we can deliver for the public. Safety is a top priority for Waka Kotahi and we, as the Regulatory Services group, aim to improve safety and reduce the risk of harm by being a firm and fair regulator applying principles of good practice grounded in Te Ao Maori - Whakapono (Integrity), Manaakitanga (Caring for people), Whanaungatanga (Relationships) and Kotahitanga (Unity).§        §To view our regulatory strategy§ : §please visit §Tu Ake, Tu Maia - Stand Up, Stand Firm§        §Our purpose is to ensure that the system is safe, effective, efficient and functions well for everyone in New Zealand. §        §Being a real-world regulator means:§        §We take a systems view that is focused on improving safety outcomes and reducing harm, we work to understand why people behave the way they do and are pragmatic in how we respond, we encourage and educate to support people to comply and enforce compliance when necessary.§        § §        §The opportunity | Te Whiwhinga mahi§        §The purpose of the Portfolio Manager role is to take ownership of developing and driving strategy, business planning, with oversight of operational delivery of the national safer commercial transport regulatory function. The goal is innovation with clear focus on outcomes, partnerships looking for win win outcomes that lock in long term behavioural change, and effectiveness and efficiency to achieve the biggest bang for our buck from our resources.§        §We are looking for someone with vision and flair who can bring a fresh approach to our business. We need someone who is innovative, can build relationships with industry, will take calculated risks to achieve outcomes, and has a proven ability to get things done. You'll enjoy working as part of a close, collaborative team, and you'll have a clear vision and the freedom to get things done. You'll own your role and will be responsible for the business outcomes.§        §In this exciting new role you'll report directly to the Senior Manager, Safer Commercial Transport. This is a great opportunity for someone with energy and talent who is ready to embrace the challenge of shaping a senior role.§        § §        §About you | Ko koe tēnei§        §To be successful in this role, you will bring:§        §          §Proven experience in bringing together multidisciplinary teams from across sectors to solve large complex issues.§          §Experience in creating a motivational work environment and enabling high performance§          §Experience leading change management and continuous improvement initiatives to drive performance and build capability§          §Experience in leading, influencing and building credibility across a range of stakeholders to drive behaviour change§          §An understanding of regulatory practice particularly within the Government context would be helpful §        §        § §        §Applications close | Rā Katinga : Wednesday, 21 October 2020§        §For a copy of the position description: §www.nzta.govt.nz/careers§        §For further information, email: §careers@nzta.govt.nz§        §To be considered for this position you must have a legal right to live and work in New Zealand.§        §NZ Transport Agency is an equal opportunity employer (EOE). At the Agency we recognise the importance of diversity and inclusion and are committed to providing a working environment that embraces these values. Please let us know if you need any support or have any access requirements that will help you through the recruitment process.§        § #LI-NZTA§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ §§This is an exciting and important new role in a new team, and you have the chance to make it your own.§It's a great opportunity to help develop a better approach to regulating commercial transport in New Zealand§You'll be responsible for national portfolios and regulatory assurance programmes aimed at improving long-term behavioural change and safety §Locations: Auckland (Upper North Island), Hamilton (Central North Island), Wellington (Lower North Island), and Christchurch (South Island)§§ §About us | Ko wai mātou§§ At Waka Kotahi NZ Transport Agency, it all starts with our people. The organisation's performance and success depend on the people who choose to make this a great place to work and make a difference for Aotearoa. The Transport Agency has a strong future focus, understanding that new technologies and changing customer expectations mean the transport system we know today will not be the one we deliver in ten years' time.§This is an exciting time for the Regulatory Services Group as we set ourselves up for future success delivering end-to-end regulatory services that are sharply focused on outcomes and delivering our regulatory purpose and objectives.  § § We have a rare opportunity to drive positive change that will make a difference to the way we work and the outcomes we can deliver for the public. Safety is a top priority for Waka Kotahi and we, as the Regulatory Services group, aim to improve safety and reduce the risk of harm by being a firm and fair regulator applying principles of good practice grounded in Te Ao Maori - Whakapono (Integrity), Manaakitanga (Caring for people), Whanaungatanga (Relationships) and Kotahitanga (Unity).§To view our regulatory strategy§ : §please visit §Tu Ake, Tu Maia - Stand Up, Stand Firm§§Our purpose is to ensure that the system is safe, effective, efficient and functions well for everyone in New Zealand. §Being a real-world regulator means:§We take a systems view that is focused on improving safety outcomes and reducing harm, we work to understand why people behave the way they do and are pragmatic in how we respond, we encourage and educate to support people to comply and enforce compliance when necessary.§ §The opportunity | Te Whiwhinga mahi§The purpose of the Portfolio Manager role is to take ownership of developing and driving strategy, business planning, with oversight of operational delivery of the national safer commercial transport regulatory function. The goal is innovation with clear focus on outcomes, partnerships looking for win win outcomes that lock in long term behavioural change, and effectiveness and efficiency to achieve the biggest bang for our buck from our resources.§We are looking for someone with vision and flair who can bring a fresh approach to our business. We need someone who is innovative, can build relationships with industry, will take calculated risks to achieve outcomes, and has a proven ability to get things done. You'll enjoy working as part of a close, collaborative team, and you'll have a clear vision and the freedom to get things done. You'll own your role and will be responsible for the business outcomes.§In this exciting new role you'll report directly to the Senior Manager, Safer Commercial Transport. This is a great opportunity for someone with energy and talent who is ready to embrace the challenge of shaping a senior role.§ §About you | Ko koe tēnei§To be successful in this role, you will bring:§§Proven experience in bringing together multidisciplinary teams from across sectors to solve large complex issues.§Experience in creating a motivational work environment and enabling high performance§Experience leading change management and continuous improvement initiatives to drive performance and build capability§Experience in leading, influencing and building credibility across a range of stakeholders to drive behaviour change§An understanding of regulatory practice particularly within the Government context would be helpful §§ §§Applications close | Rā Katinga : Wednesday, 21 October 2020§For a copy of the position description: §www.nzta.govt.nz/careers§For further information, email: §careers@nzta.govt.nz§§To be considered for this position you must have a legal right to live and work in New Zealand.§§NZ Transport Agency is an equal opportunity employer (EOE). At the Agency we recognise the importance of diversity and inclusion and are committed to providing a working environment that embraces these values. Please let us know if you need any support or have any access requirements that will help you through the recruitment process.§ #LI-NZTA§§§§

You will love working within a fast paced, agile and dynamic work environment, where innovation and calculated risk taking is highly valued, along with the ability to get stuff done.§        §Excellent verbal and written communication is essential, along with strong organisation skills. Previous programme coordination experience in a complex organisation would set you ahead of the pack§        § §        §About you | Ko koe tēnei§        §To be successful in this role, you will bring:§        §          §Demonstrated experience working in reporting and analytical roles§          §Experience in information reporting, especially performance related reporting, preferably in an area supporting other teams in making strategic, management and operational decisions§          §Experience with and exposure to Business Intelligence analytics§          §Strong analytical and quality system thinking§          §Skilled at report writing and interpreting data§          §Strong ability to identify and interpret risk and use information to provide evidence for continuous improvement§          §Knowledge and understanding of programme management and coordination, processes, disciplines and governance procedures§          §An ability to understand legislation and its impact on the work of a regulatory orgnisations, for example the Privacy Act, Official Information Act, Coroner's Act, Railways Act§          §Proven ability in relationship management, influencing and facilitation§        §        §      §Qualifications:§        §          § §Tertiary qualification in a relevant discipline or equivalent experience§        §        § §        §Applications close | §Rā Katinga : Sunday, 25 Oct 2020§        § §        §Please note that we may begin shortlisting as we receive applications.
