jobTitle: Senior Operations Adviser - Performance Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50689012.txt	§Senior Operations Adviser - Performance§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Operations Adviser - Performance§§Advertiser: §Ministry for Primary Industries§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Whatungarongaro te tangata toitu te whenua§          §As man disappears from sight, the land remains§        §        §Senior Operations Adviser - Performance §        §          §Senior Operations Adviser - Performance | Verification Services - New Zealand Food Safety§          § §          §About our team - Mō tō mātou rōpū§          §New Zealand Food Safety - Verification Services (VS) core purpose is to deliver independent, cost effective and high-quality verification, certification, inspection and clearance programmes that ensure all relevant regulatory requirements are met.  Our people deliver a world-class, efficient and cost-effective service to a broad range of animal product industries and sectors and facilitate not only food safety, but biosecurity and market access for animals and animal product exports.§          §Some of the services VS provide, include:§          §            §Verification and certification services to ~2000 processing companies (for primary and secondary food producers, storage and transport), including slaughterhouses, meat and fish packhouses, cold storage facilities and other specialised premises processing animal products.§            §Inspecting containment and transitional facilities to ensure they are meeting the relevant standards to keep New Zealand free of unwanted and new organisms.§            §Inspection and certification of live animals for import and export.§            §              §The export meat sector accounts for 80% of Verification Service's activities.§            §          §          § §          §About the role - Kōrero mō te tūranga§          §An opportunity exists for an experienced Senior Adviser/Analyst who understands business performance drivers and can develop and manage a business performance framework that will enhance the quality of information used for decision making within the Directorate.§          §This is a great opportunity to combine your performance reporting, strategic analysis, relationship management and business planning & reporting skills in a role where you can really add value.§          §You'll have a keen eye for spotting trends and be skilled in translating a broad variety of qualitive and quantitative data into meaningful and usable information, providing the leadership team with insights that enhance service delivery performance and support quality business outcomes.§          §You will be provided with broad exposure to overall operations including finance, systems, H&S, HR, cost recovery and productivity and be required to establish a clear understanding of our business initiatives and activities and build a strong rapport with senior stakeholders in order to proactively identify opportunities to improve business performance.§          § §          §Skills and Experience - Ngā Pūkenga me ngā Wheako§          §            §Proficient in Power BI or similar business intelligence software.§            §Experienced in the development of business performance indicators to measure organisational objectives in an operational environment.§            §Broad experience communicating and presenting accurate, timely and different types of data and information that is engaging, easy to consume and audience appropriate.§            §Tertiary qualification and relevant experience in a similar position (preferably within government or regulatory environment).§          §          § §          §How to apply - Me pēhea te tuku tono§          §To view the position description and/or apply for the role (submitting a cover letter and current curriculum vitae), please click "APPLY NOW" or visit the MPI Careers Site. For tracking and reporting purposes, all applications must be submitted through our online careers portal.§          §If you have any questions about the role, you may contact the Recruitment Adviser, Rosie Slevin for a confidential discussion on §04 819 4261§ or email §rosie.slevin@mpi.govt.nz§          §Applications for this role close on Tuesday 20 October 2020§          § §          §The Ministry for Primary Industries is committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity. Your unique talents and experience will help us deliver exceptional services to our communities in Aotearoa. In return you'll enjoy an inclusive and flexible working environment in a diverse team of people while you're growing your career here in NZ and internationally. We actively encourage applications from all backgrounds. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so that we can assist you through the recruitment process.§        §        §        §      §    §    §  §§§Senior Operations Adviser - Performance | Verification Services - New Zealand Food Safety§ §About our team - Mō tō mātou rōpū§New Zealand Food Safety - Verification Services (VS) core purpose is to deliver independent, cost effective and high-quality verification, certification, inspection and clearance programmes that ensure all relevant regulatory requirements are met.  Our people deliver a world-class, efficient and cost-effective service to a broad range of animal product industries and sectors and facilitate not only food safety, but biosecurity and market access for animals and animal product exports.§Some of the services VS provide, include:§§Verification and certification services to ~2000 processing companies (for primary and secondary food producers, storage and transport), including slaughterhouses, meat and fish packhouses, cold storage facilities and other specialised premises processing animal products.§Inspecting containment and transitional facilities to ensure they are meeting the relevant standards to keep New Zealand free of unwanted and new organisms.§Inspection and certification of live animals for import and export.§§The export meat sector accounts for 80% of Verification Service's activities.§§ §About the role - Kōrero mō te tūranga§An opportunity exists for an experienced Senior Adviser/Analyst who understands business performance drivers and can develop and manage a business performance framework that will enhance the quality of information used for decision making within the Directorate.§This is a great opportunity to combine your performance reporting, strategic analysis, relationship management and business planning & reporting skills in a role where you can really add value.§You'll have a keen eye for spotting trends and be skilled in translating a broad variety of qualitive and quantitative data into meaningful and usable information, providing the leadership team with insights that enhance service delivery performance and support quality business outcomes.§You will be provided with broad exposure to overall operations including finance, systems, H&S, HR, cost recovery and productivity and be required to establish a clear understanding of our business initiatives and activities and build a strong rapport with senior stakeholders in order to proactively identify opportunities to improve business performance.§ §Skills and Experience - Ngā Pūkenga me ngā Wheako§§Proficient in Power BI or similar business intelligence software.§Experienced in the development of business performance indicators to measure organisational objectives in an operational environment.§Broad experience communicating and presenting accurate, timely and different types of data and information that is engaging, easy to consume and audience appropriate.§Tertiary qualification and relevant experience in a similar position (preferably within government or regulatory environment).§§ §How to apply - Me pēhea te tuku tono§To view the position description and/or apply for the role (submitting a cover letter and current curriculum vitae), please click "APPLY NOW" or visit the MPI Careers Site. For tracking and reporting purposes, all applications must be submitted through our online careers portal.§If you have any questions about the role, you may contact the Recruitment Adviser, Rosie Slevin for a confidential discussion on §04 819 4261§ or email §rosie.slevin@mpi.govt.nz§§Applications for this role close on Tuesday 20 October 2020§ §The Ministry for Primary Industries is committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity. Your unique talents and experience will help us deliver exceptional services to our communities in Aotearoa. In return you'll enjoy an inclusive and flexible working environment in a diverse team of people while you're growing your career here in NZ and internationally. We actively encourage applications from all backgrounds. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so that we can assist you through the recruitment process.§§§§

jobTitle: 20/400 Strategic Investment Consultant Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50689275.txt	§20/400 Strategic Investment Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§20/400 Strategic Investment Consultant§§Advertiser: §Department of Internal Affairs§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§§Type:§ Secondment - 12 months§Hours:§ Full time§Location:§ Wellington§Business Group§: Agency Partnerships and Capability §Branch:§ Digital Public Service§Salary:§ $129,622 - $175,371§§                    §  §Te Tari Taiwhenua/Internal Affairs serves and connects people, communities and government to build a safe, prosperous and respected nation. We deliver value to New Zealanders in many ways – leading digital government, keeping Kiwis safe from harm, supporting strong and resilient communities, strengthening civic participation and governance, and fostering our cultural identity. In other words, we are all about helping to make New Zealand better for New Zealanders.   §Our public service is being called upon to deliver a unified, seamless and effective digital experience so that New Zealanders have the best possible experience of government.§  §  §The Digital Public Service branch achieves this by working across the public service to set system direction, connect, influence and support the system to transform and better respond to the ever-changing digital landscape. It also enables the Government Chief Digital Officer (GCDO) to support a modern adaptive public service with the skills, technology and data to operate at pace in a fast-changing digital environment.§  §  §The branch has recently redefined its purpose and has reorganised to better meet the needs of a digital public service. This role is the result of this redesign.§  §  §Are you an investment specialist looking for a challenging and satisfying new role? We seek people with a deep understanding of how investment supports the achievement of government digital outcomes to join our new team of multidisciplinary consultants.§  §  §Working collaboratively with your colleagues you will act as a ‘change agent’, supporting public sector agencies to develop investment capability to maximise and align their investment to the Strategy for a Digital Public Service.  You will do this by:§  §Being a key liaison between the DPS branch and other central agencies responsible for digital and data investment strategy§Developing a comprehensive understanding of a portfolio of agencies – including their current digital/ICT systems, risks’ and investment and transformation intentions and plans§Providing strategic direction and system outcomes to support agencies to make smart, agile, investment decisions in-line with behaviours in the Strategy for a Digital Public Service§Advising agencies about their investment plans, their responsibilities and accountabilities, and ensuring decisions are in line with published frameworks and guidelines§Supporting the development and maintenance of investment guidelines, information and tools.§§§The ideal candidate will have:§§A strong knowledge and experience of digital and ICT investment and an understanding of latest trends, thinking, frameworks, legislation and public service investment policy and processes§a comprehensive understanding of how digital investment processes influence and enable successful business change§experience managing a portfolio of complex and diverse stakeholders, and using intel gathered to inform strategy development.§§§You will also §Understand and be able to communicate the benefits of and direction necessary to achieve system digital transformation §§be an exceptional communicator and be able to give good, pragmatic advice to senior business leaders with confidence, maturity and intelligence.§§The nature of this role means you may need to have the ability to obtain and maintain a Secret security clearance. §If you want to join a team of smart, committed people who do some spectacular work for New Zealand – then make sure you get in touch.     §We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity and inclusion. We recognise a diverse workforce contributes to better business outcomes. We are committed to creating a workplace where all employees have equal access.§                    §                    §To learn more about the diverse, important mahi we do at Te Tari Taiwhenua and see why we're a great place to work, click here.§We work to make New Zealand better for New Zealanders through our four outcome areas:§§People can easily access the services and information they need §Iwi, hapū and communities across New Zealand are safe, resilient and thriving §People's sense of belonging and collective memory builds an inclusive New Zealand §New Zealand is a well-functioning democracy across central and local government§§Applications close:§ 5pm, Wednesday 21 October 2020§For more information please contact:§ Paul Jordan at §Paul.Jordan@dia.govt.nz§Job description:§ To review the full job description, please click here. If you are unable to follow the link, please review the full job description on our careers website. §§§§§

Our key stakeholders include (but are not limited to) iwi, Māori organisations, industry groups, regional councils etc.  §          §As an experienced Senior or Adviser, you will bring:§          §            §Phenomenal stakeholder relationship skills. jobText: TXT/50694815.txt	§Portfolio Manager - Safer Commercial Transport§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Portfolio Manager - Safer Commercial Transport§§Advertiser: §NZ Transport Agency§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Portfolio Manager - Safer Commercial Transport §    §    §      §        § §        §          §This is an exciting and important new role in a new team, and you have the chance to make it your own.§          §It's a great opportunity to help develop a better approach to regulating commercial transport in New Zealand§          §You'll be responsible for national portfolios and regulatory assurance programmes aimed at improving long-term behavioural change and safety §          §Locations: Auckland (Upper North Island), Hamilton (Central North Island), Wellington (Lower North Island), and Christchurch or Dunedin (South Island)§        §        § §        §About us | Ko wai mātou§        § At Waka Kotahi NZ Transport Agency, it all starts with our people. The organisation's performance and success depend on the people who choose to make this a great place to work and make a difference for Aotearoa. The Transport Agency has a strong future focus, understanding that new technologies and changing customer expectations mean the transport system we know today will not be the one we deliver in ten years' time.§        §This is an exciting time for the Regulatory Services Group as we set ourselves up for future success delivering end-to-end regulatory services that are sharply focused on outcomes and delivering our regulatory purpose and objectives.  § § We have a rare opportunity to drive positive change that will make a difference to the way we work and the outcomes we can deliver for the public. Safety is a top priority for Waka Kotahi and we, as the Regulatory Services group, aim to improve safety and reduce the risk of harm by being a firm and fair regulator applying principles of good practice grounded in Te Ao Maori - Whakapono (Integrity), Manaakitanga (Caring for people), Whanaungatanga (Relationships) and Kotahitanga (Unity).§        §To view our regulatory strategy§ : §please visit §Tu Ake, Tu Maia - Stand Up, Stand Firm§        §Our purpose is to ensure that the system is safe, effective, efficient and functions well for everyone in New Zealand.§        §Being a real-world regulator means:§        §We take a systems view that is focused on improving safety outcomes and reducing harm, we work to understand why people behave the way they do and are pragmatic in how we respond, we encourage and educate to support people to comply and enforce compliance when necessary.§        § §        §The opportunity | Te Whiwhinga mahi§        §The purpose of the Portfolio Manager role is to take ownership of developing and driving strategy, business planning, with oversight of operational delivery of the national safer commercial transport regulatory function. The goal is innovation with clear focus on outcomes, partnerships looking for win win outcomes that lock in long term behavioural change, and effectiveness and efficiency to achieve the biggest bang for our buck from our resources.§        §We are looking for someone with vision and flair who can bring a fresh approach to our business. We need someone who is innovative, can build relationships with industry, will take calculated risks to achieve outcomes, and has a proven ability to get things done. You'll enjoy working as part of a close, collaborative team, and you'll have a clear vision and the freedom to get things done. You'll own your role and will be responsible for the business outcomes.§        §In this exciting new role you'll report directly to the Senior Manager, Safer Commercial Transport. This is a great opportunity for someone with energy and talent who is ready to embrace the challenge of shaping a senior role.§        § §        §About you | Ko koe tēnei§        §To be successful in this role, you will bring:§        §          §Proven experience in bringing together multidisciplinary teams from across sectors to solve large complex issues.§          §Experience in creating a motivational work environment and enabling high performance§          §Experience leading change management and continuous improvement initiatives to drive performance and build capability§          §Experience in leading, influencing and building credibility across a range of stakeholders to drive behaviour change§          §An understanding of regulatory practice particularly within the Government context would be helpful §        §        § §        §Applications close | Rā Katinga : Wednesday, 21 October 2020§        §For a copy of the position description: §www.nzta.govt.nz/careers§        §For further information, email: §careers@nzta.govt.nz§        §To be considered for this position you must have a legal right to live and work in New Zealand.§        §NZ Transport Agency is an equal opportunity employer (EOE). At the Agency we recognise the importance of diversity and inclusion and are committed to providing a working environment that embraces these values. Please let us know if you need any support or have any access requirements that will help you through the recruitment process.§        § §        §#LI-NZTA§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ §§This is an exciting and important new role in a new team, and you have the chance to make it your own.§It's a great opportunity to help develop a better approach to regulating commercial transport in New Zealand§You'll be responsible for national portfolios and regulatory assurance programmes aimed at improving long-term behavioural change and safety §Locations: Auckland (Upper North Island), Hamilton (Central North Island), Wellington (Lower North Island), and Christchurch or Dunedin (South Island)§§ §About us | Ko wai mātou§§ At Waka Kotahi NZ Transport Agency, it all starts with our people. The organisation's performance and success depend on the people who choose to make this a great place to work and make a difference for Aotearoa. The Transport Agency has a strong future focus, understanding that new technologies and changing customer expectations mean the transport system we know today will not be the one we deliver in ten years' time.§This is an exciting time for the Regulatory Services Group as we set ourselves up for future success delivering end-to-end regulatory services that are sharply focused on outcomes and delivering our regulatory purpose and objectives.  § § We have a rare opportunity to drive positive change that will make a difference to the way we work and the outcomes we can deliver for the public. Safety is a top priority for Waka Kotahi and we, as the Regulatory Services group, aim to improve safety and reduce the risk of harm by being a firm and fair regulator applying principles of good practice grounded in Te Ao Maori - Whakapono (Integrity), Manaakitanga (Caring for people), Whanaungatanga (Relationships) and Kotahitanga (Unity).§To view our regulatory strategy§ : §please visit §Tu Ake, Tu Maia - Stand Up, Stand Firm§§Our purpose is to ensure that the system is safe, effective, efficient and functions well for everyone in New Zealand.§Being a real-world regulator means:§We take a systems view that is focused on improving safety outcomes and reducing harm, we work to understand why people behave the way they do and are pragmatic in how we respond, we encourage and educate to support people to comply and enforce compliance when necessary.§ §The opportunity | Te Whiwhinga mahi§The purpose of the Portfolio Manager role is to take ownership of developing and driving strategy, business planning, with oversight of operational delivery of the national safer commercial transport regulatory function. The goal is innovation with clear focus on outcomes, partnerships looking for win win outcomes that lock in long term behavioural change, and effectiveness and efficiency to achieve the biggest bang for our buck from our resources.§We are looking for someone with vision and flair who can bring a fresh approach to our business. We need someone who is innovative, can build relationships with industry, will take calculated risks to achieve outcomes, and has a proven ability to get things done. You'll enjoy working as part of a close, collaborative team, and you'll have a clear vision and the freedom to get things done. You'll own your role and will be responsible for the business outcomes.§In this exciting new role you'll report directly to the Senior Manager, Safer Commercial Transport. This is a great opportunity for someone with energy and talent who is ready to embrace the challenge of shaping a senior role.§ §About you | Ko koe tēnei§To be successful in this role, you will bring:§§Proven experience in bringing together multidisciplinary teams from across sectors to solve large complex issues.§Experience in creating a motivational work environment and enabling high performance§Experience leading change management and continuous improvement initiatives to drive performance and build capability§Experience in leading, influencing and building credibility across a range of stakeholders to drive behaviour change§An understanding of regulatory practice particularly within the Government context would be helpful §§ §§Applications close | Rā Katinga : Wednesday, 21 October 2020§For a copy of the position description: §www.nzta.govt.nz/careers§For further information, email: §careers@nzta.govt.nz§§To be considered for this position you must have a legal right to live and work in New Zealand.§§NZ Transport Agency is an equal opportunity employer (EOE). At the Agency we recognise the importance of diversity and inclusion and are committed to providing a working environment that embraces these values. Please let us know if you need any support or have any access requirements that will help you through the recruitment process.§ §#LI-NZTA§§§§

jobText: TXT/50694859.txt	§Data analytics§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Data analytics§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Justice§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§Analyst Level 2§§Full time, Permanent §§Wellington§ §Te āhuatunga a te tūranga/About the Role§We are looking for an enthusiastic and motivated level two analyst from a quantitative background to join a high performing team of modellers making a difference in the Justice Sector.§You may be a developing analyst looking for the experience you need to progress to senior, or have just a few years' experience and looking for the next step. The ideal candidate for this role will have two plus years of experience in a quantitative discipline and be comfortable with manipulating large data sets using a range of technical and statistical tools.§This is an opportunity to launch your career by gaining exposure to government leading analytics practices and methodology, and contribute to a safe and effective Justice system.§ §Mō te tīma/About our Team§You will work within The Ministry of Justice's Sector Analysis Modellling team, alongside high performing colleagues in a strong mentoring envioment where data is valued. §§Joining the Ministry of Justice means you will become part of an inclusive organisation that values you and the communities we serve. §It's our promise to ensure our workplace is one where our people feel healthy and safe, supported and able to be themselves at work. We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated§§ §He pūkenga tou/Skills and Experience§You will have a mind for numbers and an appetite to make a difference. You'll love data and will understand a range of techniques for making it sing. You will need to be able to manage your time well and show high quality output. A positive can-do attitude is important, and you will be willing to do what it takes to get the job done. Importantly your work will demonstrate attention to detail and show that you take responsibility for the quality of your own work.§To be successful in this role you will have:§§A tertiary degree in a relevant field or equivalent knowledge, skills and experience§SAS, strong spreadsheet and other statistical software and programming skills are a distinct advantage§Ability to relate to a wide range of people at all levels.§§ §Tono mai/How to Apply§To apply, click the Apply button below to be directed to our Careers Website. You can view a detailed position description here, as well as complete an online application form by attaching your CV and cover letter.§Applications close on 23rd October and the salary range for this role is §$61,744 - $79,177§If you have any questions please contact §Lyndsey.Rothwell@justice.govt.nz§ § § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50701649.txt	§Principal Methodologist – Census Methodology§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Principal Methodologist – Census Methodology§§Advertiser: §Stats NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Principal Methodologist – Census Methodology §      §        §          §            §Opportunity available in Wellington or Christchurch §            §About Us | Mō mātou§            §At Tatauranga Aotearoa, Stats NZ, our vision is to unleash the power of data to change lives. As New Zealand’s official data and statistics agency, we are tasked with leading the way for New Zealand’s data future, enabling data-led innovation across society, the economy, and the environment. §            §What we’re looking for | Ngā āhuatanga e hiahiatia ana e Mātou § §            §A highly skilled technical leader with expertise in Census methodology, experience delivering and supporting design and methodology solutions that build on organisational capability. You’ll have a strong customer focus, be comfortable with ambiguity and change, and have sound decision-making ability. §            §We believe in coaching and developing our staff and growing capability for high performance. This requires a certain type of technical leadership. One that focuses on mentoring and coaching technical leads for a long-term gain. In this newly created role, you’ll have the opportunity to help shape how technical leadership will operate in the team and make a significant contribution to the success of the 2023 Census.  §            §Starting salary ranges between $110,000 - $129,000 depending on the successful applicant’s experience  §            §The role | Mō te tūnga §            §            §Census Methodology leads the combined census design and methodology workstream that provides methodology and statistical support services across the programme. You’ll ensure Statistical Methods support for the 2023 Census is co-ordinated and cohesive and meets requirements. You will conceptualise, design, develop and evaluate models and methodologies to ensure statistical integrity, and support implementation and operational activity. The aim is to provide end-to-end methodology cohesion for a design-led Census and quality data for customers and Treaty partners.§            §With a focus on methodology across workstreams, you’ll keep your finger on the pulse throughout the Census Programme and bring a Te Āo Maori lense to the work that we do. Tapping into your inquisitive nature, you’ll have an eye for the smallest details which make the biggest differences and ensure statistical integrity. §            §To hit the ground running we’re looking for you to bring your experience in the following:§            §            §            §              §Supporting technical leads and census methodology teams in methodology design and developmentWorking in agile and fast-paced environments where you will need to make decisions and resolves issues quickly without letting statistical standards drop§              §Technical credibility building confidence and trusted relationships.§              §Confident with constructively challenging methodologies and able to navigate ambiguity as you juggle a variety of demands and priorities from strategic partners§              §Work in a strategic partnership with census workstreams to ensure statistical methodologies produce fit for purpose data quality§              §Providing methodology and statistical support services using statistical best practice and delivering advice based on sound research and evidence§              §Working in agile and fast-paced environments where you will need to make decisions and resolves issues quickly without letting statistical standards drop§            §          §          §            §What’s in it for you? | Ngā hua ka riro ki a koe §            §We place great emphasis on our people’s health, safety and wellbeing and encourage flexible working, whether that be from home or our modern offices. You’ll be joining an inclusive environment where people, regardless of gender, race, disability, religion or background are supported to be able to do their best work §            §              §Have challenging, varied and interesting work.  §              §Utilize your expertise within a dynamic innovative organisation.  §              §Balanced life and work commitments (37.5 hour working week)  §              §Ability to work in an agile, and flexible manner.   §            §            §How to apply | Me pēhea te tuku tono§            §            §If the above matches your skills and experience, click apply and upload your CV and cover letter. §            §To view position description, paste this link https://bit.ly/3lpg24I into your browser. §            §If you have any questions that haven’t been answered in this advert or the position description, or if you have difficulty with your application please email jobs@stats.govt.nz   §            §Applications close: §Thursday, 15 October 2020 §            §You must have the right to live and work in Aotearoa New Zealand to apply for this job. §            §            §          §        §      §      §      §    §    §Make your career count!§ For further information about working at Stats NZ and a job description please visit our careers site.§      § careers.stats.govt.nz§    §  §§§§Opportunity available in Wellington or Christchurch §About Us | Mō mātou§At Tatauranga Aotearoa, Stats NZ, our vision is to unleash the power of data to change lives. As New Zealand’s official data and statistics agency, we are tasked with leading the way for New Zealand’s data future, enabling data-led innovation across society, the economy, and the environment.   §What we’re looking for | Ngā āhuatanga e hiahiatia ana e Mātou §   §A highly skilled technical leader with expertise in Census methodology, experience delivering and supporting design and methodology solutions that build on organisational capability. You’ll have a strong customer focus, be comfortable with ambiguity and change, and have sound decision-making ability.   §We believe in coaching and developing our staff and growing capability for high performance. This requires a certain type of technical leadership. One that focuses on mentoring and coaching technical leads for a long-term gain. In this newly created role, you’ll have the opportunity to help shape how technical leadership will operate in the team and make a significant contribution to the success of the 2023 Census.    §Starting salary ranges between $110,000 - $129,000 depending on the successful applicant’s experience      §The role | Mō te tūnga §  §Census Methodology leads the combined census design and methodology workstream that provides methodology and statistical support services across the programme. You’ll ensure Statistical Methods support for the 2023 Census is co-ordinated and cohesive and meets requirements. You will conceptualise, design, develop and evaluate models and methodologies to ensure statistical integrity, and support implementation and operational activity. The aim is to provide end-to-end methodology cohesion for a design-led Census and quality data for customers and Treaty partners.§With a focus on methodology across workstreams, you’ll keep your finger on the pulse throughout the Census Programme and bring a Te Āo Maori lense to the work that we do. Tapping into your inquisitive nature, you’ll have an eye for the smallest details which make the biggest differences and ensure statistical integrity.   §To hit the ground running we’re looking for you to bring your experience in the following:§§Supporting technical leads and census methodology teams in methodology design and developmentWorking in agile and fast-paced environments where you will need to make decisions and resolves issues quickly without letting statistical standards drop§Technical credibility building confidence and trusted relationships.§Confident with constructively challenging methodologies and able to navigate ambiguity as you juggle a variety of demands and priorities from strategic partners§Work in a strategic partnership with census workstreams to ensure statistical methodologies produce fit for purpose data quality§Providing methodology and statistical support services using statistical best practice and delivering advice based on sound research and evidence§Working in agile and fast-paced environments where you will need to make decisions and resolves issues quickly without letting statistical standards drop§§What’s in it for you? | Ngā hua ka riro ki a koe §We place great emphasis on our people’s health, safety and wellbeing and encourage flexible working, whether that be from home or our modern offices. jobTitle: Senior Change Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50701766.txt	§Senior Change Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Change Manager§§Advertiser: §Westpac§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§Senior Change Manager§ §Full time, Permanent§ §Located in Britomart, Auckland§ § §In a world where change is the only constant, we know that the key is to improve the capability of people to adopt, manage and embrace change. The Change Practice at Westpac is an enterprise wide function that enables our people to be ready and able to adopt change so that value is delivered into the hands of our customers.§ § §About the Opportunity:§ § §We currently have a rewarding Senior Change Manager position available, which offers the opportunity to be part of a major transformational project implementing future state processes to ensure compliance with regulatory obligations relating to outsourcing.    § §The Senior Change Manager role will support both simple and complex change initiatives to ensure our people are ready to adopt change, minimise disruption to the business and maximise delivered value.§ § §Key components of the role include: § § §Making upcoming changes visible via the Change Forecast and providing stakeholders with decision support advice§ §Engaging with stakeholders to identify and manage change impacts§ §Building change capability in agile teams and enabling them to self-serve for simple change§ §Directly managing change for high impact / complex initiatives and measuring change effectiveness§ § §The person we’re looking for:§ § §We’re looking for someone with proven Change Management skills and experience and who has held Change Manager positions in large organisations. Ideally, you would have experience and exposure in delivering Risk and regulatory changes in a banking environment. Facilitation is key in this position as are strong influencing skills. Equally, you need to be comfortable presenting to and working with stakeholders at all levels, with the ability to adapt your style to suit the audience. You’ll need to be organised, have an eye for detail and feel at ease juggling multiple priorities. You’ll love working with people and have the perfect balance of empathy, resilience and drive to deliver. Experience in leading a small team of change managers would be ideal.  § § §What you will need to succeed:§ § §5+ years’ recent experience in change management roles, preferably in the Banking / Financial Services sector.§ §Experience delivering change relating to one or more of the following: Complex Risk and Regulatory change programmes, Risk culture or organisational culture development initiatives and data management related programmes in a banking environment.§ §Ideally, direct experience of delivering change in Agile environments and familiarity with the principles of Agile operation. Added bonus if experienced working with human centred design and have experience in adult learning, education and/or training.§ §Familiarity with change management frameworks and techniques (e.g. Prosci, ADKAR, Lean Change), with the ability to adapt and apply.  § §Excellent stakeholder management skills and a collaborative working style and comfortable operating at all levels of the organisation.§ §Proven ability to coach individuals and teams to deliver effective change.§ §Outstanding written and oral communication skills – ability to tell a story.§ §Resilience and an openness to learn and iterate are keys to succeeding in our environment.§ § §What’s great about working for Westpac?§ § §We’re passionate about people and take pride in building teams that reflect the diversity in our communities. From day one, we’ll invest in your growth and empower you to take ownership of your on-going learning and development.  As well as immersing yourself in a supportive team environment, you’ll be offered some of the best banking, wealth and insurance benefits in the market, gain access to a suite of online learning modules and career planning tools to grow with us, as well as our industry-leading superannuation programme.§ § §Interested?§ §Apply today with your CV and Cover Letter to the link on this page!§ § §We appreciate your interest in a future career with Westpac, however, due to current border restrictions brought about by Covid19 and uncertainty around when this will change, we are unable to support visas for offshore applicants at this time.§§§§§

jobText: TXT/50709292.txt	§Senior/Principal Advisor, Strategic Planning and Performance§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior/Principal Advisor, Strategic Planning and Performance§§Advertiser: §PHARMAC§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior/Principal Advisor, Strategic Planning and Performance §      §        §If you want to make a difference to the lives of New Zealanders and thrive in a busy and challenging environment, we'd love to talk to you about joining the PHARMAC team.§        §About Us§        §PHARMAC is the Crown Entity that ensures New Zealanders have the medicines, medical devices and vaccines they need to help them get well and stay well. Every year PHARMAC makes more medicines available for more New Zealanders.§        §We are committed to championing workplace inclusion, acknowledging that in order to do their best work, people must be able to bring their whole selves to work and work in a way that best suits their individual needs. This includes supporting accessibility and being willing to make accommodations to facilitate the inclusion in the workplace of people of all gender identities, ages, ethnicities, sexual orientations, disability and religions.§        §The Role§        §The Strategic Planning and Performance team at PHARMAC is accountable for ensuring that PHARMAC's strategic planning, performance monitoring and accountability mechanisms are fit for purpose and support the organisation to achieve its new strategic direction.§        §Working closely with the Manager, Strategic Planning and Performance and Performance, the Senior/Principal Advisor, Planning & Performance provides high-quality advice and co-ordination (written and verbal) for strategy, planning, project and programme management, and performance reporting. The role will contribute to the implementation and ongoing improvement of an integrated planning process that aligns strategic, annual, and business planning, including resource and financial planning.§        §The Senior/Principal Advisor, Planning & Performance also plays a key role in developing PHARMAC's business plans and accountability documents. The position will have oversight of PHARMAC's performance framework and work alongside analysts and business owners to ensure measures are well documented and that as an organisation, we use performance information to drive better results.§        §SPP is a small team so the role has considerable scope for thought leadership and taking ownership of key pieces of work, as well as engaging with PHARMAC's Senior Leadership Team. The role is fixed-term for 12 months, to really drive and embed improvements to our planning reporting practices.§        §About You§        §We are seeking applications from people with strong experience in leading and supporting organisational planning and best practice performance reporting and measurement. We are flexible about appointing at senior advisor or principal level, depending on skills and experience.§        §You will be a natural communicator, with the ability to effectively build and manage relationships at all levels, including with senior leaders. You will bring:§        §          §a thorough understanding of the concepts and principles of strategy development, planning, project and programme management, performance reporting, and governance and accountability;§          §experience providing advice and support on effective reporting measurement frameworks, reporting measures, and big-picture analysis of what reports are telling us;§          §a good understanding of the system and operation of government and public management in New Zealand; an understanding of the accountability requirements for Crown Entities would be an advantage;§          §highly effective communication skills (written and verbal) and strong analytical skills, including the ability to draft well-argued papers for the Senior Leadership Team and the PHARMAC Board;§          §the ability to work independently as part of a multi-disciplinary team, and to work at pace when required;§          §a commitment to the Treaty of Waitangi and to equitable access and use of medicines;§          §a sense of humour and a willingness to pitch in across the team.§        §        §PHARMAC is a learning organisation that supports its people to develop and you will have a thirst to learn and use new skills to support our work.§        §PHARMAC is a pro-equity organisation, with a particular focus on Māori and Pacific Peoples' health gain [link removed] and we are open to exploring flexible work arrangements on request. We will contribute to relocation costs for those moving to Wellington to take up this role.§        §The PHARMAC model is unique. We are a small organisation (around 130 staff) where your expertise is respected and you can really make a difference for people. We take pride in what we do, work hard and have fun.§        §We will be considering applications as they are received, so apply today!§      §      §Catherine Proffitt§04 831 1338§ §    §    §  §§§If you want to make a difference to the lives of New Zealanders and thrive in a busy and challenging environment, we'd love to talk to you about joining the PHARMAC team.§About Us§PHARMAC is the Crown Entity that ensures New Zealanders have the medicines, medical devices and vaccines they need to help them get well and stay well. jobTitle: Programme Manager - East and Northwest Hamilton Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50709470.txt	§Programme Manager - East and Northwest Hamilton§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Programme Manager - East and Northwest Hamilton§§Advertiser: §Hamilton City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§Our City Growth Group is growing the Hamilton of the future. Every decision we make is contributing to the Hamilton of tomorrow, next year, next decade. We’re building a city that people are attracted to live and do business in now - while creating sustainable, vibrant communities as we continue to grow. We’re ambitious about the impact we can have for the city – join us to get your hands on shaping the Hamilton of today and maximising the opportunities of its growth.§We have an opportunity for a Programme Manager to join our Growth Programmes team. In this role you’ll initially be focussed on leading the overall delivery of the Ruakura (and eastern growth areas) and the Rotokauri (and northwest growth areas). You’ll build and lead a virtual, cross organisational team of multidisciplinary project managers and technical staff to ensure that they work together in a joined up way to deliver wellbeing outcomes for these new communities. Your daily focus will be on leading, communicating and corralling our internal teams and working closely with our Elected Members and key external partners including developers, landowners and key government agencies. You’ll also lead some specific projects, such as Business Cases, to support decision making on long term future investment into growth areas.§The right person for this role will have significant experience in Project or Programme Management. You may be a Project Manager looking to take your next step into Programme Management role. You do not need to be an engineer, a planner or a technical expert as we have those people in place delivering the projects. Your job will be to set up the temporary Programme frameworks that enable those teams to work together. You will have experience working in a complex, large work environment be it international, local government or from the private sector. High on your list of skills will be the ability to quickly form trusting relationships, the ability to lead people towards a common vision, outstanding communication skills and the ability to learn quickly and to see and implement new ways of doing things. You will also be highly organised and able to lead and prioritise your workload.§We are looking for a high-performer who is energised and ready to take on a new challenge. You’ll be joining a creative and supportive team who has your back, and will provide context and training to set you up to succeed.§This is a full-time role, based in central Hamilton. Our team can work from anywhere and mixes virtual with in-house, however the influential nature of the role means that you need to be in the building for a large portion of each week.§ §Hamilton City Council is committed to being a high-performance organisation with people who think differently, act with integrity, make it happen and work together. This is your chance to be part of an organisation that is committed to building a more vibrant, attractive and prosperous city.§ §For a copy of the position description please click § HERE§.§ §The recruiting range for this role starts at $98,000 per annum and will be negotiated with the successful candidate in accordance with skills, knowledge and experience.§ §If this role sounds like it’s for you, we would love to hear from you. Make it happen and apply online today!§ §All candidates will be notified of the outcome on their application via email. Short-listed candidates will be required to complete an interview process, reference checks, pre-employment medical, drug and alcohol assessments, and a Ministry of Justice check.§ §Please note this role is being sourced directly and we are not accepting applications via external recruitment agencies. Only people who are eligible to work in New Zealand should apply. Evidence will be required.§§§§§

This role is a great opportunity to make a difference and take on a varied, challenging, and rewarding role.  The role will be based in Wellington.§This role is an integral part of the Property Project team, focusing on the management and delivery of construction projects across the Ministry's nationwide portfolio. Working within the context of the Ministry's Long Term Investment Plan and Four Year Plan this role delivers on the priorities in the Ministry's National Property Strategy, ensuring that we put the customer at the heart of everything we do.§You will be based in Wellington and will report to the Manager, Property Projects.  You will be responsible for leading and delivering a range of property construction projects, including major and minor capital works projects.  You will work closely with a range of stakeholders to scope, specify, plan, procure, implement, and manage allocated projects with a minimum of disruption to Ministry operations.§You will receive a high level of support from a team who has a proven track record in project delivery.§Mō te tīma/About our Team§At Tāhū o te Ture - the Ministry of Justice, we're committed to working together for a fair and safe Aotearoa.§§Joining the Ministry of Justice means you will become part of an inclusive organisation that values you and the communities we serve. §It's our promise to ensure our workplace is one where our people feel healthy and safe, supported and able to be themselves at work. We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated. §§He pūkenga tou/Skills and Experience§You will have excellent relationship management and stakeholder engagement skills, be well versed in capital expenditure, project financial planning, project management, and have a proven track record of successful project delivery.  This position plays a key role in developing the Ministry's current and future footprint across the nationwide portfolio.§Tono mai/How to Apply§To apply, click the Apply button below to be directed to our Careers Website. jobText: TXT/50719606.txt	§Senior Adviser Treatments§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Adviser Treatments§§Advertiser: §Ministry for Primary Industries§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Whatungarongaro te tangata toitu te whenua§          §As man disappears from sight, the land remains§        §        §Senior Adviser Treatments §        §          §§          § §          §Ma tau rourou, ma taku rourou, ka ora te iwi (with your contribution and my contribution the people will prosper)§          §Mō te Manatū Ahu Matua - (About MPI)§          §Ministry for Primary Industries (MPI) is responsible for ‘Growing and Protecting New Zealand'. Our ambition is that New Zealand is the most trusted source of high value natural products in the world. We work to achieve four outcomes: Growth, Sustainability, Protection and Participation. At MPI our values are respect, trust, connect and deliver.§          §New Zealand's biosecurity system is vital - our country is unique, and we need to protect it. Our primary sector, tourism, environment, and even our way of life is underpinned by a strong biosecurity system.§          §At Biosecurity New Zealand, our focus is on stopping unwanted pests and diseases at the border, before they get to New Zealand, and eradicating or managing the impact of those already here. With the help of New Zealanders, we ensure our unique environments and the value of our primary industries are maintained.§          §Kōrero mō te tūranga - About the Role§          §The Plant and Pathways directorate is looking for two Senior Adviser Treatments to contribute to and help deliver key treatment outcomes of the biosecurity treatment programme. The position will help coordinate a whole-of-MPI approach for the monitoring and management of biosecurity treatments both onshore and offshore and, help build the toolbox of biosecurity treatments now and for the future. §          §Mōu - About You§          §            §Post-graduate qualification in relevant discipline such as Agriculture, Entomology, Chemistry, Chemical or Material Process Engineering, Plant Pathology or, equivalent knowledge or skills and experience in a similar role§            §A commitment to ongoing professional development§            §A reasonable period of time (5+ years) working in a similar role§            §Demonstrated experience in development of treatments/crop protection programmes on one or more of the following: fumigants, fungicides, nematicides pesticides, and/or temperature treatments§            §Experience analysing and summarizing complex quantitative information from multiple sources§            §Knowledge and experience in strategy development and implementation§            §Experience in developing and managing relationships with internal and external stakeholders, including senior leaders.§          §          § §          §Ahurea - (Culture):§          §We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture. We are fair in our behaviour and our policies promote equal opportunity for all. We provide numerous training programmes and opportunities for people to continuously improve their skill sets and keep up to date with global best practices. jobTitle: Sustainability Consultant Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50728530.txt	§Sustainability Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Sustainability Consultant§§Advertiser: §Sustainability Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§Sustainability Trust is Wellington's leading social enterprise that supports sustainable living. Our mission is to create warm, dry and healthy homes for Wellington householders and to support individuals, organisations, schools and businesses to reduce their environmental impact. All profits are invested in our award-winning community programmes that empower everyone to live more sustainably. Find out more about us on our website: www.sustaintrust.org.nz.§ §Are you passionate about sustainability and driven to help people create energy efficient homes? This role combines property assessments with advice and practical solutions on how to create warm, dry homes and to reduce their environmental impact.§ §This role includes:§ § §Conducting home energy and business waste audits to set baselines and plan impacts.§ §Evaluating, reporting and designing waste and energy systems for homes and businesses. § §Analysing client requirements and recommending solutions that meet best practice, budget, and sustainability outcomes. § §Maximising the conversation of quotes to jobs by effective use of sales techniques, quoting, closing, and client follow-up.§ §Ensuring data collection, client tracking and reporting is timely and accurate.§ §We are looking for someone with:§ § §A tertiary qualification in a related area, i.e. environmental management, business, etc.§ §Experience in delivering home energy efficiency and waste minimisation programming.§ §Business-to-client (B2C) and business-to-business (B2B) sales experience.§ §A strong foundation of knowledge and passion in home energy, waste minimisation and sustainability.§ §The physical ability and willingness to conduct practical initiatives, e.g. looking under homes and into loft spaces, and conducting waste audits.§ §The role is based in Wellington, at the central head office and properties throughout the region. Sustainability Trust provides product and assessment training, inspection tools, a smart phone and a vehicle for work use. A full drivers licence is required.§ §For a full job description please visit our website: www.sustaintrust.org.nz/pages/work-with-us.§ §To apply, please address your CV and a cover letter explaining how your experience is relevant to this role to Alan Platt, Smart Homes Manager, by §Tuesday 27 October§.  § §Sustainability Trust is proud to be Living Wage Accredited and an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and we are committed to cultivating a safe, inclusive and multicultural workforce and workplace. §§§§

jobText: TXT/50732639.txt	§Business Improvement Analyst - One Year FTC§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Improvement Analyst - One Year FTC§§Advertiser: §Public Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§Public Trust is New Zealand's largest and most experienced trustee services organisation. We provide specialist advice and care across a range of trust, estate management and investment services to New Zealanders.§We are undergoing a transformation in the way we deliver to our customers, making more of our products available online, as well an integrating this technology with our 26 customer centres throughout the country. This newly created fixed term role will work across our business to support with the development, integration and decommissioning of our technology, to create better experiences for our people, customers and communities and our financial outcomes.§About the role§We're looking for an experienced analyst to support and advise on the integration of 'PT online' with our existing programmes, and work through the process of decommissioning programmes that are being retired. You will explore how our customer centres operate and the best ways to integrate our new platform and processes.§You will work with subject matter experts and leaders to understand the root cause of the issue or opportunity and work with the business to identify and implement the appropriate solution using a human centred design approach.§Underpinning this work is our strategic aspiration to grow a sustainable trustee and supervisory services business that is compelling, relevant and accessible to all New Zealanders, which we will achieve by placing equal focus on our people, our customers and communities and our financial outcomes.§Flexibility is integral to the way we work, and therefore the location of this role is flexible, with a preference for someone who is able to spend some of the time working in one of our larger offices in Auckland or Wellington. You will have the ability to work from home if that is a preference.§Ideally we would like someone who is able to start as soon as possible but we can wait until after the Christmas break for the right candidate.§What we're looking for§Personality and the right attitude is key, as we need someone who can build positive relationships with stakeholders, understand our strategy, systems and processes quickly and show a determination to get things done! In addition:§5+ year's experience with business and process analysis, solution design, business process mapping, reporting and analytics and/or the project management of system solutions in a commercial business environment§A relevant tertiary qualification with Lean Six Sigma Orange belt would be an advantage; ADKAR, Agile, Prince2 or PMP are a bonus but not essential§Understanding or experience using human centred design is an advantage§Well established stakeholder engagement and management and effective communication skills are essential as you will need to converse across the organisation, facilitate the resolution of conflicting stakeholder requirements and achieve buy in§Understanding of business case development especially as it relates to cost benefit analysis§Strong understanding of process and business improvement, including an ability to present and report on complex information in a simple manner§Customer focus and the ability to translate this into effective strategies.§In return§Public Trust are taking the lead in educating New Zealanders on the importance of planning for their future. We offer competitive remuneration, career progression, the chance to work with leading professionals in the areas of family asset planning, wills, estates, trusts and investments, an additional day of leave for your birthday and a wide range of discounts on insurance, banking, travel, car hire and more.§To Apply§If you are interested in this role, apply now via our careers site https://careers.publictrust.co.nz.§For any queries please email us at §recruitment@publictrust.co.nz§ (Please note: applications must be submitted online via our careers site and will not be accepted via email).§Please note: applications will be reviewed as they come in and interviews may commence prior to the close date of Wednesday 28th October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Evidence will be required.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50746928.txt	§SEEKING EXPERIENCED AND ENERGETIC POLICY ANALYSTS§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§SEEKING EXPERIENCED AND ENERGETIC POLICY ANALYSTS§§Advertiser: §Allen & Clarke Policy & Regulatory Specialists§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§ §Looking for your next challenge?§ §Keen to be part of a dynamic, fast-paced, flexible organisation committed to making a difference?§ §5+ years’ experience in policy, regulatidons, central government, consultancy or similar work? § § §  §About Us / Ko wai mātou §  §Allen + Clarke§ is a public policy consultancy company with offices in Wellington and Melbourne. We are well-recognised as a policy leader: our clients come to us for trusted advice on a wide range of issues. We provide policy, regulatory and business change advice, evaluation and research services, and governance, secretariat and programme management. Our clients are government agencies, NGOs and in the private sector, in New Zealand, Australia, the Pacific, and beyond. §  §Our people are flexible, hardworking and committed. We know how to work with pace and can capably work on multiple streams of work without dropping the ball. We are good at identifying opportunities, risks and issues and mitigating them to ensure a project’s success. We invest in our people and support growing policy, regulations and project management skills. You can find out more about us at www.allenandclarke.co.nz.§  § §  §The opportunity / Te Whiwhinga mahi§  §As a consultant, you will provide advice on a range of policy matters to enable our clients to achieve their work programmes. Working closely with other consultants across §Allen + Clarke§, you will have the opportunity to be involved in the development of many challenging and rewarding matters that will genuinely make a difference.§  §We are looking for consultants with experience of applying policy principles, stakeholder management and communication skills, and a track record of problem solving and formulating high quality advice.   §  § §  §About you / Ko wai koe§  §To be successful in this role, you will:§ § §have experience in the government sector (5+ years) or a consultancy § §understand the role of government and the policy process, have experience developing policy, regulations or strategy, and comfort presenting ideas to senior officials § §have strong written communication skills, and experience delivering accurate and engaging written content that is tailored for the audience§ §enjoy delivering practical, impactful policy solutions in a fast-paced environment § §be keen to work and engage with a wide range of clients on a variety of projects at the same time§ §be able to plan, manage and see high-quality policy projects through from inception to completion§ §be comfortable self-managing your work, juggling competing demands and prioritising work efficiently, with little direct supervision § §be able to be thrown in the deep end and work with our clients to identify their needs and deliverables§ §like networking and meeting new people and§ §want to further grow your policy career.§ § §  §We appreciate the value of generalists. Equally, we are interested to hear from people with particular skillsets, including economic analysis, business change and transformation, experience in managing and mentoring staff, and cultural competency. §  §The positions are Wellington based, but will involve work on projects for clients in a range of locations and potential associated travel domestically and internationally. Our projects are usually team-based, both short and long term, and may involve working in-house with our clients as well as from our offices.§  §You must be legally permitted to work in New Zealand for this role.§  § §  §Applications close / Rā Katinga:  Monday 2 November 2020§ §at 5pm. §  §If you are interested, please request a copy of the position description from recruitment@allenandclarke.co.nz.§  §We look forward to receiving your CV (maximum 5 pages) and a covering letter describing your interest and suitability for the role prior to Monday 2 November at 5pm.§  §If you have any questions, please contact Lizzie at the above email or on 021 594 780§§§§

jobText: TXT/50727799.txt	§Energy Modelling Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Energy Modelling Analyst§§Advertiser: §Meridian§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Energy Modelling Analyst §      §Provide detailed analytics, commercial insights and help us understand key industry drivers in our ever-changing market §      §      §        §Company Description§        §At Meridian, we generate electricity from 100% renewable resources and retail electricity to more than 390,000 customer connections including homes, businesses and farms in New Zealand and Australia.  We’re committed to sustainability and are active in the community, proudly supporting KidsCan and the Kākāpō Recovery Program; among others.§        §Our purpose – our “why” – Clean Energy for a fairer and healthier world is at the heart of our business, how we operate and how we treat each other.§ §        §Job Description§        §Ever wanted to understand how electric vehicles, roof-top solar, wind farms, hydro dams, green hydrogen, and Tesla’s batteries are all connected?  Ever been curious about what drives the electricity system and how New Zealand can transition to a low carbon economy?  Keen to understand and influence where and what Meridian does as we face the avalanche of new, exciting, and disruptive innovation and technology the modern world is throwing at us?§        §We are looking for an Energy Modelling Analyst who can assess, develop, and communicate commercial insights.  You will undertake modelling and forecasting for the business to ensure we are making the best decisions!§        §What you will do§        §          §You’ll contribute to long term forecasting of the energy industry in New Zealand and other markets where Meridian is active. §          §You will assist the Modelling and Portfolio Manager by gathering, interpreting, and disseminating market intelligence that feeds into the tuning of wholesale tactics, regulatory positioning, longer term strategy, and the urgency with which business improvements are sought.§          §Fantastic at modelling, you’ll be able to use existing models and tools to explore industry drivers and trends. §          §You will gather and examine data and model inputs and, with the support of other team members, maintain, develop, and run analytical models and tools.  This will include complex system optimisation modelling with clear economic and commercial frameworks.§        §        §Qualifications§        §You’ll have a degree in Data Analytics, Finance/Economics, Statistics, Operations Research, Engineering Science, or applied Mathematics.  Prior experience in the industry is a plus.  You’ll have a passion for and be an expert in modelling along with experience in dealing with large datasets.§        §If you love to push around data and get across complex problems, then this is the role for you!§        §Additional Information§        §Why choose to work for Meridian?§        §We have a superb culture where hard work, dedication and having a good time at work are vital. With a truly flexible, diverse and inclusive culture, we also offer an attractive salary package and benefits such as life and income protection insurance, enhanced leave, KiwiSaver and parental leave provisions, discounts from Meridian and various other organisations, the Meridian employee share scheme, and flexible work options where possible to make life easier for you, and to enable a better work life balance.§        §If you think you are an awesome fit, not only for our role but for Meridian – tell us why!  Include a cover letter with your CV and apply using the “Apply Now” button.  Our advertising period closes at the end of the day 23rd October and we will be in touch shortly after.§      §      §        §      §    §  §§§Company Description§  §At Meridian, we generate electricity from 100% renewable resources and retail electricity to more than 390,000 customer connections including homes, businesses and farms in New Zealand and Australia.  We’re committed to sustainability and are active in the community, proudly supporting KidsCan and the Kākāpō Recovery Program; among others.§  §Our purpose – our “why” – Clean Energy for a fairer and healthier world is at the heart of our business, how we operate and how we treat each other.§ §  §Job Description§  §Ever wanted to understand how electric vehicles, roof-top solar, wind farms, hydro dams, green hydrogen, and Tesla’s batteries are all connected?  Ever been curious about what drives the electricity system and how New Zealand can transition to a low carbon economy?  Keen to understand and influence where and what Meridian does as we face the avalanche of new, exciting, and disruptive innovation and technology the modern world is throwing at us?§  §We are looking for an Energy Modelling Analyst who can assess, develop, and communicate commercial insights.  You will undertake modelling and forecasting for the business to ensure we are making the best decisions!§  §What you will do§ § §You’ll contribute to long term forecasting of the energy industry in New Zealand and other markets where Meridian is active. § §You will assist the Modelling and Portfolio Manager by gathering, interpreting, and disseminating market intelligence that feeds into the tuning of wholesale tactics, regulatory positioning, longer term strategy, and the urgency with which business improvements are sought.§ §Fantastic at modelling, you’ll be able to use existing models and tools to explore industry drivers and trends. § §You will gather and examine data and model inputs and, with the support of other team members, maintain, develop, and run analytical models and tools.  This will include complex system optimisation modelling with clear economic and commercial frameworks.§ §Qualifications§  §You’ll have a degree in Data Analytics, Finance/Economics, Statistics, Operations Research, Engineering Science, or applied Mathematics.  Prior experience in the industry is a plus.  You’ll have a passion for and be an expert in modelling along with experience in dealing with large datasets.§  §If you love to push around data and get across complex problems, then this is the role for you!§  §Additional Information§  §Why choose to work for Meridian?§  §We have a superb culture where hard work, dedication and having a good time at work are vital. With a truly flexible, diverse and inclusive culture, we also offer an attractive salary package and benefits such as life and income protection insurance, enhanced leave, KiwiSaver and parental leave provisions, discounts from Meridian and various other organisations, the Meridian employee share scheme, and flexible work options where possible to make life easier for you, and to enable a better work life balance.§  §If you think you are an awesome fit, not only for our role but for Meridian – tell us why!  Include a cover letter with your CV and apply using the “Apply Now” button.  Our advertising period closes at the end of the day 23rd October and we will be in touch shortly after.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50728510.txt	§Programme Lead, Operational Policy and Performance, (Fixed Term)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Programme Lead, Operational Policy and Performance, (Fixed Term)§§Advertiser: §Department of Conservation§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Programme Lead, Operational Policy and Performance, (Fixed Term) §        §          §Now is the perfect time to join the National Compliance Team at the Department of Conservation as we increase in size and capability to strengthen our conservation law enforcement function. DOC's compliance function makes a key contribution to the protection of New Zealand's unique wildlife, cultural and natural taonga. It does this by enforcing compliance with the rules that apply on public conservation land, in marine reserves and mammal sanctuaries, and to protected wildlife.§          § §          §He angitūtanga: About the Role§          §As our next Programme Lead, Operational Policy and Performance, you will be responsible for leading operational policy, capability, systems and performance improvements for DOC's law enforcement and regulatory compliance function in collaboration with our Team Leads, Investigations. Your work will involve collaboration across the department as you put in place initiatives to lift performance.
