jobText: TXT/50731284.txt	§Intermediate Planner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Intermediate Planner§§Advertiser: §BTW Company Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Oct 2020§§Location§§Taranaki§, §New Plymouth§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Intermediate Planner §      §        §Operating since 1973, BTW is an innovative, solutions-focused group of Planners, Surveyors, Engineers, Environmental Scientists, UAV pilots, 3D Scanning Specialists, and Land and GIS experts. BTW’s staff of over 70 professionals are leaders in their fields with unparalleled experience on projects, both in New Zealand and overseas. BTW’s multidisciplinary teams operate from offices in New Plymouth and Hamilton.§        §We are looking to grow our New Plymouth planning team and need an Intermediate Planner ready and motivated to provide excellent service to existing and new clients. This is the chance for you to begin an exciting journey with BTW as an Intermediate Planner. You will become a core part of the team based in New Plymouth and also work closely with our planners in Hamilton. At BTW you will enjoy our flat structure and will feel that your contribution makes a tangible difference.  §        §We have several great projects lined up and would like to have an Intermediate Planner hit the ground running with us as soon as possible.§        §You will be responsible for undertaking the following work, depending on your skill set:§        §          §Contribute to planning projects and provide technical guidance and support to project teams.§          §Prepare AEE’s and consent applications, and process applications.§          §Prepare feasibility studies for potential projects and provide expert advice to clients.§          §Represent clients at Council hearings where necessary.§          §Carry out community and iwi consultation, including preparation of consultation documentation.§          §Provide Planning Policy services to clients in the form of policy analysis, submissions and representation at plan review hearings.§        §        §As an Intermediate Planner you will need:§        §          §Ideally more than 2 years’ experience in an environmental planning position.§          §To be working your way towards full membership with the New Zealand Planning Institute.§          §The ability to develop and sustain strong relationships with staff, customers, and contractors.§          §To be motivated, professional, cooperative, and responsive to the needs of the team and clients.§          §Strong written and spoken English and ability to articulate issues and solutions.§          §Able to deliver in a timely manner.§          §Active listening skills - giving full attention to what other people are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, and asking questions as appropriate.§          §Critical thinking - using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.§        §        §We offer all employees:§        §          §Competitive remuneration, and paid overtime.§          §Flexi-time which provides an excellent work-life balance, so you can enjoy what Taranaki has to offer.§          §A staff wellness programme.§          §A fantastic employee-led Training and Development Programme.§          §An engaging Leadership Team who will support and nurture your career.§        §        §If this sounds like you, please express your interest in the role by clicking ‘Apply Now’ and attaching a copy of your CV and covering letter. §        §Applications for this role close on Thursday 5 November 2020 at 5pm§        §You must have the legal right to work in New Zealand§        §For a confidential discussion about this opportunity, please phone Cam Twigley on 027 454 4886 or email cam.twigley@btw.nz§      §      §      §    §    §Join the team - making it happen. WWW.BTW.NZ §  §§§Operating since 1973, BTW is an innovative, solutions-focused group of Planners, Surveyors, Engineers, Environmental Scientists, UAV pilots, 3D Scanning Specialists, and Land and GIS experts. BTW’s staff of over 70 professionals are leaders in their fields with unparalleled experience on projects, both in New Zealand and overseas. BTW’s multidisciplinary teams operate from offices in New Plymouth and Hamilton.§ §We are looking to grow our New Plymouth planning team and need an Intermediate Planner ready and motivated to provide excellent service to existing and new clients. This is the chance for you to begin an exciting journey with BTW as an Intermediate Planner. You will become a core part of the team based in New Plymouth and also work closely with our planners in Hamilton. At BTW you will enjoy our flat structure and will feel that your contribution makes a tangible difference.  § §We have several great projects lined up and would like to have an Intermediate Planner hit the ground running with us as soon as possible.§ §You will be responsible for undertaking the following work, depending on your skill set:§ § §Contribute to planning projects and provide technical guidance and support to project teams.§ §Prepare AEE’s and consent applications, and process applications.§ §Prepare feasibility studies for potential projects and provide expert advice to clients.§ §Represent clients at Council hearings where necessary.§ §Carry out community and iwi consultation, including preparation of consultation documentation.§ §Provide Planning Policy services to clients in the form of policy analysis, submissions and representation at plan review hearings.§ §As an Intermediate Planner you will need:§ § §Ideally more than 2 years’ experience in an environmental planning position.§ §To be working your way towards full membership with the New Zealand Planning Institute.§ §The ability to develop and sustain strong relationships with staff, customers, and contractors.§ §To be motivated, professional, cooperative, and responsive to the needs of the team and clients.§ §Strong written and spoken English and ability to articulate issues and solutions.§ §Able to deliver in a timely manner.§ §Active listening skills - giving full attention to what other people are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, and asking questions as appropriate.§ §Critical thinking - using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.§ §We offer all employees:§ § §Competitive remuneration, and paid overtime.§ §Flexi-time which provides an excellent work-life balance, so you can enjoy what Taranaki has to offer.§ §A staff wellness programme.§ §A fantastic employee-led Training and Development Programme.§ §An engaging Leadership Team who will support and nurture your career.§ §If this sounds like you, please express your interest in the role by clicking ‘Apply Now’ and attaching a copy of your CV and covering letter. § §Applications for this role close on Thursday 5 November 2020 at 5pm§ §You must have the legal right to work in New Zealand§ §For a confidential discussion about this opportunity, please phone Cam Twigley on 027 454 4886 or email cam.twigley@btw.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50751476.txt	§Senior Advisor, Planning and Performance§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Advisor, Planning and Performance§§Advertiser: §NZ Transport Agency§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Senior Advisor, Planning and Performance §    §    §      §        § §        §          §Be part of a dynamic team, working closely with Principal Advisors to deliver planning and performance expertise across the group§          §Work with senior leaders at group level to provide insight, analysis and advice§          §Bring your superior Excel skills and strong background in performance and quantitative analysis§          §Wellington based§        §        § §        §Ko wai mātou§ | About us§        §At Waka Kotahi NZ Transport Agency, it all starts with our people. The organisation's performance and success depends on the people who choose to make this a great place to work and make a difference for Aotearoa. Waka Kotahi has a strong future focus, understanding that new technologies and changing customer expectations mean the transport system we know today will not be the one we deliver in ten years time.§        §This is an exciting time for the Regulatory Services group as we set ourselves up for future success delivering end-to-end regulatory services that are sharply focused on outcomes and delivering our regulatory purpose and objectives.  We have a rare opportunity to drive positive change that will make a difference to the way we work and the outcomes we can deliver for the public. Safety is a top priority for Waka Kotahi and we, as the Regulatory Services group, aim to improve safety and reduce the risk of harm by being a firm and fair regulator ensuring compliance - it is the essence of why we do what we do.  For more information, please visit §www.nzta.govt.nz/regulatory/§        §To view our regulatory strategy§ : §please visit §Tu Ake, Tu Maia - Stand Up, Stand Firm§        § §        §Te Whiwhinga mahi§ | The opportunity§        §The purpose of this role is to provide high quality analysis and advice to the Senior Manager Planning and Performance, the Regulatory Services Leadership Team and the wider Regulatory Services Management Team to support them in the areas of group business planning, operational planning, and performance/accountability reporting, including reporting progress against plans. The Senior Advisor supports planning and performance reporting across all Regulatory Services Group activities, as well as wider organisational accountability reporting processes.§        §As the Senior Advisor Planning and Performance, you will bring your strong strategic reporting and analysis experience to lead on the development and maintenance of reporting for use within the Regulatory Services Group and analyse performance information. You'll have a strong customer focus and be used to working with senior stakeholders to support them in the areas of performance and accountability reporting, including reporting progress against plans. You'll have strong written communications skills as well as an eye for detail and an interest in increasing the level of consistency to our reporting.§        § §        §Ko §koe §tēnei §| About you§        §To be successful in this role, you will bring:§        §      Knowledge and Experience§        §          §Demonstrated experience of reporting and analysis in strategic and/or operational areas§          §A strong analytical background, enabling key performance issues to be identified§          §Advanced Excel skills§          §Experience in operational or strategic planning§          §Excellent verbal and written communication skills§          §Strong relationship management skills, including building trust and confidence, to a senior level§          §Proven ability to work collaboratively within and across teams§          §The ability to work with the business to develop appropriate measures and reports§          §Experience in developing frameworks, systems and processes§          §Experience in a complex public sector agency and familiarity with regulatory environments is desirable.§        §        §     Qualifications:§        §          §A tertiary qualification in a relevant discipline or equivalent experience is desirable§        §        § §        §Rā Katinga §| Applications close : Sunday, 1 Nov 2020§        § §        §For a copy of the position description, please visit: §www.nzta.govt.nz/careers§        §For further information, email: §careers@nzta.govt.nz§        §To be considered for this position you must have a legal right to live and work in New Zealand.§        §Waka Kotahi NZ Transport Agency is an equal opportunity employer (EOE). At the Agency we recognise the importance of diversity and inclusion and are committed to providing a working environment that embraces these values. Please let us know if you need any support or have any access requirements that will help you through the recruitment process.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ §§Be part of a dynamic team, working closely with Principal Advisors to deliver planning and performance expertise across the group§Work with senior leaders at group level to provide insight, analysis and advice§Bring your superior Excel skills and strong background in performance and quantitative analysis§Wellington based§§ §Ko wai mātou§ | About us§At Waka Kotahi NZ Transport Agency, it all starts with our people. The organisation's performance and success depends on the people who choose to make this a great place to work and make a difference for Aotearoa. Waka Kotahi has a strong future focus, understanding that new technologies and changing customer expectations mean the transport system we know today will not be the one we deliver in ten years time.§This is an exciting time for the Regulatory Services group as we set ourselves up for future success delivering end-to-end regulatory services that are sharply focused on outcomes and delivering our regulatory purpose and objectives.  We have a rare opportunity to drive positive change that will make a difference to the way we work and the outcomes we can deliver for the public. Safety is a top priority for Waka Kotahi and we, as the Regulatory Services group, aim to improve safety and reduce the risk of harm by being a firm and fair regulator ensuring compliance - it is the essence of why we do what we do.  For more information, please visit §www.nzta.govt.nz/regulatory/§To view our regulatory strategy§ : §please visit §Tu Ake, Tu Maia - Stand Up, Stand Firm§§ §Te Whiwhinga mahi§ | The opportunity§The purpose of this role is to provide high quality analysis and advice to the Senior Manager Planning and Performance, the Regulatory Services Leadership Team and the wider Regulatory Services Management Team to support them in the areas of group business planning, operational planning, and performance/accountability reporting, including reporting progress against plans. The Senior Advisor supports planning and performance reporting across all Regulatory Services Group activities, as well as wider organisational accountability reporting processes.§As the Senior Advisor Planning and Performance, you will bring your strong strategic reporting and analysis experience to lead on the development and maintenance of reporting for use within the Regulatory Services Group and analyse performance information. You'll have a strong customer focus and be used to working with senior stakeholders to support them in the areas of performance and accountability reporting, including reporting progress against plans. You'll have strong written communications skills as well as an eye for detail and an interest in increasing the level of consistency to our reporting.§ §§Ko §koe §tēnei §| About you§To be successful in this role, you will bring:§      Knowledge and Experience§§Demonstrated experience of reporting and analysis in strategic and/or operational areas§A strong analytical background, enabling key performance issues to be identified§Advanced Excel skills§Experience in operational or strategic planning§Excellent verbal and written communication skills§Strong relationship management skills, including building trust and confidence, to a senior level§Proven ability to work collaboratively within and across teams§The ability to work with the business to develop appropriate measures and reports§Experience in developing frameworks, systems and processes§Experience in a complex public sector agency and familiarity with regulatory environments is desirable.§§     Qualifications:§§A tertiary qualification in a relevant discipline or equivalent experience is desirable§§ §Rā Katinga §| Applications close : Sunday, 1 Nov 2020§ §For a copy of the position description, please visit: §www.nzta.govt.nz/careers§For further information, email: §careers@nzta.govt.nz§§To be considered for this position you must have a legal right to live and work in New Zealand.§§Waka Kotahi NZ Transport Agency is an equal opportunity employer (EOE). At the Agency we recognise the importance of diversity and inclusion and are committed to providing a working environment that embraces these values. Please let us know if you need any support or have any access requirements that will help you through the recruitment process.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50722133.txt	§Senior Governance Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Governance Advisor§§Advertiser: §NZDF§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§$86308 - $106616 including 4% super contribution§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§What you will do§In this dynamic role, you will be responsible for the provision of expert governance advice, analysis and monitoring to enable effective and efficient NZDF governance systems, policies, processes and controls across Defence Estate and Infrastructure (DEI).§You will also be responsible for:§Providing secretariat support and, professional advice and guidance to senior level governance boards and committees across DEI;§Promoting and upskilling the DEI team in good decision-making and quality assurance;§Preparing presentations and documentation and maintaining the document management system; and§Coordinating and managing preparation and distribution of regular Estate performance management reports.§This is an exciting time to join our team; you will be able to utilise your governance experience to support the integration of our new Alliance services partnership model.§What we need §This role requires sound understanding of governance within the public sector at a senior level.  You will have an ability to think methodically, establish and maintain sound processes and systems, and respond quickly to complex issues.  You will be adaptable and flexible to meet changing needs.§You must also have:§Confidence with policy analysis techniques and a demonstrated ability to apply these to produce high quality policy advice;§Political savvy with the ability to work with ease in the internal political environment;§Proactive and effective management skills for internal and external relationships, conscious of organisational reputation; and§A high degree of sensitivity with the ability to liaise with confidence and influence personnel at all levels.§Who we are §Defence Estate and Infrastructure develop, maintain and manage land, property and infrastructure assets in order to support NZDF military capabilities and all of government outcomes, through the Defence Estate Regeneration Programme. The Defence estate comprises over 80,000ha of land with infrastructure and buildings with a replacement value of some $2.8bn. Defence Estate and Infrastructure is gearing up for major reinvestment and recapitalisation work over the coming years to 2025. §Every hour of every day, 365 days of the year, the New Zealand Defence Force is contributing to the defence, security and well-being of Aotearoa / New Zealand.  As a modern, professional military, it is our goal to maintain well trained, equipped and disciplined armed forces that can react to crisis at short notice. §Why Us§NZDF is an inclusive organisation that is open to flexible working arrangements and welcomes applications from people regardless of gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, age, beliefs/opinions, or family circumstances.§In return for your expertise and dedication, NZDF is offering remuneration reflective of your experience, along with:§Great benefits for you and your family§;§Fully funded life cover up to $300,000;§Discounts Handbook for selected retail, entertainment and service providers;§5 weeks annual leave per year;§Flexible working environment and positive culture;§Opportunities for career development.§How to Apply§To view the Position Description and to Apply Online please visit our §Defence Careers§ website, or use the links on this page.§Please note:§ If you are an existing NZDF employee (excluding contractors) you must apply through our Internal Vacancies site, via the HR Toolkit.§Applications close on §Monday 26 October 2020§.§Please note: §Applicants must be legally entitled to work in New Zealand (NZ) and be able to obtain and maintain the required level of NZ Government security clearance for the position applied for. The minimum citizenship and residency criteria for security clearances to be granted by the NZ Defence Force are as follows:§Low level Security Clearance§most preferably a NZ citizen, who §has resided in this country continuously§ for at least the last §five years§, OR§is a citizen of, §and/or has resided continuously§ in one or more of the following countries for the last §five years§: either Australia, Canada, NZ, the United Kingdom (UK) or the United States of America (USA); §and§ has a background history that is verifiable and can be assessed as appropriate by the NZ Security Intelligence Service (NZSIS) towards a recommendation of suitability for a security clearance at this level.§If you do not meet these minimum criteria, we will not be able to accept your application.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50759831.txt	§Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Consultant§§Advertiser: §Catalyze APAC§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§$80,000 - $100,000§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§About Catalyze § §Catalyze makes significant contributions to decision-making across the public, private and not-for-profit sectors – transforming the way the world makes decisions that matter, bringing confidence and clarity to every decision.   § § § §Catalyze is a boutique strategic management consultancy headquartered in Sydney, Australia with clients and offices in Australia and New Zealand.   § § § §We are world leading and sought-after independent experts in the fields of Decision Thinking and Decision Science. § § § §Catalyze was founded in 2001 in association with the London School of Economics. § § §Our team currently consists of seven professionals from diverse backgrounds and experience, united by a common mission to apply Decision Thinking to solve tricky problems.  We love creating opportunities, delivering value and delighting clients which means our team will grow significantly over the next few years – starting now!    § §Purpose of position § §Our Consultants play a critical role in contributing to the success and evolution of Catalyze as a growing boutique management consultancy.  § §Our Consultants are responsible for: § § § §Delivering services that support our client engagements § § § §Supporting our Principal consultants and Directors § § § §Contributing to the growth and evolution of Catalyze. § § §We are looking for motivated and capable people to join our growing team as either Canberra-based or Wellington-based consultants. § §How we Work § §We are client focussed, passionate about what we do and keen on building the capability and capacity of our team.  We routinely invest in upskilling our people.  § §Our clients are Government Departments and Agencies, Corporates and leading Not for Profits. We work with organisations committed to making informed decisions in the face of often constrained and finite resources - whether money, time, or people - to produce the greatest value, positive outcomes and impact for all. By all, we mean our clients and those they serve; citizens, communities, teams and customers. § §We solve hard problems for and with our clients - day in and day out. Problems of investment, return, constraints of any nature, strategy, performance, complexity, systems, capability, tough decisions, even simply, a lack of clarity … and more. § §After years of experience, it is crystal clear; virtually every problem ultimately comes down to making one or more critical decisions to create the optimal solution. § §We partner with our clients to solve these problems and create market leading, defensible, solutions via our deep subject matter expertise and thought leadership in Decision Thinking. This is delivered through advisory and delivering often high visibility, small and large scale bespoke projects built on best in class decision making practices and proprietary software. § §We transform standard decision-making practices to maximise value for money and solve those hard problems.   § §We bring an openness, flexibility, creativity and transparency to decision making processes, educating, adding value, creating shared understanding and an aligned commitment to the way forward on any critical decision; driving successful execution.  We have organisations: § § § §actively involve stakeholders and  § § § §move beyond considering JUST the dollars to considering everything that adds value - both the financial and non-financial. Always. § § §And it works! § §Our Values§ § §At Catalyze we ‘Strive, Drive and Thrive’. § §For our clients and stakeholders, we value participation, transparency, tangible and intangible values, choice, performance and transformation. § §We underpin our work with independence, creativity and quality, bringing expertise in Decision Thinking and years of experience with Multi Criteria Decision Analysis. § §We want work to be fun, collaborative, engaging and flexible.  We are committed to all staff participating in shaping our company.  We want our people to grow to maximise their (and our) full potential! We welcome diversity and innovation. § §You can find out more about Catalyze at www.catalyzeapac.com § §Your key relationships § §In this role your key relationships will be with: § § § §clients and their representatives § § § §potential/prospective clients or referrers  § § § §Catalyze’s Sydney, Canberra and Wellington-based staff: our CEO, our NZ Director and our Canberra Director  § § § §Catalyze UK staff § § §What we expect a Consultant to do § §As a Consultant you will work with clients at a senior level in the government and corporate sectors, supporting and contributing to the design and delivery of tailored decision-making processes, including customised training programmes.  § §You’ll have responsibilities for: § § § §planning, supporting and contributing to, client meetings, written and verbal communications § § § §working with Catalyze colleagues on all aspects of client engagements from scope definition to delivery, and in particular supporting the successful delivery of client workshops § § § §providing analytical support, from analysing data to configuring Catalyze software tools, to meet the requirements of clients and colleagues § § § §conducting quantitative and qualitative analysis of data for inclusion into client briefings, workshops and reports § § § §supporting business development in Australia and New Zealand, including supporting proposal development § § § §supporting Catalyze Knowledge investment activities, including capturing process design, developing operation procedures, etc. § § § §supporting client training activities, including developing training materials, planning training activities and contributing to training delivery § § § §consistently achieving the highest possible standard of work. § § §Your work at Catalyze will generally involve: § § § §working with senior consultants to help clients define their situation and the problems they need to address, including understanding and eliciting their requirements § § § §supporting the planning of processes to make decisions and documenting process design § § § §planning and helping co-ordinate Catalyze projects § § § §supporting clients to prepare material for decision processes § § § §supporting client workshops § § § §building decision models  § § § §analysing workshop outputs  § § § §producing written reports and presentations to clients – including proposals for new work § § § §supporting clients to create briefings and other documentation such as business cases § § §Key Requirements/Competencies § §To succeed in this role, you will need to have strong analytical skills and a real interest in strategy and organisational processes. You will be equally interested in both the technical and quantitative side of our work, as well as the social/group process side of successful consulting.  § §Essential requirements: § § § §Client-focussed, with the ability to listen and ask astute questions. § § § §Strong numerical and analytical skills with the ability to analyse, understand and explain quantitative data. You must be highly numerate. § § § §Excellent interpersonal skills and strong relationship management skills. § § § §Solid communication skills, both written and verbal. § § § §Competent with the Microsoft suite of products – i.e. Word, PowerPoint, and in particular aptitude with Microsoft Excel for organising, collecting and analysing data. § § § §Solid organisational and time management skills, with an ability to prioritise your workload, multi-task and participate in multiple projects at once. § § § §Suitability to hold and maintain a security clearance in the relevant country (i.e. Australia or New Zealand).  § § §Other desirable but non-essential attributes are: § § § §demonstrable business skills, with the ability to apply these in a workshop environment  § § § §business acumen and commercial awareness § § § §project management skills and experience § § § §presentation and facilitation skills § § § §an existing security clearance in the relevant country (i.e. Australia or New Zealand). § § §Personal Attributes § §As a Catalyze Consultant you would be expected to have the following personal attributes. § § § §Enthusiastic, professional and flexible § § § §Easy to work with – a good fit with the rest of the Catalyze team  § § § §Enjoy working collaboratively in a team environment § § § §Proactive self-starter § § § §Thrive in an often ambiguous, fast paced work environment § § § §Well-developed professional and ethical values § § § §Availability for occasional travel possibly for a few days at a time, to support our projects across Australia and New Zealand § § § §High attention to detail and focus on excellence § § § §Enjoy learning § § § §Be an Australian citizen § § §Qualifications and Experience § § § §A relevant tertiary qualification is essential § § § §Knowledge and experience of one or more of the following would be advantageous:   § § § §Enterprise Portfolio Management § § § §Portfolio Prioritisation § § § §Decision Science (multi-criteria analysis)  § § § §Relevant Government agencies and Australian or New Zealand Public Sector. § § § §A post grad qualification is desirable  § § §Please note: Catalyze will provide the training in our subject-matter expertise, in particular Multi Criteria Decision Analysis (MCDA) and Decision Thinking.  § §Confidentiality and Security § §Everyone at Catalyze is expected to maintain high ethical standards and fully comply with client confidentiality requirements for all assignments.  § §This role requires you to have the ability to obtain and maintain an Australian or New Zealand high-level national security clearance to meet certain clients’ requirements.  Ideally, you will already have a clearance of this nature.  If not, you should be aware the clearance process will require you to provide authorisation to obtain a significant amount of personal information including any criminal history.   § §For more information about the relevant security clearance processes see: § §Australia: https://beta.defence.gov.au/security/clearances/applicants-holders/getting-a-security-clearance § §New Zealand: https://www.protectivesecurity.govt.nz/personnel-security/clearances/getting-a-clearance/ § §How to apply § §Send us your CV and a brief covering letter about your suitability for the role and why you want to work with Catalyze.  Remember to include your preferred work location (Canberra or Wellington)  § §Submit your application to info@catalyzeapac.com by 5pm AEDT (7pm NZDT) Monday 26 October 2020. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a consulting role?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§What's your expected annual base salary?§What's your highest level of education?§§§

jobText: TXT/50760567.txt	§Transaction Advisors, Infrastructure Advisory§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Transaction Advisors, Infrastructure Advisory§§Advertiser: §Aurecon§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Transaction Advisors, Infrastructure Advisory §      §        §Just imagine your future with us…§ § At Aurecon we see the future through a very different lens. Do you?§ § Innovation, eminence and digital are at the heart of everything we do. Are you excited about the future? Are you driven by the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging and complex projects around the world and to learn from the best? We are.§ § Diversity is at the core of everything we do. We work together to create a culture based on respect, trust and inclusiveness. Our differences are what fuel our creativity. We embrace flexible working and are always open to discussing your individual needs so that you get to create your own experience with us.§ § §What will you do?§ § Aurecon is experiencing significant growth within our Infrastructure Advisory service offering. At the heart of it, we are about connecting business strategy to assets and executing the decisions well. In these positions you will join our Infrastructure Advisory business, where you will play an integral part in a team of highly skilled specialists that 'bring ideas to life' for our clients across the built environment, transport, land and water, energy and industrial and government.§ § You will aspire to be a trusted partner to our preferred clients, working across the whole infrastructure asset lifecycle, advising on investments and decisions that drive value and proactively respond to disruptive change.§ § Through a deep understanding of their challenges you will work with our clients to co-create innovate solutions that help to shape the future. It's your knowledge of decision making, projects and assets supported by the broader technical expertise of the business that really will set us apart. Here are the key things you will do to deliver 'advice that matters'.§ §        §          §Leading the development of portfolio strategies, business cases, asset decision frameworks, due diligence and transaction management / technical advisory services drawing in the broader expertise of Aurecon§          §Maintaining and further developing relationships with a wide range of clients and critical internal and external stakeholders§          §We know today's complex challenges can only be solved through bringing together diverse teams of people from across our business, so there will be opportunities for you to apply your skills and creativity to projects in other geographies and markets§        §        §What can you bring to the team?§ § Firstly, you will share our genuine passion for re-imaging problems and be someone that actively pursues continuous learning to help shape the future. To be successful in this position you will have:§ §        §          §Varying levels of project experience (suited to your career status) at all phases of a projects life cycle and particularly business case stages and technical / transaction management§          §A client network aligned with your career status§          §A Bachelor's degree or higher in Engineering, Project Management, Commerce/Economics or similar§        §        §We are looking to fill multiple opportunities in NSW, Victoria and NZ. These roles may suit experienced individuals from a range of professional profiles, however asset and project delivery knowledge is vital. Relevant tertiary qualifications and experience in public and private interface is important. Sector attributes sought include strategic thinking, project scoping, commercial acumen and influencing.§ § Our §Aurecon Attributes§ describe the types of people we bring together for clients. We don't expect you to have all eight of the attributes, but one that is unique to you.§ § Finally, we value that each of our team members brings something different to Aurecon. We look for people who have had a broad range of experiences throughout their career and can demonstrate how they have worked as part of a team to bring ideas to life.§ § §About us§ § Aurecon is an advisory and engineering company, but not as you know it!§ § Our clients' ideas drive what we do. Drawing on our deep pool of expertise, we co-create innovative solutions with our clients to some of the world's most complex challenges. jobText: TXT/50753989.txt	§Business Reporting Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Reporting Analyst§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Automobile Association Inc.§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§About the AA:§For over 110 years we've been helping kiwis on their adventures. We've become a trusted partner to our Members, who are at the heart of everything we do. And, as one of New Zealand's most enduring brands, we've become a permanent feature of our cultural landscape.§Our people are talented, naturally curious and love to ask 'what's next?' This means that here at the AA you'll be surrounded by proud, passionate people who love a challenge, work as one and enjoy our unique team spirit.§About the role:§The Business Reporting Analyst is a key role in our Channel Capability and Performance team which will provide management information, business insights, and performance analytics to support the division.§The purpose of this role is to consolidate Management Reporting across all distribution channels, channel performance insights and analysis, workforce productivity and performance analysis.§You will also provide reporting and data analysis support to the Channel Strategy and Delivery division for internal performance management and for external partner relationship management on the AA performance levels delivered.§Skills and experience required:§Minimum of 5 years of business/financial reporting experience including reporting/forecasting and/or workforce planning§Advanced knowledge of relevant Microsoft applications including MS Excel and MS Word§Experience of reviewing, monitoring and measuring systems, procedures and processes within a service environment§High level of understanding of business systems, technology and reporting systems§Desirable knowledge/experience with SQL, Tableau, Salesforce§If this sounds like you, apply now!§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50754079.txt	§Operations Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Operations Manager§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Automobile Association Inc.§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Corporate Development§§§§§§About the AA:§For over 110 years we've been helping kiwis on their adventures. We've become a trusted partner to our Members, who are at the heart of everything we do. And, as one of New Zealand's most enduring brands, we've become a permanent feature of our cultural landscape.§Our people are talented, naturally curious and love to ask 'what's next?' This means that here at the AA you'll be surrounded by proud, passionate people who love a challenge, work as one and enjoy our unique team spirit.§About the role:§The Operations Manager will be the bridge between the AA Retail Centres and key product stakeholders to ensure seamless integration of product solutions and services. You will drive customer experience and the ability of the Centre Network to deliver agreed performance results.§We have 37 centres across New Zealand with over 70 different products and services. You will design and manage the Operational Framework for the Centre Network, this will encompass end-to-end business processes, risk management, customer feedback and knowledge management systems, productivity modelling, reporting.§We want you to bring a fresh and dynamic approach to leading outstanding, empathetic customer interactions; creating a robust framework in the process.§Skills and experience required:§You'll need to be all over the process of sales and have proven experience in risk and compliance, as well as coaching, developing techniques and resources to motivate and lift process capability. Ideally, you will also have:§Tertiary qualification in Business or relevant field§Proven work experience 5 years+ as either an Operations Manager or Senior Business Analyst role in an insurance or financial services/banking environment§Knowledge multi-channel retail environments§Understanding of regulatory environment covering insurance and financial services§If you are up for a new challenge and have worked within the financial services sector then apply. This is a great opportunity for you to make a difference and build a legacy for yourself in a truly challenging organisation. Apply now!§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50764458.txt	§Project Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Project Manager§§Advertiser: §NoRTH - A division of Northern Regional Alliance Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Project Manager §      §        §Project Manager – Northern Regional Alliance (Frail Elderly / Older Persons Services) §        §We are seeking a project manager to work on Regional projects aimed at the transformation of older person’s healthcare services. This is a fixed term contract to progress service improvement work with a key objective being to ensure delivery of effective and efficient services to meet rising service need in a clinically and financially sustainable manner.§        §The regional project manager role supports a regional Clinical Lead and works with our Region’s 4 DHB Health of Older People management structures. The regional projects relate to those areas of work where our 4 DHBs agree to work jointly to drive improvements or to ensure consistency of approach across our region. §        §The role is a maternity leave replacement. It is for a minimum of 1 year to progress an agreed workplan during 2020/21. The role is currently part-time, 3 days per week, could possibly be more, and is based in Ellerslie/Penrose. The role may require some travel within the Northern Region (north of the Bombay Hills)§        §About Northern Region health and the programme of work§        §The Northern Region is home to almost 4 in 10 New Zealanders, and its healthcare leaders have a good track record of working together to deliver innovation and change through the Northern Regional Alliance. You can read an executive summary of the Region’s Long Term Health Plan §here§.  §        §The Government has backed our long term vision for healthcare transformation for the next 20 years, and we continue to develop the related programmes and projects, to scale up our collaboration, and to deliver changes in clinical services for patients. §        §About the role§        §The project manager role will be instrumental in helping to plan, lead and deliver projects to achieve benefits in  Frail Elderly Services. The successful candidate will: §        §          §Help detail a persuasive case for change, gaining stakeholder commitment to that change §          §Apply project management practices across the streams of work, including stakeholder engagement, governance/assurance, planning/tracking/reporting, benefits and risk management. §          §Provide secretariat services to periodic regional meetings §          §Progress key work to help drive change and to realise benefits. This is a key part of this role.§        §        §        §About you§        §It goes without saying that you'll have excellent people and communication skills (both spoken and written). You will be able to build relationships and work with people across organisations. You will be a logical thinker, be a self-starter, able to work both individually and as part of a team, with support and guidance from the NRA portfolio manager, and Older Peoples Services Subject Matter Experts (SMEs). Knowledge of older people health care services will be helpful, but is not critical to this role.§        §        §If this sounds like you, we would like to hear from you.§        §You must be eligible to work in New Zealand to be considered for this opportunity.  While all applications will be acknowledged by email, we regret that only successful candidates required for interviews will be contacted directly.  §        §We are committed to delivering the best health outcomes for our total population. We strongly encourage applicants from all backgrounds with the necessary capability and who share our values to apply. We would greatly value seeing more applicants from our Māori & Pacific communities. §        §For further information please contact:§ Rachna Sudhakar, HR Manager (NRA) via §Rachna.sudhakar@nra.co.nz§ §        §Applications close 8 November 2020§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Project Manager – Northern Regional Alliance (Frail Elderly / Older Persons Services) § §We are seeking a project manager to work on Regional projects aimed at the transformation of older person’s healthcare services. This is a fixed term contract to progress service improvement work with a key objective being to ensure delivery of effective and efficient services to meet rising service need in a clinically and financially sustainable manner.§ §The regional project manager role supports a regional Clinical Lead and works with our Region’s 4 DHB Health of Older People management structures. The regional projects relate to those areas of work where our 4 DHBs agree to work jointly to drive improvements or to ensure consistency of approach across our region. § §The role is a maternity leave replacement. It is for a minimum of 1 year to progress an agreed workplan during 2020/21. The role is currently part-time, 3 days per week, could possibly be more, and is based in Ellerslie/Penrose. The role may require some travel within the Northern Region (north of the Bombay Hills)§ §About Northern Region health and the programme of work§ §The Northern Region is home to almost 4 in 10 New Zealanders, and its healthcare leaders have a good track record of working together to deliver innovation and change through the Northern Regional Alliance. You can read an executive summary of the Region’s Long Term Health Plan §here§.  § §The Government has backed our long term vision for healthcare transformation for the next 20 years, and we continue to develop the related programmes and projects, to scale up our collaboration, and to deliver changes in clinical services for patients. § §About the role§ §The project manager role will be instrumental in helping to plan, lead and deliver projects to achieve benefits in  Frail Elderly Services. The successful candidate will: § §Help detail a persuasive case for change, gaining stakeholder commitment to that change § §Apply project management practices across the streams of work, including stakeholder engagement, governance/assurance, planning/tracking/reporting, benefits and risk management. § §Provide secretariat services to periodic regional meetings § §Progress key work to help drive change and to realise benefits. This is a key part of this role.§ § §About you§ §It goes without saying that you'll have excellent people and communication skills (both spoken and written). You will be able to build relationships and work with people across organisations. You will be a logical thinker, be a self-starter, able to work both individually and as part of a team, with support and guidance from the NRA portfolio manager, and Older Peoples Services Subject Matter Experts (SMEs). Knowledge of older people health care services will be helpful, but is not critical to this role.§ § §If this sounds like you, we would like to hear from you.§ §You must be eligible to work in New Zealand to be considered for this opportunity.  While all applications will be acknowledged by email, we regret that only successful candidates required for interviews will be contacted directly.  § §We are committed to delivering the best health outcomes for our total population. We strongly encourage applicants from all backgrounds with the necessary capability and who share our values to apply. We would greatly value seeing more applicants from our Māori & Pacific communities. § §For further information please contact:§ Rachna Sudhakar, HR Manager (NRA) via §Rachna.sudhakar@nra.co.nz§ § §Applications close 8 November 2020§§§§§

We are responsible for providing active stewardship and leadership across the nations health and disability system. jobText: TXT/50764661.txt	§Sustainability Programme Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Sustainability Programme Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Far North District Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Oct 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Rest of Northland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§§ tbody > tr > td, .job-template__wrapper table[cellpadding="2"] > thead > tr > th { padding: 2px; }§-->§.job-template__wrapper [bgcolor="#000000"] { background-color: #000000; }§.job-template__wrapper [bgcolor="#ffffff"] { background-color: #ffffff; }§.job-template__wrapper [border="0"] { border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; }§§  §    §      §        §          §            §              §                §              §              §                §                §              §              §                § §                  § §                  §Sustainability Programme Coordinator§                  § §                  §                  §                    §Te wero – The Challenge§                    §Far North District Council has recently approved a road map for how the Council and the Far North will respond to the challenges of climate change. We now need a Sustainability Programme Manager to progress the initiatives in this roadmap into meaningful outcome focused programmes and projects that will deliver on the Council’s climate change goals of:§                    §                      §Reducing the Council’s greenhouse gas emissions in line with the Governments national emission reduction targets or better§                      §Supporting the businesses and communities of the Far North towards a carbon zero 2050§                      §Future proofing the Council’s services, resources and assets from the risk of climate change§                      §Working with the communities of the Far North to prepare for and adapt to the impacts of climate change§                    §                    § The Sustainability Programme Coordinator role sits within the Strategic Policy & Planning Group but will be required to work across all groups within Council as well as collaborating closely with key external partners and stakeholders across the Far North, Northland and New Zealand.§                    §The successful candidate will lead the transition of Council from its current state towards it’s climate change goals by being the champion and lead for climate change adaption and mitigation initiatives in the Council.§                    § §                    §I ā koe§– About You§                    §You’ll be a proven sustainability professional with experience leading the development of complex projects and programmes of work with multiple internal and external stakeholders. You’ll be confident managing programmes from initiation through to the closing of projects and the realisation of climate change outcomes and benefits.§                    §As well as your proven programme and project management experience you will also have demonstrated experience in leading, inspiring, developing and building overall capability across the team and wider organisation by applying your skills in influencing, change management and thought leadership. Your innovative thinking will help shape the work programme and identify new approaches to addressing problems while advancing opportunities that are also presenting themselves as a result of climate change.§                    §You will have strong communication and interpersonal skills that allow you to engage with a range of different parties, both internal and external to Council, as well positioning you to grow into a trusted and respected colleague and advisor who role models the organisational values.  In short you are a team player who enjoys working collaboratively to accomplish shared goals. §                    § §                    §Tā mātou āroha §– What we Offer§                    §Far North District Council§ is a progressive and growing Council filled with like-minded people who love what they do and are committed to providing superior services to residents in their community.§                    §We value skilled, bold and enthusiastic employees who are open to new ways of looking at problems and responses.  We pride ourselves on maintaining a work culture that is supportive, encourages learning and recognises success.§                    §The salary for this position is Grade 19 which gives this position a salary range of $97,546 to $114,760 per annum plus Kiwi Saver, dependent on qualifications and experience of the successful candidate.  We offer you flexible work arrangements and the chance to enjoy the lifestyle and beauty only the Far North region can provide.§                    §You will also be given all the tools of the trade you need to hit the ground running including a laptop, mobile phone and a professional development plan that ensures your ongoing growth and success within the organisation.§                    § §                    §Positions like this don't come along often so don't wait - apply now!§                    §Creating Great Places, Supporting our People§                    § §                    § §Applications  close on Tuesday, 3 November 2020§                    §                    § §                    § Email: Please click the 'Apply Now' button below.§                  §                  §The Far North District Council is an§ Equal Employment Opportunity Employer§                §              §            §          §        §      §    §  §§§Te wero – The Challenge§ §Far North District Council has recently approved a road map for how the Council and the Far North will respond to the challenges of climate change. We now need a Sustainability Programme Manager to progress the initiatives in this roadmap into meaningful outcome focused programmes and projects that will deliver on the Council’s climate change goals of:§ § §Reducing the Council’s greenhouse gas emissions in line with the Governments national emission reduction targets or better§ §Supporting the businesses and communities of the Far North towards a carbon zero 2050§ §Future proofing the Council’s services, resources and assets from the risk of climate change§ §Working with the communities of the Far North to prepare for and adapt to the impacts of climate change§ § § The Sustainability Programme Coordinator role sits within the Strategic Policy & Planning Group but will be required to work across all groups within Council as well as collaborating closely with key external partners and stakeholders across the Far North, Northland and New Zealand.§ §The successful candidate will lead the transition of Council from its current state towards it’s climate change goals by being the champion and lead for climate change adaption and mitigation initiatives in the Council.§ § § §I ā koe§– About You§ §You’ll be a proven sustainability professional with experience leading the development of complex projects and programmes of work with multiple internal and external stakeholders. You’ll be confident managing programmes from initiation through to the closing of projects and the realisation of climate change outcomes and benefits.§ §As well as your proven programme and project management experience you will also have demonstrated experience in leading, inspiring, developing and building overall capability across the team and wider organisation by applying your skills in influencing, change management and thought leadership. Your innovative thinking will help shape the work programme and identify new approaches to addressing problems while advancing opportunities that are also presenting themselves as a result of climate change.§ §You will have strong communication and interpersonal skills that allow you to engage with a range of different parties, both internal and external to Council, as well positioning you to grow into a trusted and respected colleague and advisor who role models the organisational values.  In short you are a team player who enjoys working collaboratively to accomplish shared goals. § § § §Tā mātou āroha §– What we Offer§ §Far North District Council§ is a progressive and growing Council filled with like-minded people who love what they do and are committed to providing superior services to residents in their community.§ §We value skilled, bold and enthusiastic employees who are open to new ways of looking at problems and responses.  We pride ourselves on maintaining a work culture that is supportive, encourages learning and recognises success.§ §The salary for this position is Grade 19 which gives this position a salary range of $97,546 to $114,760 per annum plus Kiwi Saver, dependent on qualifications and experience of the successful candidate.  We offer you flexible work arrangements and the chance to enjoy the lifestyle and beauty only the Far North region can provide.§ §You will also be given all the tools of the trade you need to hit the ground running including a laptop, mobile phone and a professional development plan that ensures your ongoing growth and success within the organisation.§ § § §Positions like this don't come along often so don't wait - apply now!§ §Creating Great Places, Supporting our People§ § § § §Applications  close on Tuesday, 3 November 2020§ §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50752683.txt	§Senior Change Manager - Lead, Coach & Guide§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Change Manager - Lead, Coach & Guide§§Advertiser: §Taska§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§Here is a chance to join a large programme which is focused on ensuring standards are met which will  have a positive flow on effect for tamariki and whanau.§As a Senior Change Manager we expect that you have worked on large projects / programmes before where there has been process through to business change.§Experience:§ § §coaching, leading and driving employees through change must be demonstrated§ §shaping Change activities so they align with the programmes strategic goals§ §facilitating and leading discussions§ § §This is a top group of Change experts so as well as you sharing your knowledge it is a chance to work with other superb Change Managers. §An appreciation of Te Ao Māori would be welcome but not essential.§This is a Fixed Term Contract for between 18 - 24 mths§§§§

jobText: TXT/50765563.txt	§Lead Advisor Strategy and Projects | Kaitohutohu Arataki Rautaki, Kokiri hoki§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lead Advisor Strategy and Projects | Kaitohutohu Arataki Rautaki, Kokiri hoki§§Advertiser: §Stats NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Lead Advisor Strategy and Projects | Kaitohutohu Arataki Rautaki, Kokiri hoki §      §        §          §            §About Us | §Mō mātou§            §At Tatauranga Aotearoa, Stats NZ, our vision is to unleash the power of data to change lives.  As New Zealand’s official data and statistics agency, we are tasked with leading the way for New Zealand’s data future, enabling data-led innovation across society, the economy, and the environment. §            §The role | Mō te tūnga§            §            §Reporting to the Senior Manager Customer Experience, you’ll be instrumental in helping connect New Zealanders to data, enabling them gain maximum value from all that we produce.  You will take a lead role in the development of the strategy, design and implementation of Stats NZ’s approach to sharing and publishing data, statistics and other information. Your role will initially focus on ensuring data and statistics are made available at the right time and in the right way. §            §You will need to be a strategic thinker who can make connections between government strategies, international trends, and Stats NZ’s own operational requirements and role as a leader in the data system. You will be comfortable working with a wide range of people, providing effective coaching and thought leadership to lift strategic capability across the business unit. §            §You will need to develop compelling arguments for innovation and improvements, and you will produce proposals and plans that are put forward for investment decisions.  You may be responsible for leading work that flows from approved business cases or relevant strategies, and you also may be responsible for engaging others to lead work. §            §Working in the Customer Experience team, it is important that you bring a cu§stomer-centric approach to your work and demonstrate this in all you do.  §            §Salary range $85,000 - $100,000 negotiable depending on the experience of the successful candidate. §            §About you | §Mōu§            §              §You should have significant experience developing and implementing organisation wide strategies that produce demonstrable benefits.  This should be combined with strong experience in leading initiatives and projects, preferably in a customer-centric environment §              §You will be strongly advantaged if you have experience in the dissemination of data and information, or equivalent strategies that deal with sharing and publishing information §              §Your well-developed critical thinking and ability to think strategically will be utilised heavily, particularly your ability to analyse information, develop options and exercise sound judgement §              §You should bring an open and fresh approach, inclusive and collaborative style and the desire to delight your customers. §              §Knowledge/familiarity or a commitment to learn/understand Te Ao Māori (the Māori world view), and how this applies to the work we/you do. §            §          §          §            §What’s in it for you? | Ngā hua ka riro ki a koe§            §            §You’ll be joining an inclusive environment where people, regardless of gender, race, disability, religion or background are supported to be able to do their best work. §            §              §Opportunity to develop and grow your career (e.g. coaching culture, study support, secondments) §              §Flexible by default, balance life and work commitments §              §An environment that’s safe, where you can be yourself §              §City based offices with spaces that cater to a variety of working styles and needs §            §            §How to apply | §Me pēhea te tuku tono§            §            §If the above matches your skills and experience, click apply and upload your CV and cover letter. To view position description, paste this link https://bit.ly/2FxMbaYinto your browser. §            §Any questions that haven’t been answered in this advert or the position description or if you have difficulty with your application please email §jobs@stats.govt.nz§. §            §We will be screening applications as we receive them in order to move swiftly to interview shortly after the advert closes on Tuesday, 27 October 2020. §            §Note to Recruitment Agencies: unsolicited CVs will not be accepted. §            §You must have the right to live and work in Aotearoa New Zealand to apply for this job.§            §          §        §      §      §      §    §    §Make your career count!§ For further information about working at Stats NZ and a job description please visit our careers site.§      § careers.stats.govt.nz§    §  §§§§About Us | §Mō mātou§At Tatauranga Aotearoa, Stats NZ, our vision is to unleash the power of data to change lives.  As New Zealand’s official data and statistics agency, we are tasked with leading the way for New Zealand’s data future, enabling data-led innovation across society, the economy, and the environment.§  §The role | Mō te tūnga§  §Reporting to the Senior Manager Customer Experience, you’ll be instrumental in helping connect New Zealanders to data, enabling them gain maximum value from all that we produce.  You will take a lead role in the development of the strategy, design and implementation of Stats NZ’s approach to sharing and publishing data, statistics and other information. jobText: TXT/50765540.txt	§Asset Specialist, Biodiversity§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Asset Specialist, Biodiversity§§Advertiser: §Department of Conservation§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Asset Specialist, Biodiversity §        §          §An exciting opportunity has become available within our Asset Management Unit for an Asset Specialist to manage New Zealand's biodiversity resources. §          §The Department is blessed with a wide variety of built biodiversity assets that protect our flora and fauna - from boundary fencing, predator control fencing, bivouacs, aviaries, quarantine control buildings and accommodation facilities.  Don't miss the opportunity to help DOC manage these great assets.§          §This is a permanent, full-time role, location and working arrangements are flexible by negotiation outside of main centres.§          § §          §He angitūtanga: About the Role§          §The Asset Management Unit provides an effective and integrated asset management system across the Department's visitor, heritage and biodiversity assets.   The Asset Specialist plays a critical role in providing national asset management of our built biodiversity assets.  The role works closely with their national and regional planning colleagues around the country and the Biodiversity Unit.§          § §          §As one of four Asset Specialists, you will be a key member of the Asset Management Unit and the wider Operations Planning team.§          §In this role, you will:§          §            §Create and manage asset management plans in accordance with Departmental strategies, guidelines and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs)§            §Operationalise the national policies and standards developed by the Biodiversity unit§            §Provide asset management advice and support§            §Ensure national consistency across the management of assets§            §Support relevant internal and external stakeholders§            §Define, manage, oversee and monitor reporting requirements §            §Keep up to date with international industry developments§            §Provide national oversight and quality assurance of asset inventories§            §Work with the Asset Management team to improve Departmental asset management practice§            §Assist in asset management of other asset classes as needed§            §Organise and manage collection of asset inventory information§            §Undertake and organise asset valuations§            §Provide advice on departmental asset insurance matters§          §          §This is largely an office-based role; however, you will need to meet with teams in our national, regional and district locations on a regular basis.§          § §          §He kōrero mōu: What we are looking for§          §The ideal applicant will have Asset Management experience in a similar or local/national government infrastructure environment.  You will ideally understand contemporary asset management practice with the ability to apply messaging and advice to maximise our investment and minimise risk to biodiversity.§          § §          §The successful applicant will have:§          §            §Experience in the management of built biodiversity assets including aviaries, hatcheries and various types of predator proof fences§            §Understanding and experience in asset condition assessment and preparation of asset management plans§            §Understanding of levels of service, strategic goals, risk management, resiliency, criticality and life cycle management§            §Knowledge of, and experience in, implementing international best practice asset management standards§            §An understanding of conservation and how it relates to asset management§            §Experience in working proactively with stakeholders to achieve successful outcomes§            §Current full driving licence required§          §          § §          §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What's in it for you?§          §This is a great opportunity to join a large organisation that's still growing.  DOC has been undergoing a steady period of growth, and we highly value the new expertise and fresh perspectives being brought into the organisation.  This is your chance to contribute to our culture of continuous improvement.§          §We offer a fantastic supportive and collaborative working environment. Being the multiple award winner of the most attractive employer in the public sector (and second overall) with an average turnover beyond 10 years, we know people generally really enjoy working with us!§          § §          §Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory - this includes holding a valid work visa that covers the whole period of employment.§          §Please apply online via the DOC Careers Centre§ with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the requirements above. §          §For any enquiries, please contact Steve Ilkovics, §silkovics@doc.govt.nz§, ph 027 310 8191,§ quoting vacancy §400/99360.§          §Applications close at 5 pm on Monday, 2 November 2020.§          §DOC is committed to a diverse workforce that represents the communities we serve, and to creating an inclusive workplace culture. We offer a range of flexible working options depending on the needs of the role and its work context. §        §        §        §      §    §  §§§An exciting opportunity has become available within our Asset Management Unit for an Asset Specialist to manage New Zealand's biodiversity resources. §The Department is blessed with a wide variety of built biodiversity assets that protect our flora and fauna - from boundary fencing, predator control fencing, bivouacs, aviaries, quarantine control buildings and accommodation facilities.  Don't miss the opportunity to help DOC manage these great assets.§This is a permanent, full-time role, location and working arrangements are flexible by negotiation outside of main centres.§ §He angitūtanga: About the Role§The Asset Management Unit provides an effective and integrated asset management system across the Department's visitor, heritage and biodiversity assets.   The Asset Specialist plays a critical role in providing national asset management of our built biodiversity assets.  The role works closely with their national and regional planning colleagues around the country and the Biodiversity Unit.§ §As one of four Asset Specialists, you will be a key member of the Asset Management Unit and the wider Operations Planning team.§In this role, you will:§§Create and manage asset management plans in accordance with Departmental strategies, guidelines and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs)§Operationalise the national policies and standards developed by the Biodiversity unit§Provide asset management advice and support§Ensure national consistency across the management of assets§Support relevant internal and external stakeholders§Define, manage, oversee and monitor reporting requirements §Keep up to date with international industry developments§Provide national oversight and quality assurance of asset inventories§Work with the Asset Management team to improve Departmental asset management practice§Assist in asset management of other asset classes as needed§Organise and manage collection of asset inventory information§Undertake and organise asset valuations§Provide advice on departmental asset insurance matters§§This is largely an office-based role; however, you will need to meet with teams in our national, regional and district locations on a regular basis.§ §§He kōrero mōu: What we are looking for§The ideal applicant will have Asset Management experience in a similar or local/national government infrastructure environment.  You will ideally understand contemporary asset management practice with the ability to apply messaging and advice to maximise our investment and minimise risk to biodiversity.§ §The successful applicant will have:§§Experience in the management of built biodiversity assets including aviaries, hatcheries and various types of predator proof fences§Understanding and experience in asset condition assessment and preparation of asset management plans§Understanding of levels of service, strategic goals, risk management, resiliency, criticality and life cycle management§Knowledge of, and experience in, implementing international best practice asset management standards§An understanding of conservation and how it relates to asset management§Experience in working proactively with stakeholders to achieve successful outcomes§Current full driving licence required§§ §§Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What's in it for you?§This is a great opportunity to join a large organisation that's still growing.  DOC has been undergoing a steady period of growth, and we highly value the new expertise and fresh perspectives being brought into the organisation.  This is your chance to contribute to our culture of continuous improvement.§We offer a fantastic supportive and collaborative working environment. Being the multiple award winner of the most attractive employer in the public sector (and second overall) with an average turnover beyond 10 years, we know people generally really enjoy working with us!§ §Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory - this includes holding a valid work visa that covers the whole period of employment.§Please apply online via the DOC Careers Centre§ with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the requirements above. §For any enquiries, please contact Steve Ilkovics, §silkovics@doc.govt.nz§, ph 027 310 8191,§ quoting vacancy §400/99360.§§Applications close at 5 pm on Monday, 2 November 2020.§DOC is committed to a diverse workforce that represents the communities we serve, and to creating an inclusive workplace culture. We offer a range of flexible working options depending on the needs of the role and its work context. §§§§

in asset management of other asset classes as needed§Organise and manage collection of asset inventory information§Undertake and organise asset valuations§Provide advice on departmental asset insurance matters§§This is largely an office-based role; however, you will need to meet with teams in our national, regional and district locations on a regular basis.§ §§He kōrero mōu: What we are looking for§The ideal applicant will have Asset Management experience in a similar or local/national government infrastructure environment.  You will ideally understand contemporary asset management practice with the ability to apply messaging and advice to maximise our investment and minimise risk to biodiversity.§ §The successful applicant will have:§§Experience in the management of built biodiversity assets including aviaries, hatcheries and various types of predator proof fences§Understanding and experience in asset condition assessment and preparation of asset management plans§Understanding of levels of service, strategic goals, risk management, resiliency, criticality and life cycle management§Knowledge of, and experience in, implementing international best practice
