jobText: TXT/50769529.txt	§Technical Development Liaison§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Technical Development Liaison§§Advertiser: §Pan Pac Forest Products Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Oct 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Napier§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Other§§§§§§This is a new role accountable for facilitating communication with our Japanese shareholder and providing technical and capital project support to maximise future growth opportunities.§ §As a key member of the Strategic Business Development team you will contribute by co-ordinating and developing business plans, develop and maintain technical compliance requirements and ensure documentation requirements set by the shareholder are met for all business activities.§ §About the person§ §We're looking for someone who has excellent relationship management skills encompassing a comprehensive understanding of Japanese culture and business processes. Coupled with this you must have the ability to speak and write fluent Japanese.§ §You'll have proficient knowledge of Japanese business documentation and methodologies, especially those methods associated with effective communication of technically specialist aspects.§ §Successful applicants will demonstrate the following:§ § §Japanese translation and interpretation skills§ §Experience in presenting information in Japanese formats/logic§ §Japanese/manufacturing industry experience§ §Tertiary qualifications in business, accounting, industrial engineering, chemical engineering operations (or equivalent) preferred, we will also consider recent graduates§ §An understanding of both Japanese and NZ business culture is preferred§ §Strategic thinking capabilities§ §About Pan Pac§ §For over 45 years Pan Pac has been growing, processing and delivering quality radiata products to national and international markets. With a permanent workforce of over 400 staff, Pan Pac values the contributions of all employees and in return will provide a supportive and challenging work environment. Along with this, there are a range of benefits such as staff discounts on fuel and at local businesses in Hawkes Bay, free health checks and subsidised health insurance§ §If this sounds like you or someone you know, then we'd love to hear from you!§ §Only candidates who have the right to work or reside in New Zealand will be considered for this opportunity. With current border restrictions in New Zealand, we are unable to assist/consider international candidates at this time.§ § § §To apply for this job go to: panpacjobs.co.nz/Vacancies & enter ref code: 5251103. § §Applications close 30 October 2020§§§§

jobText: TXT/50765336.txt	§Senior Design Analyst - Questionnaire§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Design Analyst - Questionnaire§§Advertiser: §Stats NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Design Analyst - Questionnaire §      §        §          §            §We have an opportunity available in Wellington or Christchurch.§            §About Us | §Mō mātou §            §            §At Tatauranga Aotearoa, Stats NZ, our vision is to unleash the power of data to change lives.  As New Zealand’s official data and statistics agency, we are tasked with leading the way for New Zealand’s data future, enabling data-led innovation across society, the economy, and the environment. §            §The role | Mō te tūnga§            §            §The questionnaire design team within Data System Leadership is looking for a Senior Design Analyst to join our team.  The team is currently involved in a wide-ranging work programme, supporting the data system needs for social and business questionnaires. The ideal candidate will engage with our customers, develop solutions and build skills and capability within the team. We’re a friendly bunch with a supportive and collaborative team culture. We’re based in both Christchurch and Wellington.  In this role you'll have an opportunity to: §            §              §Build relationships internally and across the data system to support best practice methodology for questionnaire development. §              §Work with the DCD team to help build skills and knowledge in the team. §              §Identify and promote best practice in questionnaire development. §              §Work with other parts of the business. §            §            §Starting salary: $88,000 - $119,000 negotiable based on the successful candidate’s experience. §            §            §About you | §Mōu§            §            §The ideal applicant will have knowledge of qualitative and quantitative research techniques and experience in survey development and questionnaire design.  They will demonstrate strong relationship building skills, have experience engaging across government and an understanding of Stats NZ’s Government Chief Data Steward (GCDS) role within the data system.  We encourage you to apply for this role if you: §            §              §Have well developed interpersonal and relationship building skills in order to constructively engage with business units across Statistics New Zealand and across the data system. §              §Have experience in questionnaire design and qualitative/ quantitative research techniques.  §              §Knowledge/familiarity or a commitment to learn/understand Te Ao Maori, including ensuring opportunities at Stats NZ reach the Maori community. §              §Value collaboration and enjoy working as part of a team. §              §Have a passion for plain English, with excellent oral and written communication skills. §              §Are a fast learner with innovative solutions.§            §            §You’ll be joining an inclusive environment where people, regardless of gender, race, disability, religion or background are supported to be able to do their best work. This includes: §            §              §Opportunity to develop and grow your career §              §Balance with life and work commitments §              §An environment that’s safe, where you can be yourself §            §          §          §            §How to apply | §Me pēhea te tuku tono§            §If the above matches your skills and experience, click apply and upload your CV and cover letter. predator control fencing, bivouacs, aviaries, quarantine control buildings and accommodation facilities.  These assets contribute towards protecting our flora and fauna. §          §This is a assignments§Ensure national consistency across the Maintenance Planner network§Consolidate information to meet reporting requirements§Assist in the preparation of asset management plans for various asset classes as required§Assist in the preparation and update of Service Standards§Monitor international developments in asset management planning to inform work and improve Departmental best practice§Ensure physical works and professional service contracts reflect best practice performance measures§Identify Maintenance Planner training needs§§This is largely an office-based role; however, you will need to meet with teams in our national, regional and district locations on a regular basis.§ §§He kōrero mōu: What we are looking for§The ideal applicant will have Maintenance Planning and and minimise risk to biodiversity.§Experience and knowledge in the practice of asset management§Experience and understanding of asset maintenance and inspection systems and associated work planning and scheduling§Knowledge of, and experience in, implementing international asset management standards§Skills in working collaboratively with a range of people across initiatives§Experience in working proactively with stakeholders to achieve successful outcomes§Experience in the use and application Enterprise Asset Management (EAM) systems, particularly in Computerised Maintenance Management Systems (CMMS)§Current full drivers' licence§§ §§Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What's in it for you?§This is a great opportunity to join a large organisation that's still growing.  DOC has been jobTitle: Policy Analyst Job in Bay of Plenty - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50774498.txt	§Policy Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Policy Analyst§§Advertiser: §Zespri International Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§Zespri is more than simply the world’s single-largest marketer of kiwifruit. We like to think of ourselves as fruit on a mission and as rebels with a cause: to help people, communities and the environment around the world thrive through the goodness of kiwifruit.§ §We supply one of the world’s healthiest little superfruits to millions of people around the world in more than 50 markets. We are one of New Zealand’s best-known international brands, dedicated to creating sustainable long-term value for growers.§ §We are growing quickly, driven by our success in engaging more and more consumers and by offering the world’s best kiwifruit 12 months of the year. We have bold ambitions and aim to grow sales from approximately $3 billion in 2018 to $4.5 billion by 2025.§ § § § §Policy Analyst§ Reporting to the Regulatory Affairs Manager, this newly created position will provide Zespri with high-quality, objective analysis on policy issues affecting the kiwifruit industry and support Zespri’s reporting requirements under the Kiwifruit Export Regulations.  §   § This includes monitoring and analysing domestic policies and proposed legislative changes and their impact on the industry, as well as advising on how the industry should respond and contribute to the policy development process.§ While mostly focused on New Zealand, some work relates to Zespri’s markets and international growing locations.  §   § §Responsibilities:  § § §To support Zespri’s reporting requirements under the Kiwifruit Export Regulations  § §To support Zespri and the New Zealand kiwifruit industry with implementing key strategic priorities including reaching its challenging sustainability targets and contributing to the health of New Zealand’s fresh waterways  § §To analyse policies, upcoming legislation and relevant government outputs and advise on its impact on kiwifruit industry operations § §To inform the thinking of Zespri teams with regards to policy and legislative issues on areas including packaging, water, climate change, labour and agrichemicals  § §To provide briefings on relevant policy areas in New Zealand and overseas, including summaries on government announcements and major policy changes in key overseas markets  § §To consult with relevant Zespri teams on the development of policy responses  § §To monitor international trends and potential regulatory issues in key markets and growing locations which might impact on Zespri and the wider industry  § §Help develop briefings and key messages, as well as contribute to stakeholder and industry relations where appropriate  § §   § §Qualifications and Experience:§  § § §Relevant tertiary qualification § §A background in policy analysis and development, with a particular focus on New Zealand’s primary industries  § §Knowledge of legislative processes in New Zealand  § §Strong stakeholder management skills  § §Demonstrated project management skills  § § All applications should be submitted by §Friday 6th of November §§§§

jobText: TXT/50776504.txt	§Qualitative researcher - new or recent graduate§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Qualitative researcher - new or recent graduate§§Advertiser: §Scarlatti Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Salary§§$55,000 - $59,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§Summary§ § §Innovative and creative research, analytics and evaluation firm with a with a varied client base§ §Work on a wide range of research and evaluation projects that utilise your social research, problem-solving, communication and strategic thinking skills§ §Small team environment providing opportunities for learning and development§ §About Scarlatti§ §Scarlatti is a research, analytics and evaluation firm primarily serving organisations in New Zealand's primary industries, tertiary education and innovation sectors.§ §With offices in Auckland and Hamilton, we work with a diverse range of clients to help them gather and interpret data and information, identify trends, issues and opportunities, evaluate activities and report on progress against goals.§ §We are looking for a recent graduate to join our Hamilton team as a qualitative researcher. The role requires someone with proven analytical capabilities to support the wider project team develop innovative solutions for our clients. As the role is multi-faceted you will need to be dynamic and flexible in your abilities to meet the growing and changing needs of this innovative organisation.§ §About the role§ § §Working closely with other members of our team – including our project managers and analysts – as well as clients, you will be tasked with supporting the project team to analyse, evaluate and interpret research data and information, utilise your creative problem-solving skills and develop effective written documentation in the form of reports, literature reviews or other client communication§ §You will be given guidance and support from our senior staff but also plenty of flexibility to translate our company and customer needs into polished and professional deliverables§ §Full support will be given to help you develop your capabilities into new areas, but a willingness to learn will be essential.§ §About you§ § §An appropriate tertiary qualification such as in the field of Social Science, Evaluation, Education, Business, Economics, or another area where you have developed effective qualitative research and communication skills§ §Zero to two years work experience§ §Strong analytical skills, including data interpretation, numerical reasoning, critical thinking and problem solving§ §Ability to work on a variety of projects at once§ §A broad range of qualitative research skills, including data analysis, qualitative research, evaluation, with at least one area of specialisation§ §Good written English and the ability to communicate well with both colleagues and clients§ §Meticulous; a strong attention to detail§ §Self-starter who works cooperatively and positively in a small team environment, proactive and able to manage own workflow§ §Must have the right to work in New Zealand§ §What we offer§ § §Relaxed and flexible work environment with a strong team culture§ §Small office location in Hamilton§ §Salary range of $55,000 - $60, 000 (negotiable based on experience)§ §If this sounds like you, then please submit your CV along with your university transcript and cover letter to our team administrator at §deirdre.kirk@scarlatti.co.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50777322.txt	§Sustainability Intern§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Sustainability Intern§§Advertiser: §Fletcher Building Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Sustainability Intern §      §        §About us:§        §§        §          §The Fletcher Building family is a community made up of people who use all their experience, skills and individuality to do amazing work. We are listed on both the NZX and ASX and have over 34 businesses across New Zealand, Australia and the South Pacific. We are enriched by many different languages, customs and lifestyles.§          §          §Group Sustainability acts as a centre of excellence to provide high quality insights, guidance and advice on key strategic sustainability initiatives across the Group. The team works closely with our businesses and its people, and we are committed to investing in talent and enablers to deliver outstanding results in performance. Our immediate opportunity is to re-shape our organisation and create more capacity for innovation, sustainability, agility and customer connection. There has never been a more exciting time to join Fletcher Building. §          §          §About the Role§          §§          §We look forward to you joining the team at Fletcher Building as our new R&D Sustainability Intern. §          §          §Based at our Penrose Corporate head office, you will be reporting into our Group Innovation and Sustainability Team who work together towards the common goal of positioning Fletcher Building as the NZ and Australian leader in sustainable building materials, construction and distribution.§          §          §Throughout the 6-month duration of the internship you’ll work on a project focused on creating a circular economy for wood panels. The circular economy is based on three principles: design out waste, keep materials in use, and regenerate natural systems. It’s about product stewardship and having options for products when they reach the end of their life. §          §          §We’ve already identified several options to create a circular economy with wood panels by reusing, redesigning and remanufacturing wood panels but we need to know more. For the next stage of the project, we are looking for an intern who can support us with the following:§          §            §              §Collecting customer data, including phone conversations and possible visits. §              §Value Chain and waste stream mapping for the current market landscape within wood panel industry and FB businesses.§              §Researching solutions to reuse, redesign, and remanufacture wood panels.§              §Understanding how these solutions work and function for Fletcher Building and our wider supply chain. §              §Evaluating options and making recommendations on pathways for Fletcher Building to pursue from a sustainability and economic point of view, including quick wins to kickstart progress. §              §Developing plans for initial technical and/or feasibility trials.   §            §          §          §About You§          §§          §To be successful in this internship you must be a self – starter who can not only contribute collaboratively as part of a team but can independently take ownership of their work. You will have strong investigative skills and be comfortable liaising with people within Fletcher building and external companies to acquire research for the project. You’ll have a solid aptitude for understanding systems and have the capability to problem solve with an innovative approach. You’ll be a driven to ensure this project is carried to fruition and be able to creatively solve any challenges along the way.§          §          §The project is receiving funding from the Callaghan innovation in the form of an R&D grant. Therefore, to be the successful incumbent you must meet the following eligibility requirements:§          §            §              §Be about to complete, or have recently completed, a masters or PhD degree in science, technology, engineering, design or business i.e. have submitted a thesis for marking (or completed course requirement for taught masters) less than 12 months ago§              §Have undertaken the study at a New Zealand tertiary institution if you are not a New Zealand citizen §              §Not have been employed in the industry under a professional arrangement related to your area of study except temporary, part-time or at a tertiary organisation§              §Not have been previously employed at the business – unless this was short-term employment.§            §          §          §Click Apply now to showcase your skills and carve out a rewarding career path with the team at Fletcher Building. Alternatively, please forward your CV to Jessica Walker, E: §jess.walker@fbu.com§          §          §As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we strive to create an inclusive and zero harm environment for all our employees. We welcome applicants from diverse backgrounds to apply to any of our vacant positions. Talk to us about our flexible working arrangements and career pathways.§          §        §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§About us:§§§The Fletcher Building family is a community made up of people who use all their experience, skills and individuality to do amazing work. We are listed on both the NZX and ASX and have over 34 businesses across New Zealand, Australia and the South Pacific. We are enriched by many different languages, customs and lifestyles.§§Group Sustainability acts as a centre of excellence to provide high quality insights, guidance and advice on key strategic sustainability initiatives across the Group. The team works closely with our businesses and its people, and we are committed to investing in talent and enablers to deliver outstanding results in performance. Our immediate opportunity is to re-shape our organisation and create more capacity for innovation, sustainability, agility and customer connection. There has never been a more exciting time to join Fletcher Building. §§About the Role§§We look forward to you joining the team at Fletcher Building as our new R&D Sustainability Intern. §§Based at our Penrose Corporate head office, you will be reporting into our Group Innovation and Sustainability Team who work together towards the common goal of positioning Fletcher Building as the NZ and Australian leader in sustainable building materials, construction and distribution.§§Throughout the 6-month duration of the internship you’ll work on a project focused on creating a circular economy for wood panels. The circular economy is based on three principles: design out waste, keep materials in use, and regenerate natural systems. It’s about product stewardship and having options for products when they reach the end of their life. §§We’ve already identified several options to create a circular economy with wood panels by reusing, redesigning and remanufacturing wood panels but we need to know more. For the next stage of the project, we are looking for an intern who can support us with the following:§Collecting customer data, including phone conversations and possible visits. §Value Chain and waste stream mapping for the current market landscape within wood panel industry and FB businesses.§Researching solutions to reuse, redesign, and remanufacture wood panels.§Understanding how these solutions work and function for Fletcher Building and our wider supply chain. §Evaluating options and making recommendations on pathways for Fletcher Building to pursue from a sustainability and economic point of view, including quick wins to kickstart progress. §Developing plans for initial technical and/or feasibility trials.   §§About You§§To be successful in this internship you must be a self – starter who can not only contribute collaboratively as part of a team but can independently take ownership of their work. You will have strong investigative skills and be comfortable liaising with people within Fletcher building and external companies to acquire research for the project. You’ll have a solid aptitude for understanding systems and have the capability to problem solve with an innovative approach. You’ll be a driven to ensure this project is carried to fruition and be able to creatively solve any challenges along the way.§§The project is receiving funding from the Callaghan innovation in the form of an R&D grant. Therefore, to be the successful incumbent you must meet the following eligibility requirements:§Be about to complete, or have recently completed, a masters or PhD degree in science, technology, engineering, design or business i.e. have submitted a thesis for marking (or completed course requirement for taught masters) less than 12 months ago§Have undertaken the study at a New Zealand tertiary institution if you are not a New Zealand citizen §Not have been employed in the industry under a professional arrangement related to your area of study except temporary, part-time or at a tertiary organisation§Not have been previously employed at the business – unless this was short-term employment.§Click Apply now to showcase your skills and carve out a rewarding career path with the team at Fletcher Building. Alternatively, please forward your CV to Jessica Walker, E: §jess.walker@fbu.com§§As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we strive to create an inclusive and zero harm environment for all our employees. We welcome applicants from diverse backgrounds to apply to any of our vacant positions. Talk to us about our flexible working arrangements and career pathways.§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Principal Advisor Strategy and Performance Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50778826.txt	§Principal Advisor Strategy and Performance§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Principal Advisor Strategy and Performance§§Advertiser: §JacksonStone & Partners§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Strategy & Planning§§§§§§Lead the strategy function of MSD’s transformational strategy.§High-profile organisation.§Translate strategy into action.§§Manaaki tangata, Manaaki whānau§Ministry of Social Development (MSD) helps New Zealanders to be safe, strong and independent. It strives for New Zealanders to get the support they require, be resilient, live in inclusive and supportive communities, participate positively in society and reach their potential.§Te Pae Tawhiti – ‘Our Future’ - is MSD’s strategic direction. It sets out how MSD is going to bring about positive changes in the wellbeing of the people, whānau, families and communities it serves.§To make the biggest difference it can for New Zealanders, it is focusing on three areas:§Mana manaaki - is about looking after the dignity of people with warmth, listening, respect, compassion, openness and fairness.§Kotahitanga - is about unity and collective action, working together with whānau, families, hapū, iwi, providers, communities and other government agencies.§Kia takatū tātou - underpins the intention to prepare for future realities and take a long-term approach to community, regional and economic development.§The Organisational Planning, Performance and Governance (OPPG) unit will host and support the development of a business case and plans to ensure the continuation and progression of MSD’s future state work, to deliver to the intent of Te Pae Tawhiti.§The design of service model components has been progressed, but further work is needed to develop the service model, provide more detail on the broader future state to support portfolios, and advance specific business cases in relation to a commitment to further funding. §The Principal Advisor, Strategy and Performance will have the opportunity to lead the implementation function of Te Pae Tawhiti, Our Future strategy. Reporting to the General Manager OPPG, this role will provide high-level technical and thought leadership and best-practice specialist advice to help ensure the Ministry can develop and deliver its organisational strategy. The Principal Advisor will also ensure that the planning, reporting and accountability processes are well integrated and best practice. There will be a requirement to effectively engage across MSD’s internal and external stakeholders, including with Portfolio Leads. §As the Principal Advisor, you must have proven experience of operating at a senior level in a complex environment, leading organisational strategic and business planning processes. You will have a sound experience/understanding of the machinery of government, including processes such as annual budget cycle, government accountability, and public sector performance measurement. You will have a strong ability to engage well with stakeholders and be strategic in your thinking. Proven analytical skills and well-developed writing skills will be important. Having an appreciation of social services, and of te ao Māori, will also be expected.§ § §APPLICATIONS CLOSE:§ Wednesday, 4 November 2020§APPLY §OR VIEW THE POSITION DESCRIPTION§: § www.jacksonstone.co.nz§REFERENCE:§  7441§ §FURTHER ENQUIRIES:§ Simon Boyes or Helen Cox on §04 550 8000§§§§

jobText: TXT/50782055.txt	§Senior Insights Analyst Māori§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Insights Analyst Māori§§Advertiser: §Capital and Coast District Health Board§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§$90,000 - $99,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Insights Analyst Māori §      §        §Nau mai, haere mai ki Ūpoko ki te uru hauora.§        §Location: Wellington Regional Hospital§        §Contract: Permanent, Full Time§        §Salary:     $100,000.00§        §About the role§        §We have an exciting opportunity for a person that is passionate about Te Ao Māori and our Māori people’s health, you will be working alongside our Maori Health Development Group (MHDG) in delivering the Māori health strategy – Taurite Ora.§        §As the Senior Health Insights Analyst Māori, you will provide specialist skilled analyses and visualisations to support MHDG deliver the Māori health Strategy. CCDHB operates two hospitals – Wellington Regional Hospital in Newtown and Kenepuru Hospital in Porirua – as well as the Kapiti Health Centre at Paraparaumu. §        §The Mental Health, Addiction and Intellectual Disability Service (MHAIDS) spans three DHBs - Wairarapa, Hutt Valley and Capital and Coast DHB’s and includes local, regional, and national services. The local MHAIDS services are provided from multiple sites within the 3DHB sub-region – greater Wellington, Hutt Valley and Wairarapa. §        §Here at CCDHB we embrace diversity and welcome applications from people of all gender identities, ages, ethnicities, sexual orientations, disability and religions. jobText: TXT/50777580.txt	§Senior Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Analyst§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Justice§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§Senior Analyst (with a focus on data science), Sector Analysis and Modelling Sector Group National Office §§MOJ/1490071§ §Te āhuatunga a te tūranga/About the Role §Sector Group is a multi-disciplinary team that brings together the best of strategy, policy, data analysis, research and evaluation capabilities to inform decision making by justice agency leaders. We support justice agencies to work together to deliver ambitious results for a safe and just New Zealand.§ §Mō te tīma/About our Team At Tāhū o te Ture - the Ministry of Justice, we're committed to working together for a fair and safe Aotearoa.§Now is an exciting time for you to become a part of the Ministry of Justice in the Sector Group as the insights and advice we provide are highly sought after, our work is characterised by innovation, quality and impact, and we are informing the direction for justice agencies.§About the Role:§This is a sort after opportunity to take a senior role in an established and high performing team delivering outputs that drive investment in the Justice Sector. As a Senior Analyst, you will be responsible for developing and driving a work programme to build the evidence base for key decisions in the Justice Sector. However, this role has a focus on data science and provides the right candidate with the opportunity to develop and lead our use of advanced analytics.§ §He pūkenga tou/Skills and Experience§Your experience will demonstrate the ability to contribute across a range of analytical disciplines including, forecasting, modelling and advanced analytics. You will be good at managing large data sets and have experience in SAS and/or R. Most importantly you will be curious and motivated, keen to explore but ready to deliver.§You may be a talented young analyst looking for the next career step or an existing Senior Analyst looking for the chance to take more functional leadership. You will likely have a degree in a quantitative discipline such as mathematics, statistics or engineering. You will be pragmatic and agile, being able to move between action, and thought, orientation. You will have experience in a modelling environment and be both curious and proactive. Most importantly you will be able to demonstrate the ability to understand the context and work with sector stakeholders to deliver outputs supported by all the sector parties.§A permanent role in this team has not become available in quite some time, so don't miss out on this opportunity to bring your enthusiasm to this motivated team. Do you want to work in a place where data drives decision making, where evidence is required and not an optional afterthought? Are you looking to develop your career or just make a difference? Make your next opportunity your best opportunity by joining the Ministry of Justice's Sector Analysis and Modelling team.§Take your next step with us and:§• Step into a data science functional leadership role • Explore and extract value from vast amounts of linked data • Work across government agencies using data to tell compelling stories of change • Work with high performing colleagues in a sector with leaders that demand evidence • Develop your career • Contribute to a safe and just New Zealand.§A permanent role in this team has not become available in quite some time, so don't miss out on this opportunity to bring your enthusiasm to this motivated team.§Please contact Lyndsey Rothwell for more information on §Lyndsey.Rothwell@justice.govt.nz§You must have the right to live and work in New Zealand to apply for this role.§Joining the Ministry of Justice means you will become part of an inclusive organisation that values you and the communities we serve. It's our promise to ensure our workplace is one where our people feel healthy and safe, supported and able to be themselves at work. We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated.§ §Tono mai/How to Apply§To apply, click the Apply button below to be directed to our Careers Website. You can view a detailed position description here, as well as complete an online application form by attaching your CV and cover letter.§Applications close on Tuesday 27 October 2020§If you have any questions, please contact §recruitment@justice.govt.nz§ §§§§

jobText: TXT/50782863.txt	§Innovation Programme Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Innovation Programme Manager§§Advertiser: §Beca§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Innovation Programme Manager §      §        §§        §Innovation Programme Manager§ § §New Ventures Accelerator§ § We live in a world full of opportunities for transformation. Beca’s New Ventures Accelerator is a specialist innovation and entrepreneurship team focused on rapidly responding to scalable business opportunities by working with customers, start-ups and the investment community. We live and breathe innovation, entrepreneurship and business - taking risks and experimenting - via a highly structured, measurable and repeatable process that deploys Design Thinking, Lean Start-up and Agile methodologies. The influx of emerging technologies and complexity of information is accelerating the pace of change - and we're right there, alongside our customers, embracing the challenges.§ § §The opportunity§ § Innovation happens everywhere in Beca, and our New Ventures team are at the forefront of it. Our small lean team of opportunity hunters, disrupters and entrepreneurs are focused on the business side of the innovation spectrum. We have created and implemented a structured and repeatable innovation programme to accelerate the commercialisation of new products and services at Beca. We are looking for an Innovation Programme Manager to join our Auckland based team to impact the future of our business by bringing new revenue-generating ideas to life and amplify our culture of innovation and entrepreneurship.§ § Moving in an ever-changing environment there are many opportunities for hands-on leadership to assist in the development, planning and execution of various innovation activities. Overall, you will be responsible for:§ §        §          §Helping to maximise the number of ventures and innovation projects the team can handle by finding and delivering ways to create more efficient execution.§          §Focusing on the innovation pipeline, align the team and the greater business to provide visibility of status, progress and outcomes.§          §Driving the New Ventures Accelerator sprint process, engaging directly with venture teams to outline priorities, unblock hurdles and get tasks done.§          §Capturing, monitoring and evaluating progress and output of ventures and innovation projects, ensuring rigour is followed for development of the new business idea.§          §Facilitating stand-ups and other meetings to provide status updates, hold the team accountable to deadlines, prioritise actions, and keep stakeholders adequately informed.§          §Engaging across the innovation teams and the broader business to determine the most effective and efficient methods to achieve innovation results.§          §Engaging with external suppliers and partners to deliver on innovation projects.§          §Leading retrospectives to help ensure insights are captured and incorporated into future efforts.§          §Issuing regular team and stakeholder performance reporting to provide a clear and consistent global view of team objectives and deliverables, to articulate progress and value, and to share learning and best practice.§          §Working as part of the team to deliver a positive experience and ensure consistent, exceptional service at scale.§        §        §About you§ § You are curious with an entrepreneurial mindset, comfortable to move quickly and pivot if necessary. Experienced in agile project management or a scrum master. Design thinking skills, a plus. You are passionate about helping to create new businesses and envisioning new business models. With the natural ability to work with and influence a wide group of people across all levels of organisations, and be someone who embraces challenges and can take action even with faced with high degrees of ambiguity, promotes innovation and leads with a mindset of continual improvement. You’ve gained your experience working in environments with evolving processes or within start-ups, new product development or corporate innovation. You are known as highly detailed, an excellent communicator, problem-solver and critical-thinker with the ability to identify and remove barriers and enable teams to complete their objectives. You are enthusiastic about technology and how technology can accelerate growth.§ § §What we offer§ § A career with Beca will provide you with:§ §        §          §Professional development opportunities.§          §A supportive and caring work environment where you can bring your whole self to work.§          §Flexible working arrangements to balance your personal / family commitments.§          §Opportunities to learn from our industry experts and technical gurus across the Asia-Pacific.§          §Highly supportive environment of sharing and collaboration.§        §        §Beca prides itself on supporting a diverse and inclusive culture - open to inputs from creative people of all genders, ethnicity, identity, thought and experiences.§ § §Ready to make the move?§ § If you want to make everyday better, apply online today on the link below. If you have any questions, call Autumn English - Talent Acquisition Business Partner on + §64 9 336 5954§. Applications close 9 November 2020.§ § §About Beca§ § Beca is one of Asia Pacific's largest independent advisory, design and engineering consultancies. 2020 is a landmark year for Beca, representing both the dawn of a new decade and the beginning of our 2nd century. jobText: TXT/50783437.txt	§Senior Social Responsibility Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Social Responsibility Manager§§Advertiser: §Tribe (New Zealand) Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Corporate Development§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Social Responsibility Manager §      §        §§About the Role: §  § As Senior Social Responsibility Manager you will implement Lotto NZ’s CSR Strategy, with a focus on driving continuous improvement in Lotto NZ’s world-leading responsible gaming programme.§  § The environment within which Lotto NZ operates has evolved significantly, largely driven by advances in technology, and an increase in online play.  Providing a responsible gaming environment is central to Lotto NZ’s success– they cannot achieve their objective of maximising benefits for New Zealand communities if playing Lotto NZ games is causing undue harm. This is especially important during these uncertain economic times, and the cornerstone of Lotto NZ’s strategy is their commitment to minimising the risk associated with problem and underage gambling.  Here is where this role comes in…§  § Reporting to the Head of Communications and CSR, you will ensure Lotto NZ is meeting the objectives of its CSR Strategy:§  §          §Overseeing Lotto NZ’s approach to harm minimisation, ensuring Lotto NZ has a world leading responsible gaming programme.§          §Maintain industry certification through continuous improvement of the Responsible Gaming Programme – driving initiatives and policies across all functions of the business§          §Responsible for ‘Play Smart’ programme, including driving and executing on the communications strategy.§          §Drive Lotto NZ’s commitment to broader Corporate Social Responsibility, in relation to Lotto NZ’s impact from a Society and Sustainability perspective.§          §Oversee Lotto NZ’s Toitu “carbonreduce” programme, focused on reducing Lotto NZ’s greenhouse gas emissions.§          §Lead the development of meaningful metrics and effectively use data to identify opportunities to improve Lotto NZ’s Responsible Gaming & CSR Programme§        §  § This is a unique and exciting opportunity to be part of a busy, diverse and high performing team in one of New Zealand’s most well-known brands. This role offers a leadership opportunity with one direct report.§  §        §About You: §  § The successful candidate will have a strong project management/project planning background and be able to demonstrate exceptional proven ability to engage both internal and external stakeholders. You will be action oriented, motivated to own, lead and drive key initiatives and have excellent business writing skills. Experience working in CSR would be ideal (but not essential).§  § Key to this role is demonstrating your passion and commitment to doing the best by the business and players through setting standards when it comes to harm minimisation and CSR, coupled with a willingness to take the time to understand responsible gaming.§  §        §About the Company: §  § We all know Lotto NZ, a brand that has been around since the late 80s and most of us have dreamed about winning big!§  § Lotto NZ exists to provide safe gaming that allows New Zealanders to play and win while generating funding for the benefit of New Zealand communities. The funding created by Lotto NZ plays a critical role in building strong, sustainable communities and Lotto NZ are committed to providing a safe, secure and friendly gaming environment that encourages responsible play.§  §        §Apply Now!§        § §          §Here at Tribe, we are currently experiencing an incredibly high volume of applications and it may take us longer than usual to get back to you. It’s outside our normal service levels and we’re sorry for that.§  §          §In order for us to focus on servicing candidates and clients to the highest possible standards, we encourage all expressions of interest to be made via this advert. This will ensure your information reaches the correct consultant in a timely manner and we will respond to you as quickly as possible. Thanks so much for your patience during this time.§  § Chelsi Clifton +64 21 996 927  §  §          §To apply for this vacancy you MUST be a New Zealand citizen, resident, or have already secured the right to work in New Zealand and therefore hold a valid visa.§        §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§About the Role: § §As Senior Social Responsibility Manager you will implement Lotto NZ’s CSR Strategy, with a focus on driving continuous improvement in Lotto NZ’s world-leading responsible gaming programme.§ §The environment within which Lotto NZ operates has evolved significantly, largely driven by advances in technology, and an increase in online play.  Providing a responsible gaming environment is central to Lotto NZ’s success– they cannot achieve their objective of maximising benefits for New Zealand communities if playing Lotto NZ games is causing undue harm. jobText: TXT/50782044.txt	§Adoption and Change Management Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Adoption and Change Management Consultant§§Advertiser: §WM Reply Inc.§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§$100,000 - $120,000§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Management & Change Consulting§§§§§§Job Title: Adoption Change Management Consultant§Looking for are new challenge and want to take your career international?§WM Reply, a US based company, is opening are opening an office in Auckland and looking to bring in some key hires who are interested in working on leading edge M365 projects for some of the biggest companies in the world. You will be working on international projects with an initial focus on the USA.§Over the next 12 months the office is forecast to grow to a team of 20. If you're interested, then there will be a lot of opportunity to help shape the business, team culture and manage / mentor juniors. §WM Reply§ is looking for a motivated §Adoption Change Management (ACM) Consultant§.  We help enterprise clients launch and migrate to Microsoft 365 technologies with adoption change campaigns through end-to-end strategic planning, great design and inspired creativity. We are looking for someone who is flexible and willing to take on a wide spectrum of tasks in addition to change management projects. §This position is based in Auckland.§  §Qualifications§Outstanding executive presence and communications skills§University degree in Arts, Science, or similar field§3-5 years of experience in related role/field. §Experience with Microsoft Office 365, Power Platform SharePoint and/or digital transformation is a big plus. §Webinar/video production skills a plus. §Availability to travel as needed (up to 20%). §Prosci certification preferred.§End-to-end adoption change management strategy, planning and delivery §Communications and Training planning and content development and delivery §Client and stakeholder engagement §Presales/sales activities and deliverables §Marketing activities and deliverables§Webinar production and delivery §Project management for technical projects §Other tasks that emerge due to business need §Mentoring and coaching junior consultants §Salary range $100-$120k pending experience§Work from home: 2-3 days a week as desired§Office location: https://www.qbstudios.co.nz/locations/auckland/newmarket/ [link removed]§Required Experience§Change management, communications and/or training experience - you'll be working directly with clients, so collaborative interpersonal skills are a winner.§Ability to develop clear communications, dazzling presentations, titillating communication campaigns, and/or engaging training/learning content.§Ability to deliver workshops and training/learning sessions to varied stakeholder audiences. §Problem solver with analytical abilities who thinks in terms of developing solutions to drive adoption results. §User experience advocate who is convincing and persuasive in messaging to end users and target audiences about 'what's in it for me?’ §Delivery focused – our clients love us because we get stuff done. §Overachiever who loves creating things and delivering on time. §Ability to deliver and manage sales and marketing activities. §Ability to coach and mentor junior team members. §Professional and business-minded, but fun with a great sense of humor; confident in your creative ideas; willing to learn new things; and above all, good at what you do. §Ability to learn new technology quickly and to translate the benefits into training and communications. § §About Reply§Reply NZ is part of Reply Group, a leading consulting company, specializing in innovative solutions based on new cutting-edge technologies. With more than 8000 employees globally, Reply is a center of excellence in a variety of technologies and practices. Reply provides to leading industrial groups, both in Europe and North America, with effective support in terms of the definition and development of business models enabled by the new technology and communication-based paradigms, such as Social Networking, Cloud Computing and the Internet of Things, to optimize and integrate processes, applications and devices. §About WM Reply§WM Reply is part of the Reply Group and Microsoft consultancy. We work with leading enterprise clients building amazing Modern Workplaces and websites. There are always training and knowledge sharing sessions, both inside and outside of the Microsoft space.§WM Reply believes that engaged employees are better employees. We help clients introduce the latest technology and then connect their people through launch, change and adoption campaigns, great design, inspired copy and a dash of creativity.§We are extremely proud of our Microsoft Gold Partner status. We pride ourselves on a lively, dynamic and productive culture; combining Office 365 and SharePoint expertise, intelligent project management and a desire to have fun while we`re in the office.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§How many years' experience do you have in a consulting role?§How many years' experience do you have with change management?§§§

jobText: TXT/50784204.txt	§R&D Intern§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§R&D Intern§§Advertiser: §Fletcher Building Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Environment & Sustainability Consulting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §R&D Intern §      §        §          §About us:§          §          §            §The Fletcher Building family is a community made up of people who use all their experience, skills and individuality to do amazing work. We are listed on both the NZX and ASX and have over 34 businesses across New Zealand, Australia and the South Pacific. We are enriched by many different languages, customs and lifestyles.§            §            §Group Sustainability acts as a centre of excellence to provide high quality insights, guidance and advice on key strategic sustainability initiatives across the Group. The team works closely with our businesses and its people, and we are committed to investing in talent and enablers to deliver outstanding results in performance. Our immediate opportunity is to re-shape our organisation and create more capacity for innovation, sustainability, agility and customer connection. There has never been a more exciting time to join Fletcher Building. §            §            §About the Role§            §            §We look forward to you joining the team at Fletcher Building as our new R&D Sustainability Intern. §            §            §Based at our Penrose Corporate head office, you will be reporting into our Group Innovation and Sustainability Team who work together towards the common goal of positioning Fletcher Building as the NZ and Australian leader in sustainable building materials, construction and distribution.§            §            §Throughout the 6-month duration of the internship you’ll work on a project focused on creating a circular economy for wood panels. The circular economy is based on three principles: design out waste, keep materials in use, and regenerate natural systems. You’ll be a driven to ensure this project is carried to fruition and be able to creatively solve any challenges along the way.§            §            §The project is receiving funding from the Callaghan innovation in the form of an R&D grant. Therefore, to be the successful incumbent you must meet the following eligibility requirements:§            §              §                §Be about to complete, or have recently completed, a masters or PhD degree in science, technology, engineering, design or business i.e. have submitted a thesis for marking (or completed course requirement for taught masters) less than 12 months ago§                §Have undertaken the study at a New Zealand tertiary institution if you are not a New Zealand citizen §                §Not have been employed in the industry under a professional arrangement related to your area of study except temporary, part-time or at a tertiary organisation§                §Not have been previously employed at the business – unless this was short-term employment.§              §            §            §Click Apply now to showcase your skills and carve out a rewarding career path with the team at Fletcher Building. jobTitle: Senior Agile Business Analyst Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50787917.txt	§Senior Agile Business Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Agile Business Analyst§§Advertiser: §Land Information New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Agile Business Analyst §      §      §      §        §          §Do you have experience as a Senior Agile Business Analyst in a variety of projects and programmes?§          §Do you enjoy working in an innovative and fast-paced environment?§          §Be part of modernising our technology and services, and make a difference for New Zealanders§        §        § §        §At Land Information New Zealand (LINZ) we are focusing on the future by modernising our technology and the services we provide to remain connected, innovative, and flexible. §        §New Zealand currently ranks number one in the World Bank Doing Business rankings for registering property, but we want to be bolder. We are on a mission to help New Zealand retain and enhance its' world class property system and to meet the needs of the 21st century. We have initiated a long-term programme to rebuild Landonline, the system used to manage New Zealand's land information, and we are looking for people to join the team and make a valuable contribution to a programme of work that will have a positive impact across New Zealand. §        §Landonline is crucial to supporting the New Zealand way of life. There's no other way to buy land or a house in New Zealand, and it provides important information to be able to respond to emergencies, natural disasters and biosecurity concerns. We are looking for motivated people who are keen to share their knowledge in our diverse, agile team environment.§        §About the role:§        §The Senior Agile Business Analyst (BA) will spend much of their time looking at the big picture focusing on problem solving and addressing identified business needs, as well as exploring new opportunities.§        §A core member of the Agile Release Train (ART), the Senior BA will highlight solution considerations, risks, challenges, and dependencies ensuring the entire Train (business and build) is fully informed. They will support the estimation of work alongside guiding more complex analysis of need. They will proactively develop and maintain effective relationships / networks across key stakeholder areas.§        §About you:§        §We are looking for someone to hit the ground running and quickly leverage their excellent communication and business analysis skills to support the Train. You will also have:§        §          §Proven experience as a Senior Agile Business Analyst or similar§          §Strong business process analysis skills, with a focus on improving efficiency and effectiveness, including research, data collection and design §          §Demonstrated ability to identify, articulate, and address problems, business needs, and opportunities§          §Successful track record coaching and facilitating business and technical stakeholders, Product Managers, and Product Owners§          §Experience writing user stories, understanding benefits and value, estimation, facilitation and testing§          §Coaching experience helping people shift their mindset towards agile / lean approaches§          §Experience / knowledge of SAFe or other scaled agile approaches §          §Proven ability to build relationships with stakeholders across the business.§        §        §This is your opportunity to join us and make a meaningful contribution to the rebuild of Landonline and LINZ's wider transformation to deliver more value for New Zealand.§        §How to Apply§        §If this role sounds like an opportunity that would interest you, please click "Apply Online" now. We'd love to see your CV and Cover Letter reflect your relevant experience and specific examples of similar work you have done. You'll be taken to our LINZ Careers Page where you can complete your application form and upload a copy of your CV & Cover Letter.§        §If you have any questions about the role or about working at LINZ, please email §opportunities@linz.govt.nz§ and our Recruitment Team will be in touch with you.§        §Applications Close Thursday 5th November 2020§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Do you have experience as a Senior Agile Business Analyst in a variety of projects and programmes?§Do you enjoy working in an innovative and fast-paced environment?§Be part of modernising our technology and services, and make a difference for New Zealanders§§ §At Land Information New Zealand (LINZ) we are focusing on the future by modernising our technology and the services we provide to remain connected, innovative, and flexible. §New Zealand currently ranks number one in the World Bank Doing Business rankings for registering property, but we want to be bolder. We are on a mission to help New Zealand retain and enhance its' world class property system and to meet the needs of the 21st century. We have initiated a long-term programme to rebuild Landonline, the system used to manage New Zealand's land information, and we are looking for people to join the team and make a valuable contribution to a programme of work that will have a positive impact across New Zealand. §Landonline is crucial to supporting the New Zealand way of life. There's no other way to buy land or a house in New Zealand, and it provides important information to be able to respond to emergencies, natural disasters and biosecurity concerns. We are looking for motivated people who are keen to share their knowledge in our diverse, agile team environment.§About the role:§The Senior Agile Business Analyst (BA) will spend much of their time looking at the big picture focusing on problem solving and addressing identified business needs, as well as exploring new opportunities.§A core member of the Agile Release Train (ART), the Senior BA will highlight solution considerations, risks, challenges, and dependencies ensuring the entire Train (business and build) is fully informed. They will support the estimation of work alongside guiding more complex analysis of need. They will proactively develop and maintain effective relationships / networks across key stakeholder areas.§About you:§We are looking for someone to hit the ground running and quickly leverage their excellent communication and business analysis skills to support the Train. You will also have:§§Proven experience as a Senior Agile Business Analyst or similar§Strong business process analysis skills, with a focus on improving efficiency and effectiveness, including research, data collection and design §Demonstrated ability to identify, articulate, and address problems, business needs, and opportunities§Successful track record coaching and facilitating business and technical stakeholders, Product Managers, and Product Owners§Experience writing user stories, understanding benefits and value, estimation, facilitation and testing§Coaching experience helping people shift their mindset towards agile / lean approaches§Experience / knowledge of SAFe or other scaled agile approaches §Proven ability to build relationships with stakeholders across the business.§§This is your opportunity to join us and make a meaningful contribution to the rebuild of Landonline and LINZ's wider transformation to deliver more value for New Zealand.§§How to Apply§If this role sounds like an opportunity that would interest you, please click "Apply Online" now. We'd love to see your CV and Cover Letter reflect your relevant experience and specific examples of similar work you have done. You'll be taken to our LINZ Careers Page where you can complete your application form and upload a copy of your CV & Cover Letter.§If you have any questions about the role or about working at LINZ, please email §opportunities@linz.govt.nz§ and our Recruitment Team will be in touch with you.§Applications Close Thursday 5th November 2020§§§§

jobText: TXT/50782755.txt	§Senior Adviser Infrastructure – International Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Adviser Infrastructure – International Development§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Foreign Affairs & Trade§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Policy§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Senior Adviser Infrastructure – International Development §    §    §      §        §          §            §Senior Infrastructure Adviser - International Development§            §              §An exciting opportunity to apply your infrastructure expertise to New Zealand's aid investments in the Pacific and elsewhere§              §New Zealand has a large portfolio of infrastructure development activities in areas such as transport, water and sanitation, and public buildings§              §You will have a chance to shape and influence new and existing aid investments. As a Senior Adviser you will develop and lead complex initiatives, providing technical and strategically sound advice and sector leadership in infrastructure.§              §If you enjoy deploying your technical expertise and political acumen to support those with less technical backgrounds to deliver successful infrastructure projects, as well as directly manage some projects yourself, this role will be very rewarding.§            §            §Mō mātou - About us§            §Our people represent New Zealand on and offshore, and in doing so make New Zealanders safer and more prosperous. By building connections with and influencing other countries and international institutions, we advance New Zealand's interests and pursue New Zealand's values. We provide advice to the Government on the implications for New Zealand of what is happening in the world.§            §Kōrero mō te tūranga - About the role§            §This role is an opportunity to shape the design of, and drive the effective delivery of, our aid investments in infrastructure sectors. It involves working with a broad range of MFAT divisions and teams, suppliers, stakeholders and Partner Governments in developing countries.§            §You will be part of a team that provides high quality advice, and in some cases directly manages infrastructure projects. MFAT has invested in over 130 such activities during the last decade. The main focus is on transport, water and sanitation and public buildings though it is a varied portfolio that includes hospitals, education facilities, runways, wharfs, coastal protection, dam safety, recreation, tourism, and waste management.§            §The Infrastructure, Energy and Transport team sits within the Sustainable Development Sector and Thematic Division (DST) that in turn is part of the Pacific and Development Group at MFAT. The Division provides the sectoral and thematic expertise, analysis and advice needed to deliver high quality development cooperation. It is complex, fast-paced and involves engagement with multiple players across New Zealand and the Pacific.§            §Mā‎ wai te mahi nei?- Who are we looking for§            §We are looking for someone who is self-motivated, builds strong relationships, can develop and influence policy, and is interested in applying your expertise in a cross-cultural context and in support of achieving international development outcomes.§            §You will have strong technical expertise with a relevant qualification in engineering or a related field and experience in planning and management of infrastructure projects. Experience in the areas of Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) or building projects would be particularly beneficial. The role supports colleagues in MFAT with scoping, commissioning and managing infrastructure activities in the Pacific. Your direct responsibilities will also include the procurement, contract and financial aspects of managing infrastructure projects.§            §It is a role that requires strong collaboration and achieving success with and through others. You will be comfortable engaging with a large range of internal and external stakeholders, and representing the Ministry and New Zealand in your area of expertise.§            §Me pēhea te tuku tono - To Apply/Interested?§            §We want our people to reflect the diversity of New Zealand and the communities we represent - valuing and respecting the contributions of staff with diverse backgrounds, experiences, skills and perspectives. We value the transferable skills and points of view that both career and life experience bring to the table. As an employer we are committed to a focus on leadership, talent, training and development, and flexible work options.§            §If you bring an authentic view of New Zealand's place in the world, we'd love to hear from you! Apply today with your CV and cover letter!§            §For a confidential discussion please call Paul Alexander on 021 243 0685.§            §Applications close 9pm Wednesday 4 November 2020§          §          §          §        §      §    §  §§§Senior Infrastructure Adviser - International Development§An exciting opportunity to apply your infrastructure expertise to New Zealand's aid investments in the Pacific and elsewhere§New Zealand has a large portfolio of infrastructure development activities in areas such as transport, water and sanitation, and public buildings§You will have a chance to shape and influence new and existing aid investments. By building connections with and influencing other countries and international institutions, we advance New Zealand's interests and pursue New Zealand's values. We provide advice to the Government on the implications for New Zealand of what is happening in the world.§Kōrero mō te tūranga - About the role§This role is an opportunity to shape the design of, and drive the effective delivery of, our aid investments in infrastructure sectors. It involves working with a broad range of MFAT divisions and teams, suppliers, stakeholders and Partner Governments in developing countries.§You will be part of a team that provides high quality advice, and in some cases directly manages infrastructure projects. MFAT has invested in over 130 such activities during the last decade. The main focus is on transport, water and sanitation and public buildings though it is a varied portfolio that includes hospitals, education facilities, runways, wharfs, coastal protection, dam safety, recreation, tourism, and waste management.§The Infrastructure, Energy and Transport team sits within the Sustainable Development Sector and Thematic Division (DST) that in turn is part of the Pacific and Development Group at MFAT. The Division provides the sectoral and thematic expertise, analysis and advice needed to deliver high quality development cooperation. It is complex, fast-paced and involves engagement with multiple players across New Zealand and the Pacific.§Mā‎ wai te mahi nei?- Who are we looking for§We are looking for someone who is self-motivated, builds strong relationships, can develop and influence policy, and is interested in applying your expertise in a cross-cultural context and in support of achieving international development outcomes.§You will have strong technical expertise with a relevant qualification in engineering or a related field and experience in planning and management of infrastructure projects. Experience in the areas of Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) or building projects would be particularly beneficial. The role supports colleagues in MFAT with scoping, commissioning and managing infrastructure activities in the Pacific. Your direct responsibilities will also include the procurement, contract and financial aspects of managing infrastructure projects.§It is a role that requires strong collaboration and achieving success with and through others. You will be comfortable engaging with a large range of internal and external stakeholders, and representing the Ministry and New Zealand in your area of expertise.§Me pēhea te tuku tono - To Apply/Interested?§We want our people to reflect the diversity of New Zealand and the communities we represent - valuing and respecting the contributions of staff with diverse backgrounds, experiences, skills and perspectives. We value the transferable skills and points of view that both career and life experience bring to the table. As an employer we are committed to a focus on leadership, talent, training and development, and flexible work options.§If you bring an authentic view of New Zealand's place in the world, we'd love to hear from you!
