jobText: TXT/50783481.txt	§Senior Investment Analyst / Kaitātari Matua§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Investment Analyst / Kaitātari Matua§§Advertiser: §Greater Wellington§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Investment Analyst / Kaitātari Matua §    §    §      §      §      §      §        §With a clear steer from local and central government to grow public transport, it's an exciting time to be part of Greater Wellington's transport provider, Metlink.  There are some challenging growth targets we need to achieve to ensure public transport delivers a number of substantive social, economic and environmental benefits (including achieving Greater Wellington's carbon neutral ambitions)§        §At Greater Wellington we are currently seeking a full time Senior Investment Analyst to join the Metlink Strategy and Investment Team. Your insights and analysis will underpin all major projects and investment decisions, ensuring benefits are clearly identified and communicated.§        §About Greater Wellington and Metlink:§        §There's a lot more to us than meets the eye. Here at Greater Wellington Regional Council, we're working on the big things that will impact everyone in our region. Ensuring we have uninterrupted access to drinking water, staying safe from the threat of flooding, protecting and enhancing the environment, improving the quality of our fresh water, ensuring we are all connected through our public transport network and planning ahead for the potential impact of climate change across our region. We're people who are genuinely passionate about the work we do, because we believe what we do counts.§        §Every day we have thousands of people travelling with Metlink (across rail, bus, harbour ferry and Total Mobility) and every one of those journeys matters to us. Our role is to plan, develop, promote and deliver public transport services and supporting infrastructure in the Wellington region. Our goal is to be more than just a public transport service, we want to be a symbol of pride for the Wellington region, an integral part of what makes living in our region great.§        §About the role:§        §The Senior Investment Analyst will work as an integral part of the Metlink's Strategy and Investment team to provide robust investment analysis and advice on key Regional Public Transport investment decisions. The role will ensure all Metlink investment decisions maximise economic, social and environmental benefits while aligning to Greater Wellington's priorities and goals.    You will have a real opportunity to make a difference and shape the future of Wellington's regional public transport infrastructure.§        §While the role requires a strong investment analytics background, you will need to be able clearly present your analysis and insights to a number of stakeholders including Councillors and Central Government agencies. You will also help manage key funding relationships and systems with Waka Kotahi / NZTA . Your success in this role will be dependent on building strong relationships and being able to summarise complex information into ‘plain English' findings for a wide variety of audiences.§ §        §Skills and experience required:§        §          §Significant experience in undertaking economic and cost / benefit modelling preferably in a transport and / or  infrastructure investment environment§          §Superior analytical, evaluative, and problem solving skills, with a keen attention to detail§          §A proven track record of simplifying and clearly articulating / visualising complex decisions to non-technical audiences§          §Strong history of developing working relationships to effectively influence and communicate findings and recommendations.§          §Advanced excel skills with experience with working knowledge of key economic and financial metrics  (NPV, IRR etc).§          §Experience in Government investment policy / frameworks advantageous§          §An appropriate tertiary qualification, preferably in a commercial, financial or scientific discipline§        §        § §        §How to apply:§        §Click on the link to view the job description and to apply for the role with a cover letter and CV.§        §For further information, please contact Tim Shackleton at §tim.shackleton@gw.govt.nz§        §Applications close: §Thursday, 5 November 2020§        §Only people with the right to work in New Zealand may apply for this position. For advice on obtaining a New Zealand work or residence visa, please visit §www.immigration.govt.nz§      §    §    §      §      §    §    §Apply online at https://careers.gw.govt.nz§  §§§With a clear steer from local and central government to grow public transport, it's an exciting time to be part of Greater Wellington's transport provider, Metlink.  There are some challenging growth targets we need to achieve to ensure public transport delivers a number of substantive social, economic and environmental benefits (including achieving Greater Wellington's carbon neutral ambitions)§At Greater Wellington we are currently seeking a full time Senior Investment Analyst to join the Metlink Strategy and Investment Team. Your insights and analysis will underpin all major projects and investment decisions, ensuring benefits are clearly identified and communicated.§About Greater Wellington and Metlink:§There's a lot more to us than meets the eye. Here at Greater Wellington Regional Council, we're working on the big things that will impact everyone in our region. Ensuring we have uninterrupted access to drinking water, staying safe from the threat of flooding, protecting and enhancing the environment, improving the quality of our fresh water, ensuring we are all connected through our public transport network and planning ahead for the potential impact of climate change across our region. We're people who are genuinely passionate about the work we do, because we believe what we do counts.§Every day we have thousands of people travelling with Metlink (across rail, bus, harbour ferry and Total Mobility) and every one of those journeys matters to us. Our role is to plan, develop, promote and deliver public transport services and supporting infrastructure in the Wellington region. Our goal is to be more than just a public transport service, we want to be a symbol of pride for the Wellington region, an integral part of what makes living in our region great.§About the role:§The Senior Investment Analyst will work as an integral part of the Metlink's Strategy and Investment team to provide robust investment analysis and advice on key Regional Public Transport investment decisions. The role will ensure all Metlink investment decisions maximise economic, social and environmental benefits while aligning to Greater Wellington's priorities and goals.    You will have a real opportunity to make a difference and shape the future of Wellington's regional public transport infrastructure.§While the role requires a strong investment analytics background, you will need to be able clearly present your analysis and insights to a number of stakeholders including Councillors and Central Government agencies. You will also help manage key funding relationships and systems with Waka Kotahi / NZTA . Your success in this role will be dependent on building strong relationships and being able to summarise complex information into ‘plain English' findings for a wide variety of audiences.§ §§Skills and experience required:§§Significant experience in undertaking economic and cost / benefit modelling preferably in a transport and / or  infrastructure investment environment§Superior analytical, evaluative, and problem solving skills, with a keen attention to detail§A proven track record of simplifying and clearly articulating / visualising complex decisions to non-technical audiences§Strong history of developing working relationships to effectively influence and communicate findings and recommendations.§Advanced excel skills with experience with working knowledge of key economic and financial metrics  (NPV, IRR etc).§Experience in Government investment policy / frameworks advantageous§An appropriate tertiary qualification, preferably in a commercial, financial or scientific discipline§§ §How to apply:§Click on the link to view the job description and to apply for the role with a cover letter and CV.§For further information, please contact Tim Shackleton at §tim.shackleton@gw.govt.nz§§Applications close: §Thursday, 5 November 2020§Only people with the right to work in New Zealand may apply for this position. jobText: TXT/50783234.txt	§Senior Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Analyst§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Justice§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§Senior Analyst x 2, Sector Analysis and Modelling §§Sector Group, National Office §§MOJ/1490070A§ §Te āhuatunga a te tūranga/About the Role§Do you want to work in a place where data drives decision making, where evidence is required and not an optional afterthought? Are you looking to develop your career or just make a difference? Make your next opportunity your best opportunity by joining the Ministry of Justice's Sector Analysis and Modelling team.§This is a sort after opportunity to take a senior role in an established and high performing team delivering outputs that drive investment in the Justice Sector. As a Senior Analyst, you will be responsible for developing and driving a work programme to build the evidence base for key decisions in the Justice Sector. Your experience will demonstrate the ability to contribute across a range of analytical disciplines including, forecasting, modelling and advanced analytics. You will be good at managing large data sets and have experience in SAS and/or R. Justice Sector experience is a plus but not necessary. §You will be a Senior Analyst looking for a change with a degree in a quantitative discipline such as mathematics or statistics or you will be a high performing Analyst ready to take the next step in your career. You will be pragmatic and agile, being able to move been action, and thought, orientation. You will have experience in a modelling environment and be both curious and proactive. Most importantly you will be able to demonstrate the ability to understand the context and work with sector stakeholders to deliver outputs supported by all the Sector players.§A permanent role in this team has not become available in quite some time, so don't miss out on this opportunity to bring your experience to this enthusiastic and motivated team.§ §Mō te tīma/About our Team§§About the Sector Group:§Sector Group is a multi-disciplinary team that brings together the best of strategy, policy, data analysis, research and evaluation capabilities to inform decision making by justice agency leaders. We support justice agencies to work together to deliver ambitious results for a safe and just New Zealand.§Now is an exciting time for you to become a part of the Ministry of Justice in the Sector Group as the insights and advice we provide are highly sought after, our work is characterised by innovation, quality and impact, and we are informing the direction for justice agencies.§ §He pūkenga tou/Skills and Experience§Take your next step with us and:§• Build an intimate knowledge of world leading Integrated Data Infrastructure practices and methodology§• Work across agencies with connecting stories across the sector§• Work with high performing colleagues in a sector with leaders that demand evidence§• Develop your career§• Contribute to a safe and just New Zealand.§§Joining the Ministry of Justice means you will become part of an inclusive organisation that values you and the communities we serve. It's our promise to ensure our workplace is one where our people feel healthy and safe, supported and able to be themselves at work. We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated.§§ § §Tono mai/How to Apply§To apply, click the Apply button below to be directed to our Careers Website. You can view a detailed position description here, as well as complete an online application form by attaching your CV and cover letter.§Salary Range:  $99,413 to $116,956§Applications close Thursday 5 November 2020§Please contact Lyndsey Rothwell for more information on §Lyndsey.Rothwell@justice.govt.nz§You must have the right to live and work in New Zealand to apply for this role.§ §§§§

jobText: TXT/50785037.txt	§Senior Data Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Data Analyst§§Advertiser: §Maritime New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Consulting & Strategy§, §Analysts§§§§§§ §The Team §The Research, Analysis and Intelligence team leads, manages and oversees Maritime NZ’s intelligence and research programmes, data and analytics and geospatial capability. We seek an experience Senior to help us drive our data strategy, identifying patterns, trends and themes supporting Maritime NZ’s intelligence-led and risk focused approach. §We are well on our way to creating a well-connected and stream-lined data environment and have created this new Senior Data Analyst role to help get us there. We work with a diverse range of datasets from across our functional areas and reporting requirements. We are looking for an experienced Senior Analyst who has the capability to assimilate new information quickly and identify next steps regarding the quality, coding and classification required, as well as the systems, frameworks and processes to generate future analysis.  §As someone who is passionate about data you will thrive in an environment which offers a range of work including building and working with both bespoke and regular datasets.  You will enjoy sharing your expertise both within our team and with our wider organisation, presenting our data in interesting and engaging ways. §In this role, you will be responsible for:§Lead the collection, coding, classification and manipulation of data from various information systems;§  §Work with wider team to support intelligence assessments, business reporting and OIA requests; §  §Enhance both team and business data capability through mentoring and providing expert assistance;§What you’ll bring to this role §  §Previous experience working in a Senior Data Analyst role§  §Proven experience in developing logical coding and classification systems where these do not exist, or applying or modifying existing systems to make them fit for purpose.§  §Previous experience mentoring and developing analyst level roles.§  §Strong and effective communication skills including the ability to write clearly and succinctly and present work in a style which effectively leads and influences the target audience(s).§  §Forward thinking, mentally agile, flexible and innovative in approach, comfortable working with change.§  §Able to collaborate effectively across all of Maritime NZ and to develop and maintain good working relationships with key external partners or agencies. §  §Proven ability to improve data quality through systematic assessment, recommendations for improvement and implementation of recommendations.§  §Experience in designing, maintaining and improving databases.§At Maritime NZ we value our staff, our success as an organisation is underpinned by our people. §We are committed to building a diverse and motivated workforce. We think Maritime New Zealand is a great place to work and our staff are great people to work with.§Please apply on-line directly through the §Maritime NZ website§ by going to §Careers with Us§. Here you can upload your CV and cover letter. For tracking and evaluation purposes, all applications must be submitted via our on-line process.§For any other enquiries please contact Jo Attewell on §jo.attewell@maritimenz.govt.nz§. §Applications for this role close on §Wednesday 4th November 2020. § §Please note that you must have the legal right to live and work in New Zealand to be considered for this role. §For a copy of the Job Description visit §Senior-Data-Analyst-PD---October-2020.pdf§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§
